speaker: Marth
text: The blizzard has gotten worse. I can barely see anything in front of me... Kris, I think I can see somebody ahead. Is that...

speaker: Kris
text: Ah! Sire, please stay behind me. I feel the presence of enemies. Several are currently targeting us.

speaker: Marth
text: What!? But, we can't see anything like this. How should we fight back?

speaker: Kris
text: We've no choice but to directly engage the enemy. It will probably be a dangerous battle, unlike any we've faced previously.

speaker: Marth
text: Indeed. We should select those who'll fight with prudence.

speaker: Marth
text: Athena! What brings you here!?

speaker: Athena
text: Huff... huff... They are coming after you, Prince Marth. Ve vanted to varn you...

speaker: Marth
text: Ah! I see. So you wanted to help me... Thank you, Athena. It's fine now; I'll handle the rest. We'll defeat the enemy!

speaker: Clarisse
text: That wench... How dare she get in our way. If she hadn't spotted us, I could have shot the prince dead. Tsk! Oh well. As long as this blizzard carries on... This battle is mine. You can't see anything, can you? But we can. Now it's time for you to die, blind and blissfully ignorant.

speaker: Clarisse
text: You want to escape from this darkness? I'm afraid I won't let you. You won't see the sunlight ever again.

speaker: Clarisse
text: How... how dare you... I'll... I'll kill... anybody in my way... Just watch me... I'll kill... I'll kill you all!

speaker: Kris
text: Sire, we have routed the enemy.

speaker: Jagen
text: We have accomplished our objective. There is no need to remain here. Let us continue to the Ice Dragon Shrine.

speaker: Marth
text: Indeed. The sooner we meet Lord Gotoh, the better. Let's go.

speaker: Clarisse
text: Unh... Ugh... Lady... Eremiya... I'm... alone... once again...

speaker: Katarina
text: Clarisse...

speaker: Clarisse
text: R-Reese...! Why... are you here...? Don't tell me... You came here to laugh at pathetic old me?

speaker: Katarina
text: Come on, hold on to me. Let's return to the hideout, together.

speaker: Clarisse
text: Wha...?

speaker: Katarina
text: You can't walk around wounded like this. And you'll freeze to death if you don't find shelter soon.

speaker: Clarisse
text: Why...? Why would you... go so far to help me...! I've always treated... you like dirt and yet you...

speaker: Katarina
text: Because you're my little sister.

speaker: Clarisse
text: ...Pfft. You know I'm not your sister. We're both orphans, remember...? We've always been alone...

speaker: Katarina
text: But, we were raised together by Lady Eremiya... I don't mind if you hate me. But, I don't want to lose you... If I were to lose this one bond... I'd be alone in the dark, again... And the same goes for you.

speaker: Clarisse
text: ...Reese...

speaker: Katarina
text: Please, hold onto me.

speaker: Clarisse
text: B-bah... This will be the first and last time I'm gonna obey you, you hear me...?

speaker: Eremiya
text: ...Yes, I am aware of Altea's actions. We will begin the next phase of our plan. Your wish is our command, Master Gharnef...

speaker: Katarina
text: Lady Eremiya...!

speaker: Eremiya
text: Clarisse failed, didn't she?

speaker: Katarina
text: Y-yes... She's severely wounded... We need to have her treated!

speaker: Eremiya
text: Dispose of her.

speaker: Katarina
text: B-but, Lady Eremiya!

speaker: Eremiya
text: She's of no use to me wounded like this. Just leave her and she'll die by herself.

speaker: Clarisse
text: What's with that face...? It's natural... that I'd die if I failed... I knew... this would happen... but, but...

speaker: Katarina
text: Clarisse...

speaker: Clarisse
text: Go away. I don't want... you to see me like this.

speaker: Katarina
text: ...Very well.

speaker: Clarisse
text: ...... Reese... Wait... Don't go... I changed my mind... stay with me. I don't want... to be alone...

speaker: Katarina
text: Clarisse... I'm right here. I'll always be by your side. After all, I'm your big sister.

speaker: Clarisse
text: Bah! You have to be annoying, till the end... ...Sis... ter... ... ... ...

speaker: Katarina
text: ...Clarisse...

speaker: Jagen
text: Gra's army is renowned for its mighty armor knights and generals. The late king Jiol--our enemy in the last war--was a general himself.

speaker: Kris
text: I see. An army with strong defenses...

speaker: Jagen
text: In the past, yes. I hear that Gra's army now consists of new recruits. Hardly worthy enemies. Speaking of strong defenses, Kris...

speaker: Jagen
text: Your defense is truly overwhelming. Only a fool would dare approach you. Even Gra at it's prime could not compete with your defense. This battle has already been decided.

speaker: Jagen
text: Your defense is quite impressive. No man in Gra could match your defense. This battle has already been decided.

speaker: Jagen
text: Erm, your defense... could do with a little more work. This is quite worrisome. Kris, the enemies may be new recruits, but don't underestimate them.

speaker: Samson
text: Princess Sheena, it seems the Altean army has arrived.

speaker: Sheena
text: Really...? It's already the end. Samson, I have brought you much trouble. I need to watch the final days of my Kingdom of Gra. You may leave now.

speaker: Samson
text: Princess, isn't it already enough? Shouldn't you despise King Jiol for forcefully taking your mother? Isn't that why you hid at Millennium Court and stayed away from this country? Right now you are just being tricked by Hardin, and being used by him.

speaker: Sheena
text: Perhaps. I heard that the people of Gra wished for the restoration of the country, and that's why I agreed to help him. However Hardin is only interested in using us. He would just throw us away like rubbish the moment we became useless to him. Still, I will not leave! How can I just abandon those fighting for my sake!?

speaker: Samson
text: Impossible... How can our fresh recruits resist Altea's elites...? Fine, if you're staying, I will also stay to the end. This could be interesting.

speaker: Sheena
text: Samson... Why are you doing this? Aren't you mercenaries only interested in being paid with gold? I no longer have money to give you...

speaker: Samson
text: I don't know why either. It's just... Sometimes men feel like there are things that they must do. Also, I want to see how that kid fights this battle. If he truly is a hero, perhaps your mind may be changed...

speaker: Sheema
text: What...?! What have you done...? I believed you, Altea; I trusted you... How dare you... I'll kill all of you!

speaker: Samson
text: Prince Marth... How unfortunate. I thought you a better man.

speaker: Sheema
text: What...?! What have you done...? I believed you, Altea; I trusted you... How dare you... I'll kill all of you!

speaker: Old Man
text: Hardin sent troops here to prevent Gra from rebelling. The Archanea soldiers are the only ones that can still fight.

speaker: Woman
text: Princess Sheena is the child of King Jiol's second wife. But, she is different from the king. She is a very kind person. The princess is prepared to sacrifice her life for her soldiers. Is there no way to save her?

speaker: Woman
text: The soldiers here are all foreigners. There's nobody else to protect this country, because the knights of this country all died. Right now, the actions of the Archanea soldiers are deplorable. Their just the same as thieves... Those lowlifes!

speaker: Young Woman
text: Ah... Please leave me. I already have nothing to give you.

speaker: Marth
text: Ah, please don't get us wrong. We aren't here to steal.

speaker: Young Woman
text: But, didn't you all come here from Altea for revenge?

speaker: Marth
text: No, we don't want to fight Gra, because Gra and Altea were originally like one family.

speaker: Young Woman
text: Is that true...? Then, I will give my most important treasure... to... you

speaker: Marth
text: You are Princess Sheena? It's great to see you safe. I don't view Gra as an enemy. Gra and my country were originally one country. The country may have divided after Anri's death, but we always got on well as allies. But, in the previous war, I felt deeply regretful about things turning out the way they did. Princess Sheena, please allow us to be friends once again. I don't want to fight Gra.

speaker: Sheena
text: Prince Marth... Once I heard that you didn't attack my fleeing soldiers, I was really surprised. You truly are the second coming of King Anri. I trust you. Please... Treat the citizens of Gra... as if they were your citizens. I will hand my whole country to your care... Prince Marth.

speaker: Samson
text: That's great Sheena. Now I can finally leave without worry.

speaker: Sheena
text: Samson... Can you not leave...?

speaker: Samson
text: You don't need me anymore. From now on Prince Marth will protect you.

speaker: Sheena
text: Don't leave! I don't want you to leave...

speaker: Samson
text: Huh, what? Why keep me? It doesn't seem like you. ...Fine. If you say you need me, I won't go anywhere else. I will protect you wherever you may go. Is that fine with you?

speaker: Sheena
text: Yes...

speaker: Tomas
text: Prince Marth, I've been waiting for you. I'm Tomas, an Archanean soldier--or was. I've since retired from the army. The Archaneans here just want to sacrifice the defenceless Gra soldiers. This act of brutality by my former homeland... I cannot tolerate. Please, Prince Marth. Let me fight with you in some way.

speaker: Sheena
text: You... You dare treat my citizens like that... Die!

speaker: Sheena
text: Forgive me, citizens of Gra.

speaker: Samson
text: Prince Marth... I thought you were a noble person, but you're just a murderer... You disappoint me.*

speaker: Samson
text: Sheena...

speaker: Jagen
text: Sire, to keep fighting like this is pointless. All we are accomplishing is buying Hardin more time.

speaker: Marth
text: My thoughts exactly. If we continue like this, more blood will be spilt for naught. Kris, do you have any sort of plan?

speaker: Kris
text: According to our information, the enemy's primary force is concentrated along the highway. I wonder if we can avoid that route, by passing through the mountains?

speaker: Jagen
text: Hmph, we'd have to cross Adria Pass... But the steep mountains make it dangerous for an army of our size.

speaker: Kris
text: That's true, and I fear the enemy may have prepared an ambush as well. Our bravery could be our undoing. But it is the fastest possible route. If we could just break through there, we'd be in walking distance of the palace.

speaker: Marth
text: I am prepared for the danger. We managed to conquer the same perilous road that Anri walked. Compared to that... Jagen, Kris. We can overcome this challenge. Order the advance!

speaker: Frost
text: Oof... Seems I've finally caught up.

speaker: Kris
text: Hmm, and you are?

speaker: Frost
text: My name is Frost. I am a priest of Macedon. When Macedon was taken over by those warmonging rebels... You came and saved our country. Thanks to you, my family's now safe. I have come to return the favor.

speaker: Kris
text: I see. But hasn't it been some time since Prince Marth freed Macedon...?

speaker: Frost
text: Your army marched at speed and this old geezer just couldn't keep up. Eventually I lost sight of you... But then I heard that Marth had freed Altea as well, and I finally managed to catch up with you here, in Gra. I am old now, but I can still fight. Please, allow me to to join you.

speaker: Marth
text: Huh? Kris, what's with the hat?

speaker: Kris
text: This? Lord Wendell gave it to me so that my cold wouldn't get any worse.

speaker: Marth
text: From Lord Wendell, I see... Chiasmir Bridge has a strong sea wind, so it's good to have a hat to keep warm. It suits you, Kris.

speaker: Kris
text: Really? Thank you, sire.

speaker: Cain
text: Sire, you're safe! Kris! you too! You've guarded Prince Marth well.

speaker: Kris
text: Sir Cain! You made it!

speaker: Marth
text: I'm truly glad that you came back unharmed, Cain.

speaker: Cain
text: Yeah, somehow I managed to shake off the enemy and escape here. But the enemy is already approaching from the north.

speaker: Marth
text: Don't worry. We will crush them.

speaker: Cain
text: No, not this time. Hardin is being protected by a mysterious power: we can't lay a finger on him. So even if we fight him now, we haven't a chance of winning. Please, head to the northwestern fortress. There's a boat across the river, which we can use to escape to the Khadein desert.

speaker: Jagen
text: Sire, the free company to the south will probably make their move soon. Indeed, now's not the time to fight. For the time being, let's do as Cain suggests and make our escape. After that, we'll think of something...

speaker: Marth
text: I see... I don't like it, but we haven't a choice... Everyone, hurry to the northwest fortress!

speaker: Villager
text: If ya ask me, archers'll always get along well with archers.

speaker: Bantu
text: Oh look, if it isn't Prince Marth. Long time no see, Lad. It seems so noisy out; I wonder what's happened?

speaker: Marth
text: Ah, Bantu! Fancy meeting you in a place like this. How is Tiki?

speaker: Bantu
text: Oh, she is no longer by my side. Lord Gotoh took her to the Ice Dragon's Temple again.

speaker: Marth
text: The Ice Dragon's temple? Where's that? I've never heard of such a place...

speaker: Bantu
text: It's in the icy lands, far north of here. But it's no place for humans. Besides the hero Anri, no man has been there yet.

speaker: Marth
text: Anri?! Are you, perchance, referring to the "Realm of the Gods" from Anri's legends?

speaker: Bantu
text: I'm not at liberty to say anything more. If you want to know more, you should ask Lord Gotoh. Anyhow, I have a favor to ask of you. My precious firestone was stolen by thieves. If you can get it back for me, I'll show you how it works. Thank you, Prince Marth.

speaker: Hardin
text: ...Hasten the preparations of the troops within the fortress. I want Marth cornered like a rat...

speaker: Hardin
text: Heh heh heh... Prince, your struggle is in vain. But let us continue this game for a while. Just know that you're fast running out of time. Soon, I will kill you myself...

speaker: Hardin
text: Heh heh heh... Prince Marth, it's been far too long.

speaker: Marth
text: Hardin... Why did you attack our country? What would compel you to do such an act? I... I can't believe this. Have you really changed this much?

speaker: Hardin
text: Prince, I am the ruler of this continent and the Emperor of Archanea. I will show no quarter to anyone who opposes me. That includes you, Prince... I must destroy this foul world... It is beyond salvation. Traitors, playtime is over. You will all die here. All soldiers, attack! Do not leave a single traitor standing!

speaker: Caeda
text: Good day, sir.

speaker: Roger
text: Ack! You, y-you're... Caeda!

speaker: Caeda
text: Thank goodness, Roger. It's nice to see you again.

speaker: Roger
text: Uh... Uhm, you should know, I've no plans to betray Archanea. I was just thinking about that time when you asked me "do you believe in love?" But I'm different from who I was back then.

speaker: Ceada
text: Really? But you still seem like a nice man. That's why I wanted to speak with you again.

speaker: Roger
text: Uhh...

speaker: Caeda
text: May I just ask, why are you fighting for Archanea?

speaker: Roger
text: Be-because Archanea has already taken over the world. Resistance is futile: no one can win. My life is precious to me. If I side with whoever's stronger, then I'm guaranteed to live longer...

speaker: Caeda
text: I see.

speaker: Roger
text: A-are you disappointed with me?

speaker: Caeda
text: No, never. As I thought, you're fighting for what you believe in. You're not different. You're the same, kind man as when I first met you and I'm happy for that.

speaker: Roger
text: Uhhh... Wait- you're leaving?!

speaker: Caeda
text: Yes. I too must fight for what I believe in. But I'll make a request to Marth so that we don't have to fight you. I'm happy that we could talk again, Roger.

speaker: Roger
text: W-wait! ...As I thought, you're still very kind. Dare I say, we don't have girls quite like you back in Grust or Archanea. Um, perhaps... I suppose I could... Aw heck, I'm going with you again!

speaker: Marth
text: Wait, Sir Jeorge. I wish to speak with you.

speaker: Jeorge
text: Prince Marth... Please, lower your weapon. I don't want to fight you.

speaker: Marth
text: I know. As do I. You taught Gordin how to use a bow. And you were an instructor to the junior knights of Altea. You've been a great boon to Altea: I could never fight you, Sir Jeorge.

speaker: Jeorge
text: Prince... I pledge allegiance to Princess Nyna. But I can tolerate Hardin no longer... Taking other countries by force, executing "rebels" without reason...

speaker: Marth
text: ...Hardin was my friend. But he has changed beyond recognition. If he is committing any sort of crime, then I shall stop him. Jeorge, please, help me.

speaker: Jeorge
text: ...I understand, Prince. To return the kingdom of Archanea to what it was once before... I will take it upon myself to turn my bow against my homeland.

speaker: Gordin
text: Master! Please, wait!

speaker: Jeorge
text: Hm...? Gordin? Long time no see. You seem to have gotten a little sturdier, but has your bow arm improved any?

speaker: Gordin
text: Yes, at the moment, I... They call me Altea's master of bows. It's thanks to you, Master, that I've been able to progress this far.

speaker: Jeorge
text: And? Did you come here because you wanted to challenge your old teacher?

speaker: Gordin
text: N-no! It's not like that... ...I might be asking the impossible, but I'd like you to fight alongside us again, sir.

speaker: Gordin
text: Please! Master!!

speaker: Jeorge
text: I pledged allegiance to Princess Nyna, but as for Hardin... I've had it with him. Taking other countries by force, executing "rebels" without reason. The Archanean army I see now is just a collection of hired thugs. There's not even a shred of chivalry left. To return the kingdom of Archanea to what it was once before... I must take it upon myself to turn my bow against my homeland. Gordin. Convey that to Prince Marth.

speaker: Gordin
text: Thank you, Master!!

speaker: Roger
text: I don't want to fight you guys, but it's not as if I have a choice...

speaker: Roger
text: Ugh... I just wanted to meet her... once more... once more...

speaker: Astram
text: You traitors! I'll show you the might of Mercurius!!

speaker: Astram
text: Midia... My love...

speaker: Jeorge
text: You wouldn't have needed to die if you hadn't come so close, fools...

speaker: Jeorge
text: What fools...

speaker: Hardin
text: Rebel soldiers... Come to die, have you? I'll show you the terror of Gradivus!

speaker: Hardin
text: Prince Marth! I'll bury you with these very hands!

speaker: Hardin
text: Who are you? Your face is unknown to me.

speaker: Kris
text: Kris. I am Prince Marth's Royal Guard. Emperor Hardin of Archanea, the prince told me you were once a trusted friend. Why would you do something like this?

speaker: Hardin
text: Kris, is it...? What does it matter to you? You will die here regardless.

speaker: Hardin
text: Who are you? Your face is unknown to me.

speaker: Kris
text: Kris. I am Prince Marth's Royal Guard. Emperor Hardin of Archanea, I never knew you in the past. But I do know this: you are now the prince's enemy.

speaker: Hardin
text: You may come, Kris. But no one may even scratch me. You will soon know to fear... the power of the Darksphere...

speaker: Jagen
text: Please hurry, sire. The enemy is closing in on us.

speaker: Marth
text: But everyone is still fighting. I can't just leave them behind.

speaker: Kris
text: Worry not, sire. I will remain here. I will regroup with everyone later.

speaker: Marth
text: Kris! But...

speaker: Jagen
text: Sire, you of all people know that Kris is more than capable. As long as Kris is there, everyone will escape safely and reunite with you at once. Now sire, to the boat!

speaker: Kris
text: I will be the rear guard. Everyone, hurry up and escape! Lord Wendell, you too!

speaker: Kris
text: Oh, right. I just remembered. I should probably return this hat...

speaker: Kris
text: Oh, yeah. I just remembered. I should probably return this hat...

speaker: Wendell
text: I don't mind if you keep it for a little longer. Do you wish to give it back?

speaker: Kris
text: Yes. Thank you, it was most comfortable.

speaker: Wendell
text: No no, 'twas nothing. ...By the way, should I be hurrying too?

speaker: Kris
text: Erm... Yes, hurry up and escape!

speaker: Kris
text: No... If it's all right with you, I'd like to hold on to it a little longer.

speaker: Wendell
text: Yes, that would be splendid. ...By the way, should I be hurrying too?

speaker: Kris
text: Erm... Yes, hurry up and escape!

speaker: Marth
text: The war is, at long last, over. Thank you, my friends. My words cannot express my thanks...

speaker: Kris
text: Sire, you did it...

speaker: Luke
text: I did it! And thus marks the end of the Legend of the Knight Luke!

speaker: Rody
text: The war is over. I can return to my motherland at last.

speaker: Cecille
text: Prince Marth... Kris... Everyone...

speaker: Gordon
text: Prince Marth really did it! Now, peace will reign forever...

speaker: Ryan
text: W-we really did it...

speaker: Draug
text: I'm sure the people throughout the lands will be joyous.

speaker: Arran
text: My dream has been fulfilled... Now, I can go without regrets...

speaker: Malicia
text: Granny... We did it. We did it!

speaker: Catria
text: Prince Marth... I'm glad...

speaker: Warren
text: And now... back to my old life.

speaker: Cord
text: Time to celebrate our victory. I'mma go wild tonight!

speaker: Linde
text: Darkness may return time and time again... But the light will forever shine on.

speaker: Palla
text: It was a long war. But now, finally...

speaker: Bord
text: Jus' tonight, I'm gonna drink until I fall and then some!

speaker: Julian
text: It's over, at last...

speaker: Matthis
text: What? It's over? I'm not... dead?

speaker: Wrys
text: The most important thing is that peace has returned.

speaker: Ogma
text: The war is over. I must inform King Talys of the good news...

speaker: Yumina
text: Father, mother... It's finally over...

speaker: Yubello
text: Lorenz... I'll keep on working hard.

speaker: Castor
text: Mother, I'm comin' back soon.

speaker: Caeda
text: I'm glad... Marth is safe...

speaker: Barst
text: Yeah! Time to drink the night away for a change.

speaker: Rickard
text: Heh heh, I wonder how much treasure I can get my hands on?

speaker: Frey
text: Splendid battle, sire.

speaker: Norne
text: Was I of use, I wonder?

speaker: Samto
text: Oh yeah, now I'll become famous, too.

speaker: Wendell
text: Lord Gotoh... People have once again overcome their fate...

speaker: Caesar
text: Please hang in there. I'll be back soon, I promise...

speaker: Radd
text: We can save her now...

speaker: Navarre
text: Prince Marth... well done.

speaker: Feena
text: Shall I show everyone my victory dance?

speaker: Cain
text: A splendid battle, and a splendid victory!

speaker: Bantu
text: With the war past us, I shall watch over the world quietly...

speaker: Roger
text: New world, new encounters... Sounds good to me.

speaker: Jeorge
text: Now, Archanea will return to its former glory...

speaker: Minerva
text: Splendid work, Prince Marth. You've managed the feat that nobody else could have done...

speaker: Etzel
text: The era of war is over... The peaceful world she wanted will now come to fruition...

speaker: Merric
text: As long as Prince Marth and the others are around... No age of darkness threatens us.

speaker: Elrean
text: Alone, I couldn't possibly accomplish something like this. So this is the power of friendship...

speaker: Dice
text: Once I get my reward from the prince, I'mma gamble like no tomorrow.

speaker: Maris
text: Its over, it's really over. Y'know, I'm lookin' forward to my reward.

speaker: Horace
text: My people will surely be overjoyed...

speaker: Jake
text: Anna, we did it. I'll tell you all about it, later!

speaker: Darros
text: Well, whadya know? A hopeless guy like me was o' use to Prince Marth...

speaker: Robert
text: The people will be oppressed no longer.

speaker: Belf
text: General Camus, the Shadow Dragon has been vanquished. It's all over now.

speaker: Leiden
text: If only General Camus were here to see us... That's my only regret.

speaker: Beck
text: Well, I reckon it's time I start a new journey...

speaker: Athena
text: Ve von. Ve must thank every vun.

speaker: Xane
text: A world of men, huh? Well, I guess it ain't so bad...

speaker: Tiki
text: Yay! I'm so happy!

speaker: Est
text: It's finally over. Abel, I...

speaker: Dolph
text: This war may be over. But the battle for our motherland's true peace begins now.

speaker: Abel
text: The war is over at last. The days of peace and tranquility will soon return...

speaker: Macellan
text: Now, the people of Archanea need suffer no longer.

speaker: Astram
text: So I was mistaken... I must work to make amends.

speaker: Katarina
text: Prince Marth... Kris... I'm so happy...

speaker: Tomas
text: Archanea and Gra... will surely improve now... That's what I want to believe.

speaker: Sheema
text: My country's fate will finally change... You have my thanks, Prince Marth.

speaker: Samson
text: ...'Twas a good battle.

speaker: Frost
text: Now my family will finally be able to live in peace.

speaker: Roshea
text: Coyote... Did you see us...?

speaker: Vyland
text: I still have my doubts. But, it was better this way...

speaker: Sedgar
text: Coyote...

speaker: Midia
text: My nation has collapsed... But even so, I shall continue to live as a knight of Archanea.

speaker: Ymir
text: Marth is amazing. I worked hard, too.

speaker: Michalis
text: It was obvious we'd prevail. You had me on your side, after all.

speaker: Nagi
text: This is... good...

speaker: Lena
text: Julian... It was only because you were there that I could...

speaker: Maria
text: Michalis... Minerva... Can we be a happy family again...?

speaker: Nyna
text: Camus... you're...

speaker: Elice
text: Merric... Thank you...

speaker: Gotoh
text: Marth, brave prince of Altea. Thanks to your valiant efforts, Shadow Dragon Medeus has been completely obliterated. Medeus's servants--the earth dragons-- have once again returned to darkness. As long as the Binding Shield exists, they will never see the light again. Marth, the chosen Prince of Light, descendant of the hero Anri. You have not only saved mankind, but us dragonkin as well...

speaker: Tiki
text: Mar-Mar!! Does this mean I don't need to go back to the Ice Dragon Shrine anymore? I'm so happy! I love being with everyone, after all. I don't want to be all alone ever again. This is like... a dream come true. I'm so happy, so very happy. I love you, Mar-Mar!!

speaker: Malicia
text: Honestly, Tiki, for how long do you plan on hogging Prince Marth? Prince Marth looks like he's enjoying it too. Doesn't he worry that you might get mad, Princess Caeda?

speaker: Caeda
text: Please Malicia, you're so silly. But you're right, Marth looks happy...

speaker: Malicia
text: Who wouldn't? Especially after having a heavy burden lifted from their shoulders? Prince Marth has always been forced to carry such a heavy responsibility. It must have been hard on him. But Princess, you didn't have an easy time either, am I right? With everyone surrounding Marth day and night, you could seldom talk to him. You must have felt lonely.

speaker: Caeda
text: Yes I did... but it's alright. As long as Marth is safe, I have no other wish. You see, I prayed to God. When I found out Marth had been tasked with such an important mission, I asked for God to take my life, should Marth ever have to sacrifice his... That's all I could do for Marth.

speaker: Malicia
text: ...Sigh, I give up. There's no way I could compare to you, Princess. But, you'll have to wait no longer. Because your prince has finally come back to you. Look, Princess, he's looking over here. Be brave!

speaker: Caeda
text: Marth...

speaker: Marth
text: Caeda, it's finally over. I've made you suffer, too. Please accept my apologies.

speaker: Caeda
text: No, I'm the one who ought to apologize... I wasn't any help to you.

speaker: Marth
text: Don't be silly. I've only come this far because you were by my side, Caeda. And besides, the hard part begins now. The seven kingdoms of Archanea are to be unified. And everyone expects me to accept responsibility of the new kingdom. However, there's no way I could handle such a position by myself. Caeda, I want your assistance. I need you.

speaker: Caeda
text: Marth, let me tell you something... When I left Talys, I made a vow. I swore that I would go wherever you went, and that I'd trust you no matter what happened. So, no matter how painful the war was, I was able to endure. Because, Marth... I...

speaker: Jagen
text: Sire... You've done such a magnificent job. I'm speechless for words.

speaker: Arran
text: The fact I could devote my last moments to fight under Prince Marth's banner is my life's pride.

speaker: Cain
text: Truly! We're honored to be by the prince's side.

speaker: Abel
text: Yes. Even though I'm no knight now... fighting together with Prince Marth was my honor.

speaker: Elice
text: Marth... Please be happy from now on...

speaker: Draug
text: Seems we'll be busy from now on! All the kingdoms need to be rebuilt, so we have a mountain of work to do.

speaker: Frey
text: True. And yet, we can see hope in the eyes of all people.

speaker: Gordon
text: If we work hard now, we can turn the world onto the right path... That's what I truly believe.

speaker: Norne
text: I'm sure the people of this world have received that hope. Because of Prince Marth...

speaker: Ryan
text: W-we've won? It feels so unreal... Somebody pinch me--ouch!

speaker: Luke
text: Hey, you asked for it! But truly, our battles will be told as legends for generations to come!

speaker: Rody
text: Getting carried away, I see... But, I'm glad everyone from the 7th Platoon is safe.

speaker: Cecil
text: Yup. The fact we can laugh together as friends like this is what pleases me the most. And Katarina, that you includes you of course.

speaker: Katarina
text: Yes... I feel everyone's happiness as well. Kris...

speaker: Kris
text: Yes, we'll be together forever.

speaker: Wrys
text: The bonds of people are truly a wondrous sight, no matter your age.

speaker: Yubello
text: Ah, Sir Sirius? Where did he go? He was here until a moment ago...

speaker: Yumina
text: It's okay, Yubello. We must become stronger from here on. I'm sure Sirius wanted that, too...

speaker: Roger
text: I gotta return to Grust and work hard to rebuild my motherland. Say Malicia, you, er, wanna go back with me?

speaker: Malicia
text: Sorry, but this girl's taken. I have to look for my prince, after all!

speaker: Belf
text: Robert, Leiden. Let's move out.

speaker: Robert
text: Understood. We shall now become knights who protect the weak.

speaker: Leiden
text: That's what General Camus would have wanted us to do.

speaker: Minerva
text: Palla, Catria, Est. The war is finally over. You've done well.

speaker: Palla
text: Commander, your ideal world where all can live in peace... It may finally become a reality.

speaker: Catria
text: I agree. As long as Prince Marth is here, I'm sure it will...

speaker: Est
text: Oh, that's right. Let's all go to Altea. We must thank Prince Marth!

speaker: Maria
text: Ooh, I would love that! I want to see his dashingness too!

speaker: Matthis
text: Lena! I was worried about you. Tell me, did Julian make any distasteful advances on you?

speaker: Julian
text: Hey, and why would I do somethin' like that? C'mon, at a time like this...!

speaker: Lena
text: Teehee, I see you two have been getting along while I was away.

speaker: Rickard
text: Chief, don't you leave me behind! We vowed to stay together, didn't we?

speaker: Warren
text: ...I don't like the noise. But, I've discovered the worth of friendship. Thanks.

speaker: Caeda
text: Ogma, fellow Talysians. I must express my gratitude to you all for protecting Marth in my stead...

speaker: Cord
text: Princess, we'd go through hell and high water for you and yer husband.

speaker: Bord
text: Well, that and Ogma asked us to. Right, boss?

speaker: Ogma
text: Yeah. Bord, Cord, you did well. Barst, you helped a lot too.

speaker: Barst
text: It was nothin'. I just wanted to live my days in peace again.

speaker: Castor
text: It's time I return to me hometown. Thankfully, I've saved up a lot of gold.

speaker: Darros
text: I should try and earn money too, but by doing honest work instead.

speaker: Linde
text: Princess Nyna! Oh, Princess, I'm so glad you're safe...

speaker: Nyna
text: Linde... I apologize for making you worry.

speaker: Astram
text: Midia, I'm sorry. I was overtaken by anger and forgot what was most important.

speaker: Midia
text: You needn't apologize, Astram. Just don't ever leave my side again...

speaker: Jeorge
text: Good heavens, it seems we're in the way here. Sir Horace, where might you off to?

speaker: Horace
text: I must inform the people about the advent of peace.

speaker: Dolph
text: Macellan, I shall not return to the military.

speaker: Macellan
text: Yeah, we oughta try and rebuild Archanea as part of its people.

speaker: Tomas
text: I'm coming along too. For the people of Archanea...

speaker: Radd
text: It's over at last. Now, we can save her. Aren't you glad, Caesar?

speaker: Caesar
text: Of course. And I have you to thank, Radd.

speaker: Feena
text: W-Wait, Navarre! Where're you going? Don't forget me! Wait for meeee!

speaker: Samto
text: Navarre! I want to become your disciple. Wait for meee!

speaker: Jake
text: Well, s'bout time I went back to Anna. Beck, what're you going to do?

speaker: Beck
text: I was reckonin' about a new journey. Let us meet by Anna's shop again, someday.

speaker: Ymir
text: I'm goin' back to the village. Everyone is waitin' for me.

speaker: Athena
text: Ve... Ve finally repaid favor. This voman vill return to her country...

speaker: Frost
text: I'm heading back home to my family. You two are really close, aren't you? You kinda remind me of my family.

speaker: Dice
text: That we are. Oh yeah, this 'ole family talk reminds me: I can't stay gamblin' forever. Gotta find a man for mah hardworkin' gal. Right, Maris?

speaker: Maris
text: Quit yer nonsense, Pops! I don't want no man!

speaker: Wolf
text: ...So it's over.

speaker: Sedgar
text: Yeah. Everything is...

speaker: Roshea
text: Coyote, did we do the right thing...?

speaker: Vyland
text: No, Roshea. Never question yourself.

speaker: Wolf
text: That's right. We must continue to fight. To clear Coyote's name.

speaker: Wendell
text: At last, a world without war is born. Merric, Elrean, you both did well.

speaker: Elrean
text: Teacher! The words you spoke to me... I think I understand them now. I must apologize to Merric...

speaker: Merric
text: Elrean... No apology is needed; I'm your friend. Ever since the day we met.

speaker: Etzel
text: Seeing the bonds of people dissolving the conflicts between them... 'Tis a promising new world indeed.

speaker: Sheema
text: The war is over. Samson, will you... stay with me from now on?

speaker: Samson
text: Didn't I already give you my answer, Sheema? I'll go anywhere you wish.

speaker: Tiki
text: Ban-Ban! Let's go to the village together again. It's been so long, I wanna see everyone!

speaker: Bantu
text: Ooh, indeed. Once they see your smile, I'm sure they'll all be happy, too.

speaker: Xane
text: Those guys are so carefree. But I suppose I can start slacking off as well.

speaker: Nagi
text: Indeed. I, too, can finally... return to my eternal sleep...

speaker: Marth
text: Thank you, Kris. For protecting and supporting me. No amount of thanks would be enough. But, among the people, your deeds are being told as things I've done alone... That just will not do. Once we return to the castle, I'll...

speaker: Kris
text: If you allow me, sire... I have no need for a name. I don't want stories to be told of me.

speaker: Marth
text: Kris...?

speaker: Kris
text: Sire. With this war now over, a hero will be needed. A hero called Prince Marth. There are still hostilities between people who have fought for so long. Those won't disappear easily. In order to have everyone's agreement, a king everyone recognizes-- a godlike hero is needed. And that hero must be you, sire, and you alone.

speaker: Marth
text: But then, what you've done so far will be...

speaker: Kris
text: Even if the world doesn't know, you do, sire, and that's enough for me. I shall stay by your side. I shall be your shadow.

speaker: Marth
text: Kris... You're... ...Why, I wonder? Ever since we met, I felt a special connection with you. Fate sent you to me... I can't help but think that. Thank you, Kris. Please stay with me. Kris, you're my other half, my true friend...

speaker: Marth
text: Kris, just ahead is the Dark Pontifex, Gharnef--possibly the strongest sorcerer alive... or dead. Kris...

speaker: Marth
text: Your resistance to magic is impeccable. You might just be our strongest hope of defeating Gharnef. Yes. If you are there, then... we stand to win.

speaker: Kris
text: Sire... I'm honored. I'll give it my all!

speaker: Gharnef
text: So you've come, boy. How many times must you get in my way? Enough! I tire of our games!!

speaker: Marth
text: Gharnef, what have you done with my sister and the others?! Release them at once!

speaker: Gharnef
text: Heh heh heh... I've allowed them the honor of being sacrifices for the Shadow Dragon's resurrection. You will never see them again. Emperor Medeus will soon be reborn in his true and darkest form. And they will usher in a new era. 'Tis a pity. Their souls couldn't bear the suffering and shattered into pieces... Even I am powerless to help them. Shame, really. I have them to thank for the Shadow Dragon's awakening. Not even the Binding Shield can stop him now. I applaud you for coming this far. But... little prince... you will go no further. I will kill you here, and you will die knowing that you are nothing!!

speaker: Gharnef
text: Heh heh heh... Perhaps... a taste of Imhullu's might is necessary.

speaker: Gharnef
text: Heh heh... You're too late... The end is nigh...

speaker: Gharnef
text: Your blade is blunt before me, Marth... I'll smash you and the Binding Shield into pieces!!

speaker: Marth
text: I do not intend to fall here. Out of my way, Gharnef!

speaker: Gharnef
text: Heh heh heh... Allow me demonstrate Imhullu's might...

speaker: Kris
text: I will not let Prince Marth die. I won't...!

speaker: Gharnef
text: Heh heh heh... Allow me demonstrate Imhullu's might...

speaker: Kris
text: I will not let Prince Marth die. I won't let the likes of you lay even a finger on him...!

speaker: Kris
text: Sire, this way. More stairs!

speaker: Marth
text: This place... It's incredible... I feel as though I'm burning up just by standing here.

speaker: Xane
text: This is Flame Barrel... The fire dragons' graveyard. It's where the fire dragons who've degenerated into savage beasts come to wait for their death.

speaker: Marth
text: Degenerated, you say...? What do you mean by that?

speaker: Xane
text: I'm not sure if you're aware, but the dragon tribe is dyin'. Those who don't confine their true, dragon form in a stone eventually lose all reason and become monsters.

speaker: Marth
text: So that's why they become Manaketes? Xane, if you know something about the dragon tribe, please tell me.

speaker: Xane
text: If you really wanna know... Tens of thousands of years ago, the dragon tribe settled down on this continent, and created a civilization. They possessed intellect and abilities far exceedin' those of humans. But suddenly, outta nowhere, their day of destruction came. At first, they couldn't bear children. Then they began to lose their minds, goin' berserk one after the next. The elders warned that the end of dragons as a species was approachin'. There was no longer any way to prevent it. However, there was one way they could survive: to discard their identities as dragons and live on as humans. The dragons fell into a panic. Those who believed the elders sealed their forms within stones and became humans. But those who couldn't throw away their pride as a dragon; those who adamantly refused to become human... They eventually lost their minds and became naught but beasts...

speaker: Marth
text: Those fire dragons before us...

speaker: Xane
text: Yeah, they're a livin' example. And it's not just them. There are many others. But they've all gone feral now. There's no way for them to go back... Worse still, they've been manipulated and degraded like cattle by the fire clans who rule over this valley. Well, princey. Whadya say we get out of here? The clansmen around here ain't friendly; if we hang around, we'll end up as bait for their dragon pets.

speaker: Marth
text: Darros! What brings you here?! I thought you had washed your hands of your pirating days...

speaker: Darros
text: Prince Marth... Forgive me. I was lookin' t'start anew, but there be no place t'go for an outcast like me... To resume and continue these crimes; 'tis dishonorable indeed.

speaker: Marth
text: I see... Darros, you cannot stay here. Come with us.

speaker: Darros
text: Prince Marth... Ye would still accept a fool like me...? Prince, I... This time, I be changin' for sure. Me life is yours!

speaker: Darros
text: Please forgive me. I never wanted this.

speaker: Darros
text: Of course... 'Course I'd die... for what I've done...

speaker: Xane
text: Phew! And that be the end of the fire dragons' valley. How you doin', princey?

speaker: Marth
text: I'm fine... I think. Xane, I believe you said that there were other feral dragon tribes.

speaker: Xane
text: Yeah. In addition to this valley, there's the Wyvern's Dale, the Ice Dragon Shrine and the Dragon's Altar...

speaker: Marth
text: The Dragon's Altar?

speaker: Xane
text: It's a dragon graveyard in the mountains of Macedon. There, the earth dragons sleep. A long time ago... Thousands of years ago in fact... The mighty earth dragons lost their minds and attacked the humans. 'Course, the humans barely stood a chance. Most were annihilated, and the rest pushed into the desolate corners of the continent. And then... the divine dragon Naga, strongest of them all, waged a war for humanity. It was a fierce battle, but Naga emerged victorious in the end, and sealed the earth dragons below Dolhr, in a deep sleep. And so that the power of the seal would not wither, she created the "shield of the five orbs" and placed it in the Fane of Raman.

speaker: Marth
text: I see... I understand now. In other words, our guardian deity Naga depicted in legend was the divine dragon that saved humanity. But then, what about the divine sword Falchion?

speaker: Xane
text: Naga took pity on you humans, with no way of protecting yourselves, so she created it from one of her fangs. Then, together with the shield, she sealed it in the fane, and had the remainin' dragon houses watch over humanity. She put the newly born Tiki to sleep and thus ended her 5,000-year life. 'Cause of all this, Gotoh's tryin' his best to carry out Naga's order.

speaker: Marth
text: Wait, Xane... Are you telling me...!?

speaker: Xane
text: Yes: Gotoh is a divine dragon. And guess what? So am I.

speaker: Jagen
text: Blast... This heat is absurd. I wasn't sweating this much in the desert... I'm usually tolerant of heat, but this is simply unbearable... But Kris, you seem...

speaker: Jagen
text: You seem... unfazed. Are you not hot?

speaker: Kris
text: I have confidence in my strength. Sir Jagen, it seems that our companions are catching up to us. I'll go and carry them over here.

speaker: Jagen
text: What strength... It's as though you're invulnerable. Your reliability is astounding.

speaker: Kris
text: Yes, I've still some strength in me. Sir Jagen, it seems that our companions are catching up to us. I'll go and support them.

speaker: Jagen
text: Good. I'm depending on you.

speaker: Jagen
text: You seem a little dizzy... Are you holding out alright?

speaker: Kris
text: No... I-I'm... not doing so well... Still... If I could just use my strength... Oh no, I feel all weak...

speaker: Jagen
text: Kris, are you well?! Oomph, how troublesome... You'd best hold onto me.

speaker: Kris
text: I-I'm sorry...

speaker: Belf
text: Please pardon my sudden rudeness, but might you be Prince Marth?

speaker: Marth
text: Who are you...?

speaker: Belf
text: I am Belf, and these men here are Robert and Leiden. We rushed here because we wish to join your battle.

speaker: Robert
text: We were once knights of the Sable Order of Grust, but we have now separated from our homeland.

speaker: Leiden
text: We threw away our ranks as knights, and now live to protect those who are powerless.

speaker: Marth
text: The Sable Order of Grust... But in the previous war, we fought against the Sable Order as enemies. Despite that, you're willing to join our army?

speaker: Belf
text: Our general wished for us to protect the weak, regardless of nationality. He is gone now, so we would like to fulfill his final wish.

speaker: Marth
text: ............ I see. You seem to speak truly. Very well. I'd like you to fight alongside us.

speaker: Marth
text: Kris, may I have a moment? Wh-what in the blazes!? M-may I ask, what happened to your hair?

speaker: Kris
text: Father Wrys cut my hair for me. Is something wrong, sire?

speaker: Marth
text: He, uh, certainly did. Well, if you like it, then wonderful. ...... W-well then, let's begin the war council.

speaker: Kris
text: Yes, sire.

speaker: Ogma
text: Yuliya, Jubelo. This place is notorious for the Macedonian Vikings. If we could, we'd stay the hell away, but the village where Lord Wendell resides is just past this area.

speaker: Jubelo
text: Mister Ogma... I'm scared... Can we go back...?

speaker: Yuliya
text: Jubelo! Get a hold of yourself! You're a man, are you not? Show some spine! You can use a Fire tome, can't you? So... fight with it!

speaker: Jubelo
text: But Master Wendell said that we mustn't fight... Besides, I don't like fighting.

speaker: Yuliya
text: Ugh, stop complaining! It's just you and me now. You have to stay strong, because I... sniff... I don't know what we're supposed to do...

speaker: Jubelo
text: Oh... I'm sorry, Yuliya... I'll do my best, so... please don't cry!

speaker: Ogma
text: Damn... This can't be good... We've been spotted. Kids, we've got no choice; we're going to have to cut through. Do not leave my side!

speaker: Boy
text: D'you know of a staff called Rescue? I hear you can bring faraway allies right next to you in a flash! It'd be so cool if it were true!

speaker: Girl
text: Oh, those "Star Shards" are so shiny and pretty. If you hold on to them, something good might happen to you.

speaker: Villager
text: These days, all them bandits and pirates've been doin' as they please. Geez. This wouldn't 'ave 'appened if it weren't for all them political tomfoolery.

speaker: Villager
text: Oh, you're... you're... the prince of Altea! How nice of you to drop by, sir!

speaker: Marth
text: I heard Lord Wendell was living here.

speaker: Villager
text: Yes, that, er... was correct... Yesterday, a group of Archanean soldiers suddenly came and took the pontifex away. Although, Prince... He did leave his magic tome behind. I believe it's wind magic. Please, take it with you.

speaker: Marth
text: Well, if it isn't Castor! What brings you to a place like this?

speaker: Castor
text: Ah, Prince Marth! Erm... Actually, I need money for medicine for me sick mother. But I couldn't find any work in Talys, so I moved here instead.

speaker: Marth
text: I see... That's terrible... I do hope your mother gets better. Well, goodbye then...

speaker: Castor
text: ......... Wait!! Me mother, she's really sick... I need money, sir...

speaker: Marth
text: Hm? Oh right, here. It's only a little, but I hope it helps.

speaker: Castor
text: Uhm... Thank you, Prince Marth. You don't have to be so kind to a guy like me...

speaker: Marth
text: Castor... That's a bit much... It's only natural to help someone in need.

speaker: Castor
text: No, Prince Marth! You've done so much for me. I want to help you. Please, let me fight alongside you. You have my life at your disposal!!

speaker: Guile
text: Gahahaha! Won't be long now 'til my boys, hidden in the forts, all spring out 'n' attack. I can almost see the precious looks on their bewildered faces!

speaker: Ogma
text: And just who the hell are you? Are you in league with the pirates?

speaker: Sirius
text: I am Sirius, a mere traveler.

speaker: Ogma
text: Oh, I see. I'm a little bit worked up right now. Sorry about the mix-up.

speaker: Sirius
text: Those children...

speaker: Ogma
text: I'm taking care of them. Do you know them?

speaker: Sirius
text: No, I don't... But I do know that, as things stand, you won't escape with them. As I understand it, the Altean army should arrive here, provided you reach the southern village. Please, allow me to distract the bandits, while you make your escape to safety.

speaker: Ogma
text: I see. So Prince Marth is here, eh? Got it, thanks. I've got to ask though. Why help a group of complete strangers like us?

speaker: Sirius
text: I want to save the children. That is... all.

speaker: Ogma
text: I see... Sirius... You said your name was Sirius, right? Let's meet again after we both get out of here! There's someone I need to take care of... The guy in charge of Grust's occupation, Commander Lang. I want to avenge a man named Lorenz... You--join me...! If I've got you on my side, then I'll be that much stronger.

speaker: Sirius
text: Yes... That would be interesting. But first, you have to survive. Hurry and go!

speaker: Sirius
text: Touch me and I'll strike you down.

speaker: Sirius
text: How foolish of me...

speaker: Guile
text: I'm sorry! ...I wasn't thinking! Gahaha, just kidding! I'll be smashing your pretty head in!!

speaker: Guile
text: I won't... forget this!

speaker: Caeda
text: Marth!!

speaker: Marth
text: Caeda? Did something happen? Why are you here?

speaker: Caeda
text: Marth... Altea... Altea was attacked by the imperial army. The Archanean League... Gra and Aurelis ambushed us. Our forces were annihilated and we lost the castle...

speaker: Marth
text: Wh-what did you say?! This can't be happening! Altea is...

speaker: Kris
text: Damn! Our homeland has fallen to the enemy...

speaker: Jagen
text: This is terrible beyond words... That which I feared the most has come to pass. Emperor Hardin likely heard Lang's story, and had us branded traitors.

speaker: Marth
text: I refuse to believe it. Hardin would never attack Altea! You're telling me that he believed Lang and truly thought that I wished to instigate a rebellion? Never!

speaker: Jagen
text: No, I agree with you, sire. This attack was too soon. It happened far too quickly. For an attack of this scale, a great number of preparations had to have been in place. It is likely... that the Grust campaign was a setup. As was the situation in Macedon. It's quite simple, really. They had you leave Altea, with your elite knights in tow, and then proceeded to attack our weakened defenses. Hardin had this planned right from the start.

speaker: Marth
text: That's preposterous! Are you implying that Hardin--with no provocation whatsoever--decided to attack his fellow nation? Are you seriously suggesting this was all an elaborate trap? No! I won't accept it... Hardin... why?

speaker: Jagen
text: Sire... Princess Caeda, what of the others? Is Princess Elice safe?

speaker: Caeda
text: Elice, she... She gave herself up in order to let me escape with this message. Marth... I'm so sorry. She wanted me to warn you, no matter what... Sniff...

speaker: Marth
text: Caeda... Don't cry. I understand. Just knowing you're safe makes me happy. I should be the one apologizing. I shouldn't have left... You needn't have to go through this. We will take back Altea. Even if we have to fight Hardin, we WILL reclaim our homeland!

speaker: Jagen
text: Oh, by the way, Kris. About that hairstyle of yours... Have you decided to keep it that way?

speaker: Kris
text: ...Do you think it looks funny? Well, it'll grow back eventually, if I leave it alone... Do you think I should return it to normal?

speaker: Jagen
text: Well, it's your decision to make. You should do as you please. So what will it be? Are you going to go back to the hairstyle you had before?

speaker: Kris
text: Yeah. I'll have to apologize to Father Wrys later, but I think I'll change it back to normal.

speaker: Jagen
text: Yes. I do believe that would be a good idea.

speaker: Kris
text: No, it's alright. I'm quite fond of my new hair... Or lack of it, rather.

speaker: Jagen
text: I-is that so? Well, if that's your wish, then I can hardly complain.

speaker: Kris
text: Hah! Hyah!

speaker: Jagen
text: I see you train without the need for sleep. Most admirable, Kris.

speaker: Kris
text: Ah, Sir Jagen.

speaker: Jagen
text: A strong offense and a tough defense are obviously important, but... You cannot afford to neglect your skill. Without the skill to deliver it, it matters not how mighty your attack is if it does not reach the enemy. Speaking of which...

speaker: Jagen
text: Your skill is like that of an expert... I have nothing to add. Keep up the good work.

speaker: Kris
text: Thank you, Sir Jagen.

speaker: Jagen
text: Your skill is not bad. Don't fall behind the other knights. The experience you gain from training and combat, will help elevate your skill further. Be ever diligent.

speaker: Kris
text: Yes, Sir Jagen.

speaker: Jagen
text: Your skill is still insufficient... It ought to be better than this. You may or may not have the talent for it, but don't give up... The more experience you gain from training and combat, the more you can refine your skill. Be ever diligent.

speaker: Kris
text: Y-yes, Sir Jagen.

speaker: Palla
text: Julian, good news! Catria finally brought the Altean army for us! We're going to join their ranks to help save Princess Minerva. Please take Lena and escape to safety, quickly!

speaker: Julian
text: No can do, Palla. Lena's disappeared... I'm not leaving by myself.

speaker: Palla
text: What? Lena as well... Princess Maria is missing too; why is it only clerics...?

speaker: Julian
text: Anyway, I'm staying in the village to see if I can't find any information. Sorry, Palla. Give my best to Prince Marth.

speaker: Villager
text: This is just between you and me, but I heard that armory is in league with the rebels. If you're going to enter you should be careful not to get jumped.

speaker: Villager
text: I wonder what's going to happen to Macedon? They say that Prince Michalis is dead, and Princess Maria is nowhere to be found... On top of that, they say that Princess Minerva has been captured and that her life is in peril. I just hope... that this country doesn't end up like Grust...

speaker: Villager
text: You know, a little while ago, a paladin came here; said he was on a journey. He was wearing a mask, but I'm sure that underneath, he was a good person. He was kind, yet wrapped in a veil of sorrow. I wonder if I'll ever see him again...

speaker: Villager
text: The pegasus knight trio must be lonely without Est. And I was such a fan of their "Triangle Attack!" too... Oh, Est... Come home already, will ya?

speaker: Villager
text: Have you noticed the large drawbridge behind this village? Normally it's separated by the river, but if you use this key here, you can cross the bridge. Just, once you cross the drawbridge, the enemies on the other side will come and attack you at once. If you want to advance safely, you might be better off taking the long detour that goes right around the mountain. Here, take the key. No matter which path you take, do take care of yourself, m'kay?

speaker: Marth
text: You, you're Bord! You've come to Macedon as well?

speaker: Bord
text: Long time no see, Prince. Cord already joined with you's guys, right? We Talysian mercenaries wanted to join you's army, so we came all the way here. Princess Caeda's our lady, and the guy who's gonna be her man is important to us too. Prince Marth, I'll protect you with my life.

speaker: Julian
text: Hey, Prince, it's been a while, hasn't it? It's me, Julian!

speaker: Marth
text: Julian? I'd heard that you'd gone to Macedon with Lena, but to think we'd cross paths here... How is Lena? Of course, she's with you, right?

speaker: Julian
text: Well, er, how should I say this... Lena suddenly up and vanished... I... I don't know what to do.

speaker: Marth
text: Wait, Julian, tell me what happened, in detail.

speaker: Julian
text: Lena's been missing since last night. The villagers speak of some sort of strange priest prowling around lately. It seems that somehow, Lena was taken by this man.

speaker: Marth
text: A priest...? Julian, as it turns out, Princess Maria has gone missing as well. I have a terrible feeling about this. Anyway, staying here won't solve anything. Come with us. I'm worried for Lena, too. We'll all help to look for her.

speaker: Julian
text: Prince Marth... Thank you. Nothing would please me more.

speaker: Michalis
text: Rucke, I'm impressed a spineless coward like you could throw this country into so much chaos. I'll hazard a guess that Hardin talked you into this?

speaker: Rucke
text: Wha-! ...Y-you're... B-but how...

speaker: Michalis
text: Thought I was dead? Haha... My death was but a trifle. Hand Minerva over to me, Rucke. I no longer have plans for this country. Do with it as you please. However, I won't rest until I've disposed of "him" with my own hands.

speaker: Rucke
text: U-uhh... but, Princess Minerva is barely breathing... Nobody could save her now...

speaker: Michalis
text: Do you want me to shove this spear down your throat? I said bring her to me.

speaker: Rucke
text: Y-yes, of course. S-somebody, bring the princess here!

speaker: Michalis
text: It's been a while, Minerva. That ungainly appearance doesn't suit you. Losing Maria; your subordinates abandoning you... Is this the ideal country you dreamed of?

speaker: Minerva
text: Mi... Michalis... How...?

speaker: Julian
text: Hey! Cut it out. Why must you always insist on pointing your sword at us? I pity Lena for having to put up with your stupidity.

speaker: Matthis
text: Oh, it's you, Julian. Are you still trying to worm your way into Lena's good books? No way, I won't hand my cute lil' sister to a thieving rat like you.

speaker: Julian
text: You can relax... Lena and I would never work out. But even if it's just a little, I wanted to help her in any way I could.

speaker: Matthis
text: Ooh, you finally realized where you stand. Attaboy, Julian!

speaker: Julian
text: Er, that's not the kind of thing I want to be hearing from you... Well, whatever. If you're worried about Lena, then come with me.

speaker: Matthis
text: Oh, alright, thanks. You see, they forced me to join the rebel army, but you know I hate fighting. Alright, lil' brother. Let's join forces and look for our cute lil' Lena!

speaker: Matthis
text: Lena... Where are you? What I would give to hear your voice just once before I die...

speaker: Matthis
text: Lena... F-forgive... your foolish big brother...

speaker: Rucke
text: D-damn it... Why is the Altean army here...? You're all going down with me. Die!

speaker: Rucke
text: The Altean knights... As I expected...

speaker: Jagen
text: Sire, the rebels have fled the castle, but I regret to inform you that Princess Minerva was nowhere to be found.

speaker: Marth
text: What could have happened? She was supposed to be held inside the castle...

speaker: Lang
text: Oh-hoh, I knew this task was unworthy. Excellent work, Prince Marth. We'll take care of Macedon from here. Now, let us discuss your next mission.

speaker: Marth
text: General Lang, what in the world do you want this time?

speaker: Lang
text: Well, you see... My castle was attacked and the Grustian prince and princess were kidnapped. The perpatrator fled to Macedon, it seems. Prince Marth, you are to capture him and return the children to me!

speaker: Marth
text: You're asking me to send those children to their doom!

speaker: Lang
text: You're in no position to defy me. Now, off to work you go, my prince.

speaker: Kris
text: You...! Your rudeness towards my liege has gone too far...! Shut up! Prince Marth is not your minion!

speaker: Lang
text: What did you say?! Know your place, Altean soldier! Marth, it seems that your countrymen are devoid of manners!

speaker: Marth
text: ...I apologize on his/her behalf. But it is as Kris says: General Lang, I will no longer follow your orders from here.

speaker: Kris
text: Sire...!

speaker: Lang
text: What! Do you mean to defy my orders?! I see... I see. As I suspected, it was YOUR doing. The person who kidnapped Grust's prince and princess was the mercenary, Ogma. On your orders, no less!

speaker: Marth
text: I didn't know of this. But if I had the choice, I would have done exactly as you suggested. Back at Grust, even though they were meant to be our enemies, I should have helped those children.

speaker: Lang
text: You! You clearly speak words of treason! Perhaps I should report this to the Emperor!

speaker: Marth
text: Do as you will. But you're not the only person who intends to visit the palace. I will speak to Emperor Hardin and Princess Nyna and inform them of your crimes. Forgive me, Jagen. But I cannot stand for this any longer.

speaker: Jagen
text: I understand. You have endured well until now. Lang, my liege might forgive your frequent rudeness to him, but I will not. Come, draw your sword. Even though I, Jagen, am old and senile, I will not lose to the likes of you.

speaker: Lang
text: Wh... what did you say?! Damn you... I'll remember this!! Once the Emperor gets wind of this, I'll crush your puny little Altea!

speaker: Marth
text: Jagen... you're a bag of surprises. To think you'd stand up against Lang like that.

speaker: Jagen
text: Sire, are you underestimating me in my old age? Bwahaha... I'm not about to let youngsters like Kris hog all the glory just yet. Still, I'll admit it was somewhat foolish to contest with Lang, even if he did push my lord at every turn.

speaker: Kris
text: Sire, Sir Jagen. What is our next plan of action?

speaker: Marth
text: According to Lang, Ogma is on his way to Macedon. He probably intends to visit the village where Lord Wendell resides.

speaker: Kris
text: Lord Wendell?

speaker: Marth
text: Lord Wendell is a pontifex of Khadein; he fought as our ally in the last war. I hear he's living in Macedon now. It also happens that the children that Ogma saved were raised by Lord Wendell So I'm sure it would be the perfect time to pay him a visit.

speaker: Kris
text: Yes, understood.

speaker: Jagen
text: But, I worry about Lang... I pray that nothing bad shall happen...

speaker: Jagen
text: Kris, are you aware that we've been searching for the assassins who besieged Altea a year ago...?

speaker: Kris
text: Ah! I assume, since you're mentioning it, that you've found a new lead?

speaker: Jagen
text: We're not certain, but we've received information that might lead us to them. A few days ago, I heard of a suspicious group heading towards Macedon's northern mountains.

speaker: Marth
text: The northern mountains? What could they be after up there?

speaker: Jagen
text: Rumors say they are pursuing our former allies in the War of Shadows... And I don't believe they're after a friendly chat with them either.

speaker: Marth
text: I see. Then we cannot ignore this lead, especially if lives are at stake. Jagen, Kris, we shall pursue the enemy.

speaker: Jagen
text: Agreed. Let us prepare to march, with haste.

speaker: Marth
text: ...... That's, uh, certainly one heck of a hat... A gift from Ymir, I presume?

speaker: Kris
text: Yes. It keeps me warm. Although I'm worried that it'll stand out...

speaker: Marth
text: I should be, if I were you. If you stepped out on the battlefield wearing that, you'd be a popular target...

speaker: Gotoh
text: Prince Marth, in this altar lurks many savage barbarians and mage dragons long gone mad. They have fallen under Gharnef's spell and will attack you given the chance. Gharnef's servants-- the heretic priests possess great power. They are not to be taken lightly. If you let this battle drag on, it may become fiercer than you can handle. Do not stop. Make for the end at once! Once you defeat Gharnef, retrieve the Falchion that he stole from your Altea. As you well know, without the Falchion, defeating Medeus will be nigh impossible...

speaker: Marth
text: I understand, Lord Gotoh. My friends and I shall sally forth to the deepest depths of the altar!

speaker: Gotoh
text: It would be wise to bring this ally with you. She has deigned to lend you her strength.

speaker: Marth
text: You're...

speaker: Kris
text: Another ally from the previous war, sire?

speaker: Marth
text: No, I don't believe we've ever met. But, why...? I have the strangest feeling that I know her...

speaker: Nagi
text: My name... is Nagi. I will... stop the enemy... You must hurry to the throne room... Go... This time... everything... must end......

speaker: Kris
text: Sire! Look, stairs! They probably lead further in. We must hurry, sire!

speaker: Marth
text: Right, Kris! ...By the way, do you intend to wear that hat from here on out?

speaker: Kris
text: Actually, I'm not entirely sure. It's very warm, as Sir Ymir said, but I stick out like a sore thumb...

speaker: Marth
text: Indeed, the enemies looked surprised. Well, what is your decision? Are you going to take it off?

speaker: Kris
text: Yes, I think I will remove it for this battle.

speaker: Marth
text: Excellent choice. Well, let's hurry!

speaker: Kris
text: No, I rather like it. It's so toasty.

speaker: Marth
text: I-I see. Well then, let's go!

speaker: Marth
text: As expected, the Archanean army is extremely powerful. We must approach with great caution.

speaker: Kris
text: It seems that Hardin has assembled his entire army for the battle.

speaker: Jagen
text: Even so, the people have lost their faith in Emperor Hardin. They welcome us as liberators. It is certainly very reassuring. This is our final battle. It may drag on but all the same, I would ask that you take utmost care.

speaker: Marth
text: Kris, the enemy is the Archanean imperial army. The continent's strongest and most renowned military force. It's strange, but I'm not afraid. Kris, if you're here, then everything will be okay. Everyone, let's go!

speaker: Marth
text: As expected, the Archanean army is extremely powerful. We must approach with great caution.

speaker: Kris
text: It seems that Hardin has assembled his entire army for the battle.

speaker: Jagen
text: Even so, the people have lost their faith in Emperor Hardin. They welcome us as liberators. It is certainly very reassuring. This is our final battle. It may drag on but all the same, I would ask that you take utmost care.

speaker: Marth
text: Kris, the enemy is the Archanean imperial army. The continent's strongest and most renowned military force. I'm not worried though... I know how strong you are, Kris. You won't lose to anyone.

speaker: Kris
text: Yes, sire! Please leave it to me!

speaker: Marth
text: Everyone, let's go!

speaker: Vyland
text: I knew it. You intend to invade Coyote's palace. The king forbade us from interfering... But I will do anything to protect Coyote! I'll defy his edict if I have to!

speaker: Roshea
text: Prince Marth... It is I, Roshea of the Wolfguard. I received King Aurelis's pardon and have been waiting for you. I am truly sorry for the battle of the pass. I realize that an apology means little, so I will now fight under your banner. But... the other Wolfguard members have all sided with the Archanean army. I wonder if I could persuade them. Vyland, at the least... Vyland might listen to what I have to say.

speaker: Woman
text: Emperor Hardin was once a kind man, but he suddenly changed into such a frightening Emperor... Ah... If I say things like this, I will get killed as well.

speaker: Young Man
text: Midia is the pride of Archanea. She was the daughter of th highest officer of Archanea, Duke Owen. This rebellion only came about because she could not stand and watch us suffer. No matter what, you must rescue her.

speaker: Young Woman
text: We thought that Nyna and Hardin's marriage would finally bring peace to the world, yet this happened. Oh deities... What should we do...?

speaker: Old Man
text: Midia is really pitiful. She only just retired as a knight to live together with Astram, and now she has been separated again. She's still a young girl, it's so sad. What can you do to help her...?

speaker: Man
text: The Archanea army has changed. The troops are all bloodthirsty savages now. What is going on with this country?

speaker: Old Man
text: Oh, this is so sad. Those that opposed Emperor Hardin have all been killed... Could the Emperor be possessed by a demon...?

speaker: Roshea
text: Vyland! Why are you here? The king told us not to interfere. Aha! Have you decided to join the Altean army like me?

speaker: Vyland
text: Roshea, I came to bring you back. Why have you turned to the Alteans? We are Coyote's subordinates. Open your eyes! You're being deceived!

speaker: Roshea
text: You're wrong, Vyland. The time I spent with the Alteans was short, but I know one thing for sure. It's not as Coyote says. They're not evil people.

speaker: Vyland
text: Roshea...

speaker: Roshea
text: Vyland, please. I don't want to fight all of you. Especially you, Vyland...

speaker: Vyland
text: ............ Well, Roshea... You were always the kindest out of us in the Wolfguard.. You've always been able to tell which were the good guys, and which were the bad. I can't fight you, Roshea. If you, our brother-in-arms, are this sure, then I believe you. I am your ally from now on.

speaker: Roshea
text: Vyland...!

speaker: Vyland
text: Sedgar, hold on. It's me, Vyland.

speaker: Sedgar
text: What's the meaning of this, Vyland? Don't tell me you've defected!?

speaker: Vyland
text: Listen, Sedgar. I--I don't know. What am I supposed to do? I loved Coyote like a brother. All I wanted was to fight for him. But... But he has changed for the worse. It's as though he's someone else now...

speaker: Vyland
text: I wanted to serve him, always. That's why I've been turning a blind eye. I shut myself, trying to remember the Coyote who loved us so long ago. It really hurt to face the truth. That Coyote's not who he used to be... I just don't know anymore. Hey, Sedgar... What the hell am I supposed to do?

speaker: Sedgar
text: Vyland... I too... I feel the same way. I know he's gone insane, but I looked the other way and blocked my senses. One day, he'll go back to being our Coyote... That's what I kept telling myself.

speaker: Vyland
text: Roshea has gone over to the Alteans. I cannot fight him. Sedgar, you should come too. I don't know what's right anymore. But I don't want to fight you, either.

speaker: Sedgar
text: Yes... Even though Coyote's madness was clear to me, I did nothing. I have to make this right.

speaker: Sedgar
text: Wolf! Hold your fire!

speaker: Wolf
text: Sedgar! What are you doing?! So you've chosen to betray Coyote?!

speaker: Sedgar
text: No, it's not like that! This is for Coyote's own good! Something's wrong with Coyote. Even you must know that!

speaker: Wolf
text: That changes nothing! I will die at Coyote's side! I swore as much! Though all of you might betray us. Though I might be alone. I will not abandon him!

speaker: Sedgar
text: Even though you disobey his heart?

speaker: Wolf
text: What do you mean!?

speaker: Sedgar
text: Wolf, do you remember what Coyote said to you, the day you became commander of the Wolfguard?

speaker: Sedgar
text: If I should wander from the path of the righteous, please... lead me back onto it. That's what he said.

speaker: Wolf
text: I should never have forgotten. The words of Coyote himself... But, to tell me that time has come... That we must... That we must defeat Coyote...

speaker: Sedgar
text: We have to remind Coyote of the day we swore allegiance to him. No matter how painful it may be... That is our only recourse. I never wanted to believe it would come to this...

speaker: Wolf
text: Enough, Sedgar! For goodness sake... It would have been better had I died at Adria Pass... I am the commander of the Wolfguard... The life that Coyote gave me... I will not waste it. Even if that should lead to Coyote's death...

speaker: Nehring
text: What...? Our Archanea has been defeated? But as long as I'm here, I won't let you enter the castle!

speaker: Nehring
text: Glory to the Emperor...

speaker: Boah
text: Oh, Lord Marth. I've been waiting for you.

speaker: Marth
text: Boah!? You've suffered a grave wound... What happened?

speaker: Boah
text: Mmm... It was truly frightening... I suppose the Archanea royal family is indeed under a curse. You should know about Hardin and Nyna's marriage, two years ago. To restore Archanea, a king was required, and only two people were suitable. King Aurelis's younger brother, Hardin, and Altea's Prince Marth, you... Those were the choices, and we pleaded for Nyna to make the final decision. Originally, she wanted to wait a while longer, but we begged for her to make up her mind immediately. In the end she said that choosing Prince Marth as her husband would hurt Princess Caeda, so she finally decided on Hardin.

speaker: Marth
text: Wait a second, wasn't that a little harsh on Nyna? I understand that Archanea needed a king, but Nyna, she already...

speaker: Boah
text: You are referring to Grust's Lord Camus? But that would be unspeakable... Unthinkable in fact. Princess Nyna was the sole successor of the royal bloodline of Archanea. I felt bad as well, but for this country we had no other choice. However, Lord Hardin was very happy. Compared to ascending Archanea's throne, he seemed happier about the fact that Nyna chose him for her husband.

speaker: Marth
text: I also understand Hardin's feelings. He could sacrifice his own life for Nyna. But, did he know about Camus? If he did, I don't believe he would be so happy.

speaker: Boah
text: Mmm... Of course we kept that a secret, and we also persuaded Nyna to hide it as best as she could. But, Lord Hardin was a very sensitive man. He quickly found out that Nyna's heart had no place for him. He felt very painful... He locked himself in his room, and didn't allow anybody to see him. Taking advantage of his broken heart, Gharnef appeared. He took on the guise of a merchant to approach Hardin, and showed him the Darksphere. The distraught Hardin was quickly consumed by the orb. From that day on, he completely changed. It was because I was only focused on restoring this country that I committed such a horrendous mistake. Please, forgive me, Prince Marth...

speaker: Marth
text: I can't believe all that happened. ..... Where is Nyna now?

speaker: Boah
text: When Hardin discovered that she had taken the Fire Emblem, he had her confined in her room. After that, she would still communicate in secret with me. However, Hardin found out and then wounded me. He also handed Nyna over to Gharnef.

speaker: Marth
text: Gharnef...!?

speaker: Boah
text: Mmm... Gharnef had always wanted to take Nyna. He said that the resurrection of the dark dragon required the blood of noble clerics... And so... He took Nyna... To use her as a live sacrifice... Lord Marth, I'm already done for. I will give my Thoron and Physic to you. I beg of you, please rescue Nyna. Even if Archanea is destroyed it no longer matters... I only wish for Nyna to be safe...

speaker: Marth
text: Huh...? W-who's there?

speaker: Kris
text: Sire, it's me, Kris.

speaker: Marth
text: Oh, it's just you.... You had me startled for a moment. Especially with that mask on you...

speaker: Kris
text: Is it that strange?

speaker: Marth
text: Well... perhaps a little. Do you mean to fight like that?

speaker: Kris
text: Yes.

speaker: Marth
text: I-I see.

speaker: Marth
text: Jagen, where in the world are we...?

speaker: Jagen
text: This is the path depicted in the Anri Saga. The first obstacle in Anri's Way: the Desert of Death. With its scorching sun, raging sandstorm, savage clansmen of the sands and wyverns that soar and dominate the skies. As the city of illusion shimmers in the distance, we can only stand and gaze... Or so the legend has it.

speaker: Marth
text: So Anri came through here as well. And by himself, too...

speaker: Jagen
text: That's right. Your ancestor and Altea's founder, King Anri... To save Princess Artemis, he set out on a journey to seek the Divine Blade Falchion.

speaker: Marth
text: King Anri was strong. I wouldn't be able to cross through here alone. I'm truly grateful to those who offered to accompany me through this desert.

speaker: Kris
text: I think everybody wishes to follow you, sire. Everyone wants to be with you. Wherever you go, they will follow. That's what I believe. It's because of your kindness, sire.

speaker: Marth
text: Thank you. I don't have Anri's power. But I have all of you. Wonderful companions like you, Kris. That's how I can keep going. Let's go, Kris.

speaker: Kris
text: Understood.

speaker: Caeda
text: Jake! What are you doing all the way out here...?

speaker: Jake
text: Is that you, Caeda? Hey, long time no see. I'm here to meet my beloved Anna.

speaker: Caeda
text: Huh? Anna lives in a place like this?

speaker: Jake
text: Oh, you didn't know? Anna's running a secret shop out here. It's a tiny bit troublesome coming here, but y'know, love conquers all barriers! Your turn Caeda. What're you doing in the desert?

speaker: Ceada
text: Listen, Jake. We're fighting for the peace of the continent again. Could you help us, like old times...?

speaker: Jake
text: I dunno, I kinda lost my ballista, so I doubt I'd be much use to you.

speaker: Caeda
text: That's not true. You'd help us a lot just by being there...

speaker: Jake
text: Aw, shucks. How could I say no when you say it like that? I bet Anna's worried about the war too. Alrighty, I'll join you then.

speaker: Jake
text: What?! M-more bandits?

speaker: Jake
text: Anna... I'm... sorry...

speaker: Tiki
text: Mar-Mar!! It's been aaages. It's me, Tiki! I've wanted to see you for so long.

speaker: Marth
text: Huh... Tiki?! You came to welcome us? Oh, I see... you've been living with Lord Gotoh, haven't you?

speaker: Kris
text: Sire, do you know this little girl?

speaker: Marth
text: Yes. This is Tiki, a companion of ours during the war. Tiki was a great boon to our cause. She mowed down legions of enemy dragons with her tremendous power.

speaker: Kris
text: What?! This little girl did that...?

speaker: Marth
text: But you've certainly grown since last time. I'm glad to see you're well.

speaker: Tiki
text: Yeah... But I was so lonely. 'Cause you never came to see me...

speaker: Marth
text: I'm sorry. But I could never forget about you. I had intended to invite you back to Altea once things had calmed down.

speaker: Tiki
text: Mar-Mar... I... I love you!

speaker: Xane
text: ...Gotcha!

speaker: Marth
text: Xa... Xane!!!

speaker: Kris
text: What the...?! T-the little girl is now a man!

speaker: Xane
