text: Oopsy daisy. Took you by surprise, didn't I? Particularly you over there, newbie. I'm Xane. A friend of Marth's. Transformin' into other people's a special ability of mine. Hey princey, my Tiki impression was pretty darn tootin', wasn't it? Did I provide some comic relief? Well, shall we get goin'? You wanted to see Lord Gotoh, right?

speaker: Marth
text: Xane, how do you know Lord Gotoh? Just who are you?

speaker: Xane
text: Well, lemme see. I don't think that really matters right now. Hey, put that jaw back in place and follow me.

speaker: Marth
text: Kris, I noticed you fighting with that mask on.

speaker: Kris
text: Yes. The desert sun was strong, but it acted as a shield. Nevertheless, I suppose there's little point in wearing it now.

speaker: Marth
text: I see. Are you going to remove it then?

speaker: Kris
text: Yes. I think I shall.

speaker: Marth
text: Yes, that's probably a good idea.

speaker: Kris
text: No. I'll keep fighting with it on.

speaker: Marth
text: I-is that so...? Does it not bother you in any way?

speaker: Kris
text: Not at all. I can fight just fine with it on.

speaker: Marth
text: I-I see. Well, if that's what you've decided then I have no problems with it.

speaker: Jagen
text: Sire, Lord Horace should be inside this fort.

speaker: Kris
text: It seems the enemy has already infiltrated the building. Please be careful, sire.

speaker: Marth
text: All right. Let us fight with caution.

speaker: Legion
text: Uwee hee hee... Horaces, was it? Youses a stubborn ones... Yous already killed three of our brotherses. But there are mores of us... moreses, moreses, moreses! How longs can you last? Uwee hee!

speaker: Horace
text: Who the hell are you? Who gave you the orders to attack me?

speaker: Legion
text: Uwee hee hee. Who knowses? We sure don't. But really, poor yous! You'll be killed by us, and won't even knows why!

speaker: Horace
text: My life isn't my own. Ever since I became a knight, my life is for my liege and my people. I cannot be defeated by cowards like you.

speaker: Legion
text: Uwee hee hee! Bring it on!! We are Legion. There are manys of us and ones of us, all in oneses. Want to knows how to defeats us, hmm? Simple. Just kills the real Legion. But can you findses the real Legion?! Uwee hee hee!!!

speaker: Horace
text: You are Kris, Prince Marth's Royal Guard, correct? 'Tis an honor to meet you. I am Horace, an Archanean knight in the service of Princess Nyna. Prince Marth saved me in the previous war. For Princess Nyna's sake, please allow me the privilege of fighting alongside you.

speaker: Legion
text: Uwee hee hee! You can kills us and kills us again. But there are mores of our brotherses... moreses, moreses, moreses of us! As longs as the real Legion is still standing, there'll be no end to the Legion... Uwee hee!!!

speaker: Legion
text: Uwee hee hee!!! Are we real or are we false? Try us and see!!!

speaker: Legion
text: Uwee hee... hee... how did you... know...?

speaker: Kris
text: Sire, the remaining enemies have fled. Victory is ours.

speaker: Marth
text: Good work. But either way, that was a strange enemy. Were they even human...?

speaker: Jagen
text: I've heard rumors about them. Those wicked assassins crushed their souls when they were young, and raised them as living puppets who follow orders without question...

speaker: Marth
text: How pitiful... Kris. I wonder if Katarina was raised under such circumstances, as well...

speaker: Marth
text: However, we can't do anything about that now. Let us go ahead. To Anri's Way, where Lord Gotoh awaits.

speaker: Kris
text: Sir Jagen, I've found something most odd inside the castle. It's this mask. It seems like a different type from the one those assassins wore, but what's it for...?

speaker: Jagen
text: Heh... This is a mask for use in a masquerade ball, I believe.

speaker: Kris
text: Masquerade ball?

speaker: Jagen
text: Yes. Noblemen once donned these masks in order to conceal their identities. They were probably used in this old castle a long time ago. So, it's unrelated to the assassins.

speaker: Kris
text: I see... But, it sure is a strange mask.

speaker: Jagen
text: What of it? Don't tell me you intend to wear it?

speaker: Kris
text: Yes. For some reason, I feel like giving it a try.

speaker: Jagen
text: You are an odd one. Well, do as you wish.

speaker: Kris
text: No, I'll leave it where I found it.

speaker: Jagen
text: Yes, good idea.

speaker: Katarina
text: Lady Eremiya... I have a report. Legion, he...

speaker: Eremiya
text: I see, so he failed. Even though I took such good care of him... Such a troublesome child.

speaker: Katarina
text: Lady Eremiya, the Altean army is strong. Now that Legion has been defeated... Perhaps we should refrain from pursuing them.

speaker: Eremiya
text: No. Crushing Altea was an order of his.

speaker: Katarina
text: But...

speaker: Clarisse
text: What? Reese, don't tell me you're afraid?

speaker: Katarina
text: Clarisse...

speaker: Clarisse
text: Lady Eremiya, please allow me the honor. I'll take care of them.

speaker: Eremiya
text: My, you're a good girl, Clarisse. Would you?

speaker: Clarisse
text: Anything for you, Lady Eremiya.

speaker: Katarina
text: ... Lady Eremiya, about the remaining Legion brothers...

speaker: Eremiya
text: Ah, those. Get rid of all of them.

speaker: Katarina
text: Lady Eremiya...!

speaker: Eremiya
text: They can't fight now that they've lost Legion, can they? So, they're useless now. Broken junk is to be discarded.

speaker: Katarina
text: B-but, Lady Eremiya... They were with us in the orphanage... with you too, Lady Eremiya...

speaker: Eremiya
text: So what?

speaker: Clarisse
text: Reese, you sure are useless, aren't you? Don't worry, Lady Eremiya. I'll get rid of them.

speaker: Eremiya
text: My, Clarisse is such a good little girl. Completely different from a certain failure.

speaker: Clarisse
text: Ah, Lady Eremiya... Your praise makes me happy.

speaker: Jagen
text: Sire! We've been ambushed by the enemy! Enemy troops are waiting for us ahead.

speaker: Marth
text: Alright. Jagen, Kris, make preparation for battle.

speaker: Kris
text: Yes, immediately.

speaker: Kris
text: Yes, at once.

speaker: Radd
text: We did it, Caesar! Our ambush was a success. They're completely surrounded. Tactical victory is ours.

speaker: Caesar
text: I see. However, don't lower your guard. Our enemy is the Altean army... We know how strong they are.

speaker: Radd
text: But Caesar, are you really fine with this? We did fight under Altea's banner in the previous war...

speaker: Caesar
text: We're mercenaries. We have no liege. I need gold, and will do anything for it. Even selling my soul to the devil.

speaker: Radd
text: Gold, huh... Indeed, when we get the reward from Emperor Hardin... I'm sure we could save her. Alright, let's do it, Caesar!

speaker: Caesar
text: Radd, there's no need for you to follow me. My sister is my business. The Altean army is strong. You'll die if you're careless.

speaker: Radd
text: I'm doing this for my own interests too. So I'll tag along with you, Caesar. As I always have, and always will.

speaker: Caesar
text: Very well. Then, let's go!

speaker: Clarisse
text: Legion, you're ready, I presume?

speaker: Legion
text: Yes, yes, yesss! It's finally time for us allses! Uwee hee hee!!! Togethers with those mercenaries, we'll gives Marth a royal funeral!

speaker: Clarisse
text: It seems some of those mercenaries were Marth's allies in the previous war. I do wonder if they'll be of any use.

speaker: Legion
text: So whats? Doesn't matters. If they're uselesses, all we have to do is kills him ourselves.

speaker: Clarisse
text: Bah, I don't like you getting the best part. Oh well, do whatever you want.

speaker: Caesar
text: The time for words is gone. Fighting is all we can do, now.

speaker: Caesar
text: Can't I... even save... one little sister...?

speaker: Radd
text: I am Radd, deputy commander of this mercenary band. Here I come...

speaker: Radd
text: Caesar... Please... stay alive...

speaker: Legion
text: Uwee hee hee! Come on! Come on! Come on! Timeses to fight!!!

speaker: Legion
text: We won't dies... even if you kill mes... Uwee...hee...

speaker: Caesar
text: You win, Prince Marth. I should have known you weren't a foe we could defeat with petty tricks. I surrender. Kill me or whatever; I'm all yours.

speaker: Marth
text: Caesar, I'd like to hire you and Radd if possible. I want you to come with us. You and Radd fought by my side in the previous war. You're both my comrades.

speaker: Caesar
text: Prince, forgive me, but we're mercenaries. All we did in the previous war was fulfill our duties as hired swords.

speaker: Marth
text: It might have been just a job for you two... But not to me. Both of you are my precious comrades. You were then, and still are now.

speaker: Caesar
text: Prince... I appreciate your willingness to say such kind words to mercenaries like us. However, at the end of the day, we're hired swords. Therefore, we ask for gold. Prince, Archanea occupies your country. It's obvious you don't have the extra resources needed to pay us.

speaker: Marth
text: Well, you have a point...

speaker: Kris
text: Gold shouldn't be an issue. Prince Marth will reclaim Altea, our homeland. Altea may be occupied by Archanea now, but we shall defeat them. And then, you'll have the gold you seek.

speaker: Caesar
text: Do you... honestly think you stand a chance? Against a powerful kingdom like Archanea?

speaker: Kris
text: Of course. Besides, I'm sure you don't have a choice, at this point. Since you've failed your mission, Archanea won't pay you the gold you seek anymore. If you're a hired sword working for gold, following Prince Marth would serve your interests better. Am I wrong?

speaker: Caesar
text: ...Indeed, your argument is sound. As we've failed, we have no other options. Prince Marth, Radd and I are now your hired swords. We shall accompany you for as long as you wish us to.

speaker: Marth
text: Thank you, Caesar.

speaker: Radd
text: No... Caesar...

speaker: Marth
text: Radd... You have my condolences. Radd, I'd like to hire you if possible. I want you to come with us. You and Caesar fought by our side in the previous war. You're both my comrades.

speaker: Radd
text: ...Me, work for you? Sure thing, Prince Marth. But I hate you guys. I could just feign joining you, Prince, and then try and kill you, y'know?

speaker: Marth
text: I don't mind.

speaker: Kris
text: Sire...!

speaker: Marth
text: Radd, listen to me. Caesar is dead... We killed him. And that's why I ask this of you. I don't want this... I don't want comrades killing each other!

speaker: Radd
text: ...Prince Marth...

speaker: Kris
text: Radd. This is the first time we meet. I don't know your connection with Caesar. However, I know this. Caesar's death... pains Prince Marth as much as it pains you...

speaker: Kris
text: Radd, Prince Marth will be even sadder if you die, too. We don't want to repeat that tragedy again. So, please...

speaker: Radd
text: ...Alright. Prince Marth, if you so wish, then I'll tag along with you. I'll accept the money once this war is over. For Caesar's sake, too, I must save that girl...

speaker: Marth
text: Thank you, Radd.

speaker: Caesar
text: We lose, Prince Marth. I should have known you weren't a foe we could defeat with petty tricks. Kill me. Send me to where Radd is waiting.

speaker: Marth
text: Caesar, I'd like to hire you, if possible. I want you to come with us. You and Radd fought by my side in the previous war. You're both my comrades.

speaker: Caesar
text: Prince, forgive me, but we're mercenaries. All we did in the previous war was fulfill our duties as hired swords. Besides, do you think I'd just agree? Now that Radd's been killed...

speaker: Marth
text: That's right, Radd is dead... We killed him. But that's exactly why I'm asking this of you. I don't want this... I don't want comrades killing each other anymore!

speaker: Caesar
text: ...Prince Marth...

speaker: Kris
text: Mercenary commander Caesar. This is the first time we meet. I don't know your connection with Radd. However, I know this. Radd's death... pains Prince Marth as much as it pains you...

speaker: Kris
text: Caesar, Prince Marth will be even sadder if you die, too. We don't want to repeat that tragedy again. So, please...

speaker: Caesar
text: ...Very well. While I'm not fully convinced... This was something I brought upon myself. I have no right to blame others for it. Prince Marth, from now on I'm in your service. I shall accompany you for as long as you wish it.

speaker: Marth
text: Thank you, Caesar.

speaker: Kris
text: Sire, the battle is over.

speaker: Marth
text: Kris, Caesar and Radd were... our comrades in the previous war. Jeorge too, to think we'd be fighting our former comrades like this...

speaker: Jagen
text: Sire, you must be strong. Now that Archanea has become our enemy, we'll have to face this kind of situation many times over. But don't worry, sire. You will always have Kris and me--your loyal retainers--by your side.

speaker: Marth
text: Thank you, Jagen, Kris. It's only because you're with me that I can walk forward. Let us go, to the Fane of Raman.

speaker: Clarisse
text: Oh dear. Legion, it seems your clone died.

speaker: Legion
text: Legion was no clone. Legion was our brotherses. We are allses brotherses.

speaker: Clarisse
text: Ugh, whatever. So, are you the real Legion? Or just another clone?

speaker: Legion
text: Who knows? Legion doesn't knowses. Uwee hee hee! The Alteans are strong-strong. Next times, we'll bring ALL our brotherses. Real Legion and brotherses, together we'll kills Marth. Uwee hee!

speaker: Jagen
text: By the way, Kris. I have something I'd like to ask you.

speaker: Kris
text: Yes, Sir Jagen?

speaker: Jagen
text: From your perspective, what kind of person am I?

speaker: Kris
text: What kind... of person?

speaker: Jagen
text: I keep wondering about how I should have acted towards Lang... Our homeland Altea's position is important, but perhaps I brood far too much and offend people.

speaker: Kris
text: You worry about these things too, Sir Jagen? You needn't worry. Your concern for Prince Marth is more than evident. You're very strict, Sir Jagen, but also very kind.

speaker: Jagen
text: Is that so...? Ho ho, if you cheer me on enough, I may even age backwards!

speaker: Kris
text: Sir Jagen, when you look at me, what kind of person do you see?

speaker: Jagen
text: Hmm, well... You're very capable as a Royal Guard...

speaker: Jagen
text: And you have an aura that attracts people.

speaker: Jagen
text: And you're wise, almost foresighted.

speaker: Jagen
text: And I can feel a hidden genius somewhere.

speaker: Jagen
text: And you have a kind heart.

speaker: Jagen
text: And you have an indisputably strong heart.

speaker: Jagen
text: That's the kind of person you are.

speaker: Kris
text: What an honor.

speaker: Jagen
text: Well, we'd best begin the war council. Let us go, Kris.

speaker: Kris
text: Yes, Sir Jagen.

speaker: Phina
text: Huff... huff... Please... help me... The thieves... They're going to...

speaker: Phina
text: No, it can't be! You're... one of them... as well? Oh, fine... Do your worst! If you're going to kill me, do it fast!!

speaker: Navarre
text: Girl... Get behind me. The Altean army is marching towards the south of this forest. I'll take you to them.

speaker: Phina
text: Huh? You're going to help me? You mean, you're not with the thieves?

speaker: Navarre
text: Until just now, I was. But, I've changed my mind.

speaker: Phina
text: Why...?

speaker: Navarre
text: There's someone in the Altean army that I want to see. That's all.

speaker: Phina
text: Hmmm... But really, it's 'cause I'm cute, right? At any rate, I'm glad. My name's Phina. I'm a dancer from Warren. People say that once they see my dancing, they feel instantly refreshed! I can show you, if you like. Oh, I should tell you my story: I got separated from my troupe, and wandered into this forest. And then, those horrible thieves came and tried to take me by force... But it's okay now. You seem kind of scary, but actually you're very kind. However, your appearance is... Your face isn't bad, but your dress sense is kind of lacking. And, ugh, what's with your hair? You know, nowadays...

speaker: Navarre
text: Just stop talking! Anyway, don't stray too far. We'll cut our way to the west corner, and then escape through there. If you want to live, then shut up and come with me.

speaker: Phina
text: Ah... Y-yes, sorry...

speaker: Villager
text: The ancient Fane of Raman is just a treasure trove to thieves. You can see 'em carrying the stolen treasure all over the place. I hope they get cursed or something...

speaker: Villager
text: The ones protecting the bridge are Astram's free company: powerful men who stop at nothing. As a wise man once said: "Let sleeping dogs lie", eh?

speaker: Villager
text: I wonder if you've seen that young lady's dance? Marvelous, isn't it? Makes a tired body feel healthy again in the blink of an eye!

speaker: Villager
text: You must never go near that cave. I heard a rumor that in that cave dwells a terrible fire dragon.

speaker: Soldier
text: Captain Astram, we've sighted the Altean army to the south! Shall we attack?

speaker: Astram
text: Our mission is to hold the bridge. Leaving the bridge will not be permitted. Only attack if the enemy approaches.

speaker: Soldier
text: Yes sir. But what about the troops in the fort? I hear they will march out soon.

speaker: Astram
text: They were bought with coin by the Emperor. Let them do as they please. Either way, they won't win. WE will be the ones to stop the Altean army.

speaker: Jagen
text: Sire, please exercise caution! Reports indicate that a fire dragon has emerged from the cave to the west!

speaker: Astram
text: Traitors! I'll show you the might of the Mercurius!

speaker: Astram
text: Midia... My love...

speaker: Dahl
text: Tryin' to take a cut from a thief's plunderin'... You people ain't even human!

speaker: Dahl
text: Murderers... the lot of you...

speaker: Jagen
text: Sire, we've driven away the thieves, but the temple was completely ransacked; anything that wasn't nailed down is gone. I'm sure even Guardian Deity Naga would be furious. 'Tis truly the end of civilzation.

speaker: Marth
text: Jagen, do you know the legend of Naga?

speaker: Jagen
text: Yes; only vaguely, however. Kris, do you know of it?

speaker: Kris
text: No, not really...

speaker: Jagen
text: Unknown among the youth, I see... Then, sire, allow me the honor.

speaker: Jagen
text: It's said that a thousand years ago... when there was not one king in the lands, people lived in small villages. One day, terrible monsters descended and the humans were massacred, pushed to the brink of extinction. The few who survived prayed to the gods for salvation. The gods heard their prayers, and a gigantic warrior was sent down to earth. The warrior carried a gleaming blade of light in his right hand, and in his left hand, a shield embedded with five orbs. Then, after a fierce battle, he eradicated the monsters and returned to the heavens. He was our guardian deity, Naga, and this temple is dedicated to him. "He was the avatar of the gods: our guardian deity..."

speaker: Marth
text: With the blade of light and the five orbs... That is the legend of Naga...

speaker: Jagen
text: Well then, sire. We have to cross the Chiasmir Bridge soon. We must hurry; if the enemy takes it, getting across will be nigh impossible.

speaker: Marth
text: Alright then, inform the whole army: We cross Chiasmir Bridge at once. We haven't a moment to waste!

speaker: Kris
text: Yes sir!

speaker: Kris
text: Lord Wendell, we're off to Chiasmir Bridge. I... A-achoo!

speaker: Wendell
text: Oh dear, are you alright? Have you caught a cold?

speaker: Kris
text: Perhaps. It's too early to tell.

speaker: Wendell
text: Don't push yourself too hard, and remember to keep yourself warm. Oh I know, shall I lend you one of the hats that I'm wearing?

speaker: Kris
text: Huh? Is that okay?

speaker: Wendell
text: Yes, I have many of these hats, so there's no need to worry. Well then, would you like to try it on?

speaker: Kris
text: Yes, please, if it's not a bother.

speaker: Wendell
text: No, no, don't be shy. Here you go. And do remember to watch your health.

speaker: Kris
text: You're a good person, Lord Wendell. I want to be more like you... Oh yeah, if I wear this hat for a while, I wonder if my hair will start to look like his? And then, maybe I'll be a bit more like Lord Wendell!

speaker: Kris
text: No thank you, but I appreciate the gesture. I'll be just fine.

speaker: Wendell
text: I understand. But, do remember to watch your health.

speaker: Jagen
text: Sire, we have detected an enemy presence in the mountains. It seems there is a battle ongoing.

speaker: Marth
text: Alright. Jagen, Kris, let us hurry with our preparations!

speaker: Wrys
text: So I'm surrounded... How sad, I guess this is the end of the road for me...

speaker: Clarisse
text: Alright, he's right where we want him. Now to savor his pain as we slowly draw the life from his tormented soul...

speaker: Katarina
text: Clarisse... The Altean army has arrived.

speaker: Clarisse
text: Tsk! What a nuisance. Reese, I hate to admit it but you were right about this outcome. Alteans never abandon their comrades... You sure learned a lot about that trash from your time staying with them.

speaker: Clarisse
text: My job is to kill, one by one, everyone who sided with Marth in the previous war. Because if his allies live, they'll eventually join him, one after another. And that would be dangerous.

speaker: Katarina
text: ... Clarisse, are you really up for the task?

speaker: Clarisse
text: I don't need to get MY hands dirty, do I? My underlings can get the job done. We're hardly dealing with strong enemies.

speaker: Katarina
text: You'll die if you underestimate Kris and the others, Clarisse. I served as Kris's tactician, but I wasn't much help as one; I didn't give them the advice a tactician should give. Even without me, Kris and the others are strong.

speaker: Clarisse
text: What? Have you become attached to the Alteans after your little frolic with them? Then, just sit there and watch. Watch hard and well as I kill your beloved companions. Oh yes, and please... don't get in my way, okay?

speaker: Clarisse
text: Alright, I'm leaving the rest to you. Others are coming to help you soon, so hurry and kill them already. If by some chance those rats aren't dead when I return... I'll make sure YOU'RE dead, got it?

speaker: Wrys
text: Oh, my savior Kris. Thank you kindly for coming to my rescue. I cannot fight, but I can heal your wounded. Take me with you and you'll be very glad you did.

speaker: Clarisse
text: Wait... what? Where did you lot come from!?

speaker: Clarisse
text: Tsk! This is bad... To think I'd run from the likes of you... I'll remember this!

speaker: Kris
text: Sire, are you unhurt?

speaker: Marth
text: Yes, I'm alright. Thank you, Kris.

speaker: Jagen
text: We've repelled the assassins, but we cannot afford to linger here.

speaker: Marth
text: I agree. I'm worried about Ogma. Let us hurry to Lord Wendell's place!

speaker: Clarisse
text: ...Hmm. The Alteans are better than I expected. Oh well. We can always snuff them out later. I'll let them live for now.

speaker: Katarina
text: I warned you. The Altean army is strong...

speaker: Clarisse
text: Gosh, Reese. You can be annoying sometimes. Whose side are you supposed to be on? Don't tell me you're thinking of betraying Lady Eremiya?

speaker: Katarina
text: ...No. That thought could never cross my mind. We all live for Lady Eremiya. For her sake, I must defeat Kris... I know that well enough.

speaker: Wrys
text: Greetings, Kris, my friend. It's been a while since we last had a decent conversation.

speaker: Kris
text: Yes. Ever since the knight training, eh, Father Wrys?

speaker: Wrys
text: Indeed, and you've become even stronger than you were then... ...Oh, did your hair grow a little?

speaker: Kris
text: Really? Well, it is true I haven't had the time to take care of it since we left Altea...

speaker: Wrys
text: You know, a haircut like mine is astonishingly easy to take care of.

speaker: Kris
text: I-I can imagine...

speaker: Wrys
text: If you so wish, I could shave your head, so it's like mine.

speaker: Kris
text: Eh?

speaker: Wrys
text: As I'm a monk, I'm quite used to shaving heads. It's quite alright. If you don't like it, you can just let your hair grow and have your previous haircut back. What do you say? Would you allow me to shave your head?

speaker: Kris
text: Yes, please.

speaker: Wrys
text: Very well. Then, give me a moment to prepare. ...Are you really sure?

speaker: Kris
text: Y-yes...

speaker: Wrys
text: Then, please sit down. Now, close your eyes...

speaker: Kris
text: I-I think I'll pass.

speaker: Wrys
text: I see. It's a pity, but perhaps it's for the best. In any case, Kris, I'm counting on you from now on.

speaker: Jagen
text: Your highness, we've entered the castle! But don't forget that Hardin is being protected by the Darksphere. To fight him , you must have the Lightsphere!! Be sure to let the person fighting him carry it.

speaker: Hardin
text: Midia, even you betrayed me. Archanea's paladins have lost their touch.

speaker: Midia
text: You fool!! Don't you see it? What you're doing isn't normal. Where did you take Nyna to? Bring her back to us now!!

speaker: Hardin
text: Nyna! That woman betrayed me. I just wanted to destroy Grust. And she had to go and give the Emblem to that boy... Those who betray me must die. Midia, you're no exception!!

speaker: Midia
text: If you want to take my life, go ahead. But Hardin... Do you know how much suffering you've caused because of your stupid jealousy? Just open your eyes and see!

speaker: Hardin
text: Stupid jealousy...? Haha... You can say what you like. This world is corrupt and full of annoying people. Is this kind of world even worth anything? It would be far better for it to be destroyed. Midia, you shall watch here... As Prince Marth dies by hand!!

speaker: Hardin
text: Marth...? As a servant of the Empire, you dared to invade Millennium Court. I am disappointed in you. So Altea's Prince of Light is just a lowlife.

speaker: Marth
text: Hardin! Your are being controlled by the Darksphere, and have lost your just heart!! Please, you must return to normal!

speaker: Hardin
text: Hahaha...! You are so naive, Marth. I attacked Altea solely because of my hatred of you. In the previous war, it was only because you were the descendant of Anri that Nyna gave the Emblem to you, and chose you to become the leader of the alliance. Prince of Light... What nonsense! If you hadn't received my support you would have died long ago, so don't act all big, Marth!! From that day on, I hated you. I kept silent for Nyna, but I knew I would have to deal with you eventually. This has nothing to do with the orb!

speaker: Marth
text: Hardin... Is that true... Your hatred of me... I didn't know...

speaker: Hardin
text: Ha... That's why you're just a boy. Marth! Come to me, so I can use my Gradivus to pierce your heart!! In this tiny continent, I am the only hero that is needed!

speaker: Hardin
text: Rebels... Did you come here to get yourselves killed? I'll show you to fear my Gradivus!!

speaker: Hardin
text: Marth... Your highness... I have finally awakened... From my deep dream... Your highness... I am deeply sorry... I fought with my inner demon. However I was too weak... I resisted with all my might... But I still lost... I hoped for your highness' hand to end my life... That way I could be saved... Your highness... Nyna... Please take care of Nyna... She... I hope you... can tell her... In the... end... I still... loved her... I hope... She can... forgive me...

speaker: Hardin
text: So you've come, Marth!! I'll run you through, just as you wish!

speaker: Marth
text: Hardin, that's enough!

speaker: Hardin
text: I've no quarrel with you... Bring Marth to me!!

speaker: Kris
text: Sir Hardin... To defeat you is my duty. Prepare yourself.

speaker: Hardin
text: I've no quarrel with you... Bring Marth to me!!

speaker: Kris
text: Dark Emperor Hardin... Look nowhere else, I am your opponent!

speaker: Kris
text: Sire, the battle is over. We have won.

speaker: Marth
text: Yes, and with this, finally...

speaker: Jagen
text: Sire! Look over there! Your sister and the others...

speaker: Marth
text: Elice! And Princess Nyna...! Lena, Maria; you're all safe!

speaker: Nyna
text: Marth, I'm so happy you made it... Ngh...!!

speaker: Gharnef
text: You--you carry the Binding Shield...! Gah! My magic has been dispelled? Withdraw, my priests. At this rate, he will... Let us hurry the Shadow Dragon's return!

speaker: Marth
text: Gharnef...!

speaker: Kris
text: That man was the Dark Pontifex Gharnef! His servants were impersonating the princesses.

speaker: Marth
text: What was he playing at? He mentioned something about the Shadow Dragon's return... So as we suspected, my sister and the other clerics must be in Gharnef's hands...

speaker: Jagen
text: Forgive my interruption, sire, but Lord Gotoh has arrived.

speaker: Marth
text: Lord Gotoh? Take me straight to him!

speaker: Gotoh
text: Excellent work, Prince Marth. You managed to obtain all of the orbs. Thanks to your efforts, the lost Binding Shield is finally complete.

speaker: Marth
text: Incredible! It felt as though the shield itself pulled in all the orbs... So this is the fabled Binding Shield. But what now, Lord Gotoh? From Gharnef's actions, it would seem he has the noble clerics imprisoned. I worry for their safety.

speaker: Gotoh
text: Hmm... I understand how you feel... However, we have a far greater task to accomplish--we must seal away the earth dragons. Soon they will awaken from their slumber. They will rise up from the ground, destroying everything in their wake, and turn this world into a living hell. Go, Marth. Entomb the awakened dragons once more!

speaker: Jagen
text: Marth, it's finally over. Now, the world is safe. Look, the princesses are over there...

speaker: Marth
text: Sister! And there's Princess Nyna... And Lena and Maria as well. It's great to see that everybody is safe.

speaker: Nyna
text: Marth, you finally came. I am so happy... I will need your help to restore Archanea.

speaker: Elice
text: You really worked hard, Marth. You are my pride.

speaker: Lena
text: Lord Marth, with our combined strength we have already vanquished Gharnef. Please relax.

speaker: Maria
text: The world is safe now. Your highness, please hurry back to Altea.

speaker: Marth
text: Really? It's good to see everybody well. But you all don't look too good...

speaker: Nyna
text: Everybody is tired from battling Gharnef. But it doesn't matter now, so please don't worry.

speaker: Marth
text: Really...? Nyna, I am sorry about Hardin. I couldn't save him.

speaker: Nyna
text: It's fine. He was devoured by his own ambitions, so it is not unexpected that he was lost. Well, Marth, you should hurry back to your homeland. Everybody is probably worried about you. With your remaining time, you must live well. As long as there are still people in this world, your name will never be forgotten.

speaker: Jagen
text: Kris, new information regarding the assassins has reached the palace. As you may have guessed, they were dispatched by Hardin and Gharnef. The head of the organization is a woman named Eremiah.

speaker: Kris
text: Eremiah... And where is she now?

speaker: Jagen
text: Here, in Archanea. Apparently, she runs an orphanage in the mountains.

speaker: Marth
text: An orphanage?

speaker: Jagen
text: Yes, so it would seem. However, it's an orphanage in name only. She confines the children to a basement devoid of light, and teaches them all manner of wicked things....

speaker: Kris
text: ......Sire. Please, let me go. I'll crush them-- I won't allow such a travesty to stand.

speaker: Marth
text: I understand, Kris. I, too, cannot allow a situation like this to carry on.

speaker: Katarina
text: ...Please, wait.

speaker: Marth
text: Katarina? Were you listening the whole time?

speaker: Katarina
text: There's a hidden passage to where Lady Eremiah is... I'll show you the way.

speaker: Katarina
text: Please, allow me to go. I'll be fine. I don't believe for a moment that this will atone for everything I've done... But while I live I want to help in any way that I can.

speaker: Kris
text: ......Sire. Please, let me go. I'll crush them-- I won't allow such a travesty to stand.

speaker: Marth
text: I understand, Kris. I, too, cannot allow a situation like this to carry on. Let's go to the orphanage then.

speaker: Jagen
text: Well, Kris, is everyone making good use of the drill grounds? Of course, if you win often, you'll be that much stronger. Kris, you...

speaker: Jagen
text: Oho-ho, you... You've done very well, haven't you?

speaker: Kris
text: Yes, I go there often.

speaker: Jagen
text: I see. Then there is nothing I have to add. I should recommend the drill grounds to the others.

speaker: Jagen
text: Oho-ho, you... You've been winning quite often, eh? Not bad at all.

speaker: Kris
text: Thank you. But I hope to improve further.

speaker: Jagen
text: That's the spirit! I should recommend the drill grounds to the others.

speaker: Jagen
text: Hmm, you... It seems you haven't won much yet. Are you purposely avoiding the drill grounds?

speaker: Kris
text: S-sorry, I don't really have the money, so...

speaker: Jagen
text: Well, it's fine if you're not struggling now, but when things get tough, that experience will be the clincher. Just remember, if you ever feel that your foes are too strong, there is a place where you can hone your skills.

speaker: Marth
text: Xane, we've already climbed this high. It's so cold... Even breathing is hard.

speaker: Xane
text: We're almost there. Look, can you see over there? That's the Ice Dragons' Temple where Gotoh is.

speaker: Marth
text: But, that was quite a shock. Tiki is actually the daughter of the Divine Dragon King. Also, both Gotoh and you are Divine Dragons.

speaker: Xane
text: Ah... When the Divine Dragons fought the Earth Dragons they over-exhausted their dragonstones, and so practically became extinct. Aside from Naga, only Gotoh, me and the just born Tiki survived. However, after the war we discarded our dragonstones, so we could no longer become dragons again. Even so, I still have knowledge and power that exceeds that of humans. Gotoh followed Naga's orders to protect humans, but that's got nothing to do with me. I don't like humans. They scorned the Manaketes, even though they had lost their power, and treated them like filth. I can fully understand why Medeus and the others hated humans so much. The Earth Dragon King, Medeus, tricked his own tribe and became a Manakete by himself. He used to follow Naga's orders and guarded the Dragons' Altar. However the once docile humans finally achieved power and became aggressive. They even started to attack the Manaketes that lived in peace. The Manaketes were angered by the betrayal of humans, and gathered at the Dolhr region. They formed their own kingdom of Manaketes and began a war to conquer the humans. To save the humans, Gotoh handed the Falchion to Anri and he created an academy of magic at Khadein. But whoever won wasn't any of my concern.

speaker: Marth
text: Then, why are you helping me? I'm also a human...

speaker: Xane
text: You're different from the others. You don't seem like an unreliable person either...

speaker: Marth
text: Mmm... Thank you, Xane.

speaker: Xane
text: Don't... don't be silly. I'll get embarrassed. Anyway, let's head to the temple, but be careful of the Ice Dragons. Although they're also wild dragons, they will instinctively try to protect their temple. Poor guys...

speaker: Marth
text: You, you're Beck! To think we'd meet here of all places!

speaker: Beck
text: Me too, Prince Marth. Boy am I surprised to see you. It's been far too long. After the war, I was travelin' the continent. And, um, somehow...

speaker: Marth
text: ...You landed up here? Well, thank goodness. There's no way you would have joined the barbarians. Beck, we're fighting another war. Why don't you come with us?

speaker: Beck
text: I don't have my ballista any more. Just my horse-buddy right 'ere. But if you're fine with that, then sure. I'll help you princey.

speaker: Beck
text: What's the point of war?

speaker: Beck
text: D-damn... it... You too... Pony...?

speaker: Marth
text: Hey, Xane. Gotoh didn't really mention anyting about the five orbs, but I thought they were very important. Do you know anything about them?

speaker: Xane
text: Gotoh was afraid of shocking you so he didn't say anything. I will tell you. However, after I've told you, you'll probably think it was better off not knowing. The orbs rest on the shield that seals the Earth Dragons... Basically they are part of the Shield of Seals. Since ancient times, the Divine Dragons have passed down these sacred jewels, each possessing different powers. To put it simply, the shield is just a pedastal and the five orbs are what creates the power of the seal. So if any one of the orbs is lost the seal will weaken.

speaker: Marth
text: Hmm, is that so? But, how come the orbs were scattered?

speaker: Xane
text: Because the shield was broken. The Shield of Seals was displayed at the Fane of Raman, and it was stolen by somebody who ended up breaking it...

speaker: Marth
text: When did that happen?

speaker: Xane
text: Around 600 years ago. To recover the shield, Gotoh spend many years searching the lands. In the end, he only found the five orbs, with the shield nowhere to be seen. Not only that, but the five orbs, which he painfully collected, were scattered again after Raman was attacked in the previous war.

speaker: Marth
text: Really? ...So that was why Gotoh was looking for the lost jewels... the orbs?

speaker: Xane
text: Yep, the Starsphere, Lightsphere and Geosphere... as well as the Darksphere and Lifesphere. The Lightsphere is in Gotoh's possession, that Starsphere was shattered and the Darksphere was given to Hardin by Gharnef.

speaker: Marth
text: The Geosphere is in Altea and all that remains is the Lifesphere.

speaker: Xane
text: Ah... Anyway, let's enter the temple. From now on I will also help you fight. Well, let's go!

speaker: Jagen
text: Sire, please wait. Kris, you as well.

speaker: Jagen
text: I just received a distressing message. People have been sighted not far behind us. There seems to be a battle underway.

speaker: Marth
text: Out here? Could it be the barbarians? Or perhaps it's the assassins...

speaker: Jagen
text: In any case, this area is almost entirely uninhabited. So it can't be any old people... To make matters worse, the snow is becoming heavier... Fighting will be difficult in this weather.

speaker: Marth
text: But if there are allies...

speaker: Kris
text: Indeed. We cannot abandon them. If there are allies that is...

speaker: Marth
text: Then we'll just have to find out for ourselves, before the battle is over. Let's go!

speaker: Luke
text: Ahh... This forest sure is nice and peaceful.

speaker: Kris
text: Yeah.

speaker: Luke
text: Just walking around here makes me feel rejuvenated, in a way.

speaker: Kris
text: Yeah, same here.

speaker: Luke
text: Oh, by the way. We're lost, aren't we?

speaker: Luke
text: Hey, Kris the Ordinary! Wasn't this supposed to be, y'know, a shortcut!? Well?!

speaker: Kris
text: Um... I'm sorry... I really did think it was... But we're definitely lost.

speaker: Luke
text: WHAAAAAT?! You don't need to tell me that! I figured that one out ages ago!

speaker: Katarina
text: Everyone, please, we mustn't fight. We need to work together in times of crisis...!

speaker: Roderick
text: She's right. There's no point in crying over spilt milk. Rather, let's find a way home. Ahem. Ladies and gentlemen, our new mission: find our way back to Altea Castle. Of course, we should try not to wander around aimlessly while we find our way.

speaker: Luke
text: Argh, we've totally fallen behind the others. ...Altean knights, lost in Altea. Sir Jagen is going to kill us...

speaker: Kris
text: I-I'm really very sorry...

speaker: Katarina
text: It's fine. If we march all night, we can make up for lost time. Ah...! Please, wait! Could that be...?

speaker: Ryan
text: W-what's wrong?

speaker: Katarina
text: Over there! That village is under attack!

speaker: Bandit
text: Gahahaha! Steal, burn, loot, pillage! Kill everyone who tries to flee! Gahahahaha!

speaker: Legion
text: Yes, yes, that's it, that's it. Uwee hee hee! ...The more you alls riot, the smoother our jobses will be! Uwee hee!!

speaker: Kris
text: Bandits, here...?! We can't just ignore this. Everyone, move out!

speaker: Merric
text: Bandits... Prince Marth would be saddened if he saw this...

speaker: Kris
text: Hey! Who are you? You don't look like you're in league with the bandits...

speaker: Merric
text: You've got [color] hair... I gather you're the commanding officer? Very well, I shall join you. The name's Merric. I'm a mage from Khadein. Your orders, please!

speaker: Merric
text: You've got blue hair... just like Marth's... I gather you're the commanding officer? Very well, I shall join you. The name's Merric. I'm a mage from Khadein. Your orders, please!

speaker: Bandit
text: Gahahaha! Just die already!

speaker: Bandit
text: Ga...ha...ha...

speaker: Merric
text: I'm glad everyone's safe. Might you be Altean knights?

speaker: Katarina
text: Hm, Kris, maybe this Merric is a friend of Prince Marth... That's it! He must be Merric the wind mage. I heard he even fought alongside Prince Marth during the War of Shadows. Wow, I-I'm a little nervous now...

speaker: Merric
text: Prince Marth summoned me to help train the new knights. But, sadly, I seem to be rather lost. Would it be alright if you would show me the way to Altea Castle?

speaker: Kris
text: T-to Altea Castle?

speaker: Legion
text: Uwee hee hee... Just as planned.

speaker: Clarisse
text: Legion.

speaker: Legion
text: Ooh, Clarisse. Didn't youses have somethings else to do?

speaker: Clarisse
text: Quiet, you. It was easier than taking candy from a baby. I don't waste my time like you lot. You and Reese had better end this quick! It's not hard.

speaker: Legion
text: Whatever. In the ends, our sneaking around is going to gets us results. We've gots a plan... We'll kills Marth... without fail.

speaker: Luke
text: Finally... Altea Castle. We're back at last.

speaker: Katarina
text: Huh? What's the matter, Kris? Is there something bothering you?

speaker: Kris
text: Katarina, did you see him? Among the bandits... There was a funny man with a mask. I didn't count him amongst the dead. It's a little worrying...

speaker: Katarina
text: ...A masked man, huh? I'm sorry. I didn't see him... Well, it's okay. We did beat them in the end! Heehee, all this worrying's gotten me hungry... Come on, Kris, let's go and find something to eat.

speaker: Kris
text: I'm just a little tired and hungry, is all.

speaker: Katarina
text: Ooh, is that all? To be honest, I'm a bit hungry as well... Kris, let's go and find something to eat.

speaker: Marth
text: Please, come in.

speaker: Kris
text: Commander Kris and Katarina, of the 7th Platoon, reporting as ordered, sire.

speaker: Marth
text: Please, calm yourselves. You may stand at ease.

speaker: Katarina
text: Yet you summoned us so suddenly, milord... Is it to do with the bandits we subjugated? Are you, sire, reprimanding us for disobeying our orders?

speaker: Marth
text: Not at all--it's quite the opposite. Your actions have saved many. As ruler, my duty is to protect my people, and I am truly grateful for what you did.

speaker: Katarina
text: We're honored to be of service, but that was tougher than any of our training. Phew...

speaker: Marth
text: Kris, and you as well, Katarina... I hear from Jagen that you've been exemplary cadets.

speaker: Kris
text: Is that so, sire? Sir Jagen never intimated as much...

speaker: Marth
text: I've seen your skill, and I agree wholeheartedly with him. Why, the both of you are suitable for the Altean army. Should the two of you pass your test, I'd love it if you would become my Royal Guards.

speaker: Kris
text: Royal Guards, sire?

speaker: Marth
text: Though the stories tell of me as a great hero, it is not so. There is only so much that I can do by myself. That much, I know to be true. The War of Shadows was won with the aid of comrades who wished for the same future as I. 'Twas not a lone romp across the land. I realized, whether in peace or war, I need people I can trust--young, dynamic soldiers who can support and guide me.

speaker: Kris
text: B-but the Royal Guard exists to protect the king... It is a role of immense importance... Are we even fit for such an esteemed duty?

speaker: Marth
text: Yes, I believe so. I want you to be my Royal Guard. Jagen feels the same as I. But... don't feel obliged to promise me; I won't think ill of you if you decline. And so, I ask this of you once more. You need not answer right away. It's quite alright. Please think it over carefully.

speaker: Kris
text: So this is the School of Khadein... The sanctuary of those who study magic.

speaker: Marth
text: Indeed. Merric studied here since he was a child. I personally have no magical ability, but as for you, Kris...

speaker: Marth
text: You're incredible. I don't think you'd lose to even Merric.

speaker: Kris
text: I wonder if I could study here, in Khadein?

speaker: Marth
text: Actually, I think they'd want you to teach.

speaker: Marth
text: You have potential. I'm sure you'd qualify to study here.

speaker: Kris
text: Thank you, sire.

speaker: Marth
text: You too, hm...? You're not very good at magic either.

speaker: Kris
text: Yeah... I'm not really cut out for it.

speaker: Marth
text: Well, everyone has their own talents. I wouldn't worry too much about it.

speaker: Arlen
text: Merric. It's time to put an end to this.

speaker: Merric
text: Wait, Arlen! Why do we have to fight? We were both Master Wendell's pupils: we're friends, are we not? Why do you despise me so?

speaker: Arlen
text: I was Master Wendell's disciple before you, and I was the stronger one. Even so, Master Wendell gave you Excalibur. He should have given it to me! Clearly, I was the only one worthy to be his successor, yet he...

speaker: Merric
text: But I have no intention of succeeding Master Wendell. I hold no ill feelings for Khadein, but once I finish studying I plan to go home. Back in Altea, there is somebody I must protect for the rest of my life... So, Arlen, please! Why don't you join us so we can take back Altea?

speaker: Arlen
text: Altea, you say?! Why should we help a country that rebelled against the empire and attempted to invade their fair nation? The mage corps of Khadein have sworn allegiance to Emperor Hardin. Oh, I see... I knew it was you... YOU dragged the Altean army here!

speaker: Merric
text: No!! That's not how it is!

speaker: Arlen
text: Shut your mouth, traitor!! I won't listen to your lies any longer! Your Excalibur and my Thoron; we'll put them to the test!

speaker: Wendell
text: Arlen! What are you doing?!

speaker: Arlen
text: Master Wendell...

speaker: Wendell
text: You still don't understand my decision, do you? Indeed, as a mage, your power surpasses mine. But you lack compassion. That is why I did not grant you Excalibur.

speaker: Arlen
text: ... Compassion...?

speaker: Wendell
text: I had decided that you were to be my successor when the time came. To think you would harbor a grudge towards me... Does that not make you the same as Gharnef?

speaker: Arlen
text: The same as Gharnef...? Teacher! What are you saying?

speaker: Wendell
text: Arlen, listen to me... Gharnef, along with Pontifex Miloah, were Lord Gotoh's best pupils. But Lord Gotoh saw Gharnef's weakness, and so he left Khadein and the Aura tome to Pontifex Miloah. Gharnef, overcome by jealousy, stole the Darksphere from Lord Gotoh, and created the Imhullu tome. As a result... His heart was trapped within the Darksphere for all eternity. Wrath and envy led him to ruin. Do you understand now, Arlen...?

speaker: Arlen
text: ...Teacher... ...Teacher! I'm so sorry. I... I was wrong. Please... find it in your heart to forgive me!

speaker: Wendell
text: Arlen, you will use that power of yours for the good of the people. Understand?

speaker: Arlen
text: I won't lose to someone like Merric. Anyone who sides with him is my enemy. Thunder, strike them down! Thoron!!

speaker: Arlen
text: Master Wendell...

speaker: Arlen
text: Why does everyone side with HIM...? Even though... even though I'm stronger!

speaker: Wendell
text: How horrible... Consumed by your hatred, you have forgotten what is truly important.

speaker: Kris
text: Sire, we've rescued the clerics.

speaker: Kris
text: Sire, we've rescued the clerics that were threatened by the enemy.

speaker: Marth
text: Excellent. Good work, Kris.

speaker: Kris
text: As thanks, they have offered to give us this.

speaker: Gotoh
text: Marth... Do you hear me?

speaker: Marth
text: Lord Gotoh! Yes, I can. You are speaking to me through magic, are you not? Lord Gotoh, I must ask: what has happened to cause Hardin to suddenly change so much?

speaker: Gotoh
text: Hmm... The Darksphere is the culprit... Hardin's soul is trapped within the Darksphere...

speaker: Marth
text: The Darksphere? What on earth is that?

speaker: Gotoh
text: Light, Star, Earth, Life and Darkness... In this world, there exist five sacred orbs. The Darksphere is that which complements the Lightsphere; in battle, it possesses the enemy's mind, negating their attacks. But the Darksphere also amplifies wrath and envy, and can turn their owner into a demon. Hardin must have obtained the Darksphere from somewhere... And now his heart has been lost to it.

speaker: Marth
text: But why? He should have been happy after his union with beloved Princess Nyna, so why the envy?

speaker: Gotoh
text: Prince... Humans are never simple creatures... In any case, the only object that can overcome Hardin's Darksphere is the Lightsphere. If you want to do something about him, then you had best come and get it from me.

speaker: Marth
text: Huh? Really, Lord Gotoh? If we have the Lightsphere, then we can save Hardin?

speaker: Gotoh
text: Well... If his heart is not completely consumed, then perhaps.

speaker: Marth
text: Lord Gotoh! Please, lend the Lightsphere to me.

speaker: Gotoh
text: If you come in person to the Ice Dragon's Temple where I reside, then you shall have it. But that will be no easy task. So, Marth. Do you have the courage to walk the path that Anri walked?

speaker: Marth
text: Yes, I do! I will go!! Please, allow me to go! I must have the Lightsphere!

speaker: Jagen
text: Kris, may I have a word? As this army's tactician, I have been observing each and every of our battles. If I were to sum up your recent style of fighting, I would say...

speaker: Jagen
text: Most impressive! To the end. All of your comrades support each other, and you fight as one, so as to not lose each other. With Prince Marth as our core... and your support, we shall not falter.

speaker: Kris
text: It is an honor, Sir Jagen.

speaker: Jagen
text: Excellent! There is no other word. At times we lose comrades... But even so, we have always prevailed. With Prince Marth as our core... and your support, we shall not falter.

speaker: Kris
text: It is an honor, Sir Jagen.

speaker: Jagen
text: Unsatisfactory... It pains me to say it. But your comrades have fallen, one after another... At this rate, I worry for the future. You must protect them from now on. Their lives are in your hands, Kris.

speaker: Kris
text: Yes, Sir Jagen.

speaker: Malice
text: Hey, can I talk to you for a second? I came here 'cause I heard Marth's group was passing by, but, erm...

speaker: Kris
text: Sorry, who are you?

speaker: Malice
text: I'm Malice. A mercenary, and not a cheap one. I'd like to ask you something: is yer prince okay with paying gold? Oh, of course, it's okay if I have to wait until this war's over. So, erm... If you, er, paid us, say... 590 gold for our services, that ought to do, I think.

speaker: Kris
text: Huh? If it's only that much, then Prince Marth would gladly pay...

speaker: Malice
text: Phew! The rumors are true. He's completely different from all our employers up till now. Right, Pops?

speaker: Dice
text: He IS different. Looks like we hit the jackpot coming to this desert. I'm Dice. On behalf of the both of us, it's great to be in your service.

speaker: Jagen
text: Sire, we've just received new information. It concerns the assassins' movements... Lord Horace, who thought to ally with us, is in peril.

speaker: Marth
text: Lord Horace...! Kris, Lord Horace is an Archanean knight in Princess Nyna's service. He was our ally.

speaker: Marth
text: Lord Horace! I am Marth of Altea. I ask that you lay down your arms...

speaker: Horace
text: ...... Is Princess Nyna... safe?

speaker: Marth
text: We cannot abandon Lord Horace. Jagen, Kris, let's hurry!

speaker: Luke
text: Sigh.

speaker: Ryan
text: What's wrong, Luke?

speaker: Luke
text: Don't you think it's a crying shame that there aren't any cute and caring clerics around?

speaker: Ryan
text: W-what do you mean...?

speaker: Luke
text: Well, a knight thrives on romance, right? Like if I were wounded in battle, and a lovely cleric came to my aid... Hey, Kris the Ordinary. If we had a cleric like that with us, I bet we'd all fight twice as hard!

speaker: Kris
text: Well, I don't know about the romantic part... But it would make our lives easier if we had a healer on our side. Unfortunately, I don't think there are any healers around, Luke. It might be a good idea for us to ask someone for assistance on this matter.

speaker: Katarina
text: Kris, everyone, please listen. I bring good news. They've found us someone who can support our platoon! It appears we might be joined by a healer.

speaker: Luke
text: She's finally here! My lovely cleric! Out of my way! Let me at her!

speaker: Wrys
text: Pleased to meet you! I am Wrys, a humble curate. I cannot fight, but this staff I carry can heal your wounded.

speaker: Wrys
text: Yes, yes, I heard the whole thing from Sir Jagen. If you like, I could lend you my services as a healer. ...Oh my, has something terrible happened? Your face looks awfully pale... Have you been taken by illness, my boy?

speaker: Kris
text: It's nothing... He's just overwhelmed with joy right now.

speaker: Kris
text: Ah, no, it's nothing... (Be careful what you wish for, Luke!)

speaker: Katarina
text: Pay no heed to Luke; we're all fine. Pleased to make your acquaintance, Wrys.

speaker: Cain
text: Well then, let's continue the combat training. Everyone, you had better be prepared! I've decided that you will have a rather unusual instructor for today's practical training.

speaker: Cain
text: This is Miss Athena, a foreign myrmidon who helped us in the last war.

speaker: Athena
text: Ve are indebted to this country, and ve vish to return the favor. Any voman would do the same. Ve are bad at teaching. But if ve are using swords, ve will not lose.

speaker: Katarina
text: Athena is a myrmidon with excellent speed and an opponent whom you must be very cautious of. Kris, do your best!

speaker: Cain
text: This is General Jeorge, who is visiting from the kingdom of Archanea.

speaker: Jeorge
text: I came to instruct Gordin in archery, but once I heard your story, my curiosity was piqued, to say the least. So I asked a big favor: to be allowed to take part.

speaker: Katarina
text: Sir Jeorge... A true master of the bow and arrow, they call him greatest archer on the continent. Kris, do your best!

speaker: Athena
text: Ve vill challenge you!

speaker: Athena
text: ...Ve give up.

speaker: Jeorge
text: I am Jeorge, a bow knight of Archanea. Let me see how you fare in battle.

speaker: Jeorge
text: ...That was magnificent...

speaker: Athena
text: You are strong. Especially you. You, vat is your name?

speaker: Kris
text: The name's Kris. Junior knight Kris.

speaker: Athena
text: Kris... Ve vill remember that. You, you are our friend. Ve vill aid you if you vant.

speaker: Jeorge
text: Not bad at all. That was a splendid fight. You, what is your name?

speaker: Kris
text: The name's Kris. Junior knight Kris.

speaker: Jeorge
text: Kris... I'll remember that name. I'm afraid I cannot join your cause, but... Gordin, could you go in my stead?

speaker: Gordin
text: Yes sir. I'll gladly fill in for you.

speaker: Jeorge
text: Kris, you are someone I'd like to fight alongside one day. I look forward to the day we can meet again.

speaker: Cain
text: Today's training is now over. With that, I shall give you an interim report.

speaker: Kris
text: Interim report...?

speaker: Cain
text: From the very first test until now, I have evaluated your manner of combat. The more of your allies that have been injured and forced to withdraw, the poorer your score. Get ready to listen up!

speaker: Kris
text: Yes sir.

speaker: Cain
text: Commander Kris of the 7th Platoon! Of the twenty junior knight platoons, you place...

speaker: Cain
text: First! Wonderful work, Kris! You are most talented!

speaker: Katarina
text: A-amazing! We did it! We did it, Kris! It's all thanks to you, Kris.

speaker: Cain
text: But don't let your guard down. Placing first doesn't give you an excuse to start slacking off. That is all! You may return to the castle!

speaker: Cain
text: Third! Impressive, Kris! I'd say that you've placed rather high.

speaker: Katarina
text: We did it! We did it, Kris! It's thanks to you, Kris.

speaker: Cain
text: But don't let your guard down. You are still in-training--so from now on, you must aim even higher. That is all! You may return to the castle!

speaker: Cain
text: Tenth. Just in the middle, Kris. I've got nothing good to say, at this rate.

speaker: Katarina
text: I'm sorry, Kris. It's because I can't do anything...

speaker: Cain
text: But don't give up. You are still in the middle of training, so I expect more effort from now on. That is all! You may return to the castle!

speaker: Cain
text: Last... Kris... None placed worse than you...

speaker: Katarina
text: I, I-I'm terribly sorry, Kris... It's because I can't do anything...

speaker: Cain
text: ...But don't give up. You are still in the middle of training, so from now on try as hard as you can. That is all! You may return to the castle!

speaker: Kris
text: ...Wow, this castle is absolutely massive. It's a huge difference to the house in my hometown... Now, where were the 7th Platoon's chambers again...?

speaker: Elice
text: Oh my... You are a junior knight, are you not?

speaker: Kris
text: Ah, yes. I'm Kris. I came here hoping to become an Altean knight. And you are...?

speaker: Elice
text: I am Elice. Marth's elder sister.

speaker: Kris
text: Oh! Prince Marth's elder sister... Please excuse my lack of manners.

speaker: Elice
text: It's alright, Kris... I think it's very admirable that you've come to help Marth.

speaker: Kris
text: It is an honor to serve Prince Marth, the Hero King.

speaker: Elice
text: The Hero King... you say? It does seem that our people have grown fond of calling him that. But the truth of the matter is that Marth... Marth is just a weak, vulnerable child...

speaker: Kris
text: Prince Marth is weak...?

speaker: Elice
text: Yes. Of course, he was the hero who triumphed in the battle against the Shadow Dragon. However, behind his heroic face, Marth is an idealistic child who firmly clings on to his beliefs. And as you too must know, the real world... cannot be saved with just ideals.

speaker: Kris
text: Yes...

speaker: Elice
text: Even as we speak, somewhere unknown to us, our people's lives are being lost... Marth cannot save those people.

speaker: Kris
text: Yes, that's true... Even the most excellent of kings is not an omnipotent god. A king is no more than human, and there are limits to what he can do.

speaker: Elice
text: Yes. Precisely. Most people realize this and can come to terms with that reality. But Marth cannot do that... He truly thinks that he can save everyone. In war, losing just one companion is unbearable for him... He suppresses his feelings with all his willpower, but I know that inside, his heart breaks and bleeds...

speaker: Elice
text: In this cruel world, it will become increasingly difficult for him to continue to hold these ideals... Kris, if some day you should achieve knighthood... Please, protect him somehow and keep his ideals safe...

speaker: Jagen
text: Macedon's main force consists of pegasus knights and dracoknights... Both are fast and highly mobile units. In particular, there are the Whitewings, who fought under our banner in the last war... There aren't many in these lands who could match their terrifying speeds.

speaker: Kris
text: I would have loved to witness their prowess...

speaker: Jagen
text: Kris, while we're on the subject of speed...

speaker: Jagen
text: Your speed can be summed up as exemplary. Even the Whitewings would have trouble keeping up with you. As I'd expect of an Altean Royal Guard.

speaker: Kris
text: It is an honor to receive such praise, Sir Jagen.

speaker: Jagen
text: Your speed is satisfactory. But the Whitewings would simply fly straight over you.

speaker: Kris
text: I see... I'll be more careful, Sir Jagen.

speaker: Jagen
text: Your speed is, sadly, terribly lacking. The Whitewings would probably reach their destination in half your time...

speaker: Kris
text: I-I see... I-I'll be more careful, Sir Jagen.

speaker: Anna
text: Hello there Kris.

speaker: Kris
text: Hm? You're...? Why do I feel like we've met somewhere before...?

speaker: Anna
text: Oh, don't worry about little old me. The important thing is that I came here to share a wonderful tip with you. Have you heard about "How's Everyone"?

speaker: Kris
text: How's... everyone?

speaker: Anna
text: How's Everyone is all the rage! By checking it, you can see how everyone in your army is faring. You can watch your allies train, discover useful items, or even listen to their thoughts... So if you ever want to know how everyone is, then take a look at "How's Everyone." Easy, right?

speaker: Kris
text: I... see. Thanks, I guess.

speaker: Anna
text: The more time passes, the more things you'll be able to see. If you ever feel the urge, then go ahead and take a peek! Well, I'll be off now. Buh-bye!

speaker: Catria
text: Prince Marth!! Thank goodness you've come to Macedon!

speaker: Marth
text: Catria?! I received word that there was a rebellion in Macedon. Are you unharmed?

speaker: Catria
text: Yes, I'm fine. My older sister Palla and I managed to escape somehow. But Princess Minerva was captured by the rebels. Prince Marth, please... You have to rescue Princess Minerva! At this rate, her life will be in danger!

speaker: Marth
text: Of course I will help her. Catria, please take us to where she is.

speaker: Catria
text: Yes, my lord! But first we have to break through these woods. General Rumel's dragon knight squad is lurking within this area. If we approach from the front, we'll be easy pickings for them.

speaker: Marth
text: I see...So you're suggesting we flank them from the left or right. Thank you, Catria. Leave it to us!

speaker: Villager
text: Warren's a bit of an idiot. Just 'cause they paid him well, he went ahead and joined the rebel army! Ahh, to think a fool like him was once acquainted with the fair Catria...

speaker: Villager
text: Look out for those pilfering thieves. If they take off with your precious treasure, you won't ever get it back. Never let them escape from your sight.

speaker: Villager
text: Because of the last war, every nation has been forced to lead hard lives. The only well-off country is Archanea, ruled by Emperor Hardin.

speaker: Villager
text: Some dirty thieves took our village treasure, the Lady Sword, and ran off with it. Only women can wield the incredible power of that sword. Please, prise it back from their filthy hands.

speaker: Villager
text: Beware when dracoknights are around. Even from a far-off distance, they can move all at once and swoop down on you!

speaker: Cord
text: O'er here! Prince Marth!

speaker: Marth
text: You're... Cord! What are you doing so far from Talys?

speaker: Cord
text: I couldn't sit still when I heard you's fighting again, so I came to join in. We're Talys's mercenaries, right? If ya died, Princess Caeda'd cry. Prince Marth, lemme fight too. I'll join you's army.

speaker: Catria
text: Warren?! Even a good man like you has sided with the rebel army...

speaker: Warren
text: Catria the White, huh? It's been a while. You know I'm just a common hunter. If they pay me enough, I'll do anything.

speaker: Catria
text: Warren, listen to me! Princess Minerva endeavored to create a country where its people could live at ease. She exiled soldiers and generals of ill repute to accomplish that goal. But General Rucke, despite knowing this, roused the soldiers into a coup d'etat. Can't you see? He's just trying to make this country into his own! And you can honestly say you're okay with that?

speaker: Warren
text: ...I see. Well, I don't like the military acting as if they owned the place... Alright then. If you're going to help the princess, then so will I.

speaker: Warren
text: No hard feelings. I don't have anything against you, but this is the way I live. Forgive me!

speaker: Warren
text: Damn it... I should've seen this coming...

speaker: Rumel
text: Taste the terror of Macedon's fearless dracoknight squad!

speaker: Rumel
text: General Rucke, I leave the rest to you...

speaker: Jagen
text: Sire, we found someone most unusual confined in one of the fortress rooms.

speaker: Marth
text: Hm? ...Linde! How did you wind up in a dangerous place like this?

speaker: Kris
text: Sire, do you know this woman?

speaker: Marth
text: Yes, this is Linde. Her natural talent for magic helped us a great deal in the last war.

speaker: Linde
text: Prince Marth! Thank heavens. What a pleasant surprise meeting you here. I desperately needed to see you again, so I set out to find you. But the Macedonian soldiers found me suspicious and they dragged me to this fortress...

speaker: Marth
text: Is that so? I'm glad you're safe. But, why were you looking for me? Shouldn't you be by Princess Nyna's side?

speaker: Linde
text: I was requested by Princess Nyna to deliver you this.

speaker: Marth
text: Huh? This...! This is the Fire Emblem! The royal heirlom of Archanea: the Emblem Shield!

speaker: Kris
text: The Fire Emblem... I heard that in the last war, Princess Nyna entrusted you with it, sire...

speaker: Marth
text: Indeed. I looked after this as Archanea's representative in the last war. But why give this to me now? Especially at a time when Archanea has so much influence under Emperor Hardin's reign? In this peaceful age, why is Princess Nyna giving me the "Champion's Proof"...?

speaker: Linde
text: I don't understand either. Princess Nyna didn't explain why, just that I had to give it to you... I remember her eyes seemed so sad... I think she may have been crying...

speaker: Marth
text: Princess Nyna crying?! What on earth has been happening...? Linde, after this battle ends, I will go see Princess Nyna. Until then, I want you to remain with us.

speaker: Linde
text: Yes, Prince Marth!!

speaker: Luke
text: Hmmm...

speaker: Ryan
text: What's the matter now, Luke?

speaker: Luke
text: Guys, guys, guys, I need an opinion! How's my hair look?

speaker: Roderick
text: Your... hair?

speaker: Luke
text: I'm a soldier of love, seeking out only the most beautiful women, but I... haven't gotten any dates yet.

speaker: Katarina
text: I'm sorry to say, most of the girls here think of you as small fry. I mean, people think Ryan is a "cutie," or Roderick is "Ohmigosh, so cool!" Quite a few people seem to secretly lust after Kris too.

speaker: Luke
text: Exactly! I didn't get it at first. I thought, "what am I doing wrong?" That's when I realized: it's my hair!

speaker: Kris
text: I'm not sure what leap of logic led you to that particular conclusion...

speaker: Luke
text: Well, for example, I'll fix up my hair like you do! And then...

speaker: Luke
text: They'll see me as brave... and beautiful, just like Kris, right?

speaker: Roderick
text: Err... Luke, you're a guy. How does mimicking Kris automatically make you gallant...?

speaker: Katarina
text: Luke, maybe if you did something about that attitude of yours, you'd be more popular. Oh, it's time. Apparently, today, Sir Jagen wishes to have a word with us before training.

speaker: Luke
text: My feminine grace'll win hearts, just like Kris!

speaker: Ryan
text: Your "feminine grace" is scaring me actually...

speaker: Katarina
text: Luke, maybe if you did something about that attitude of yours, you'd be more popular. Oh, it's time. Apparently, today, Sir Jagen wishes to have a word with us before training.

speaker: Luke
text: N-no, let's not actually. The girls would run away in fear if I had Kris's hairdo...

speaker: Kris
text: ...How rude! What's wrong with my hair, exactly?

speaker: Katarina
text: I-I think your hair looks great, Kris... Oh, it's time. Apparently, today, Sir Jagen wishes to have a word with us before training.

speaker: Luke
text: They'll see me as brave... and handsome, just like Kris, right?

speaker: Roderick
text: Not possible...

speaker: Katarina
text: Luke, maybe if you did something about that attitude of yours, you'd be more popular. Oh, it's time. Apparently, today, Sir Jagen wishes to have a word with us before training.

speaker: Luke
text: They'd see me as gentle and quiet, like softly falling rain! Just like Kris, right?

speaker: Ryan
text: Umm... If you say so?

speaker: Katarina
text: Luke, maybe if you did something about that attitude of yours, you'd be more popular. Oh, it's time. Apparently, today, Sir Jagen wishes to have a word with us before training.

speaker: Luke
text: N-no, let's not actually. The girls would run away in fear if I had Kris's hairdo...

speaker: Kris
text: ...How rude! What's wrong with my hair, exactly?

speaker: Katarina
text: I-I think your hair looks great, Kris... Oh, it's time. Apparently, today, Sir Jagen wishes to have a word with us before training.

speaker: Jagen
text: Three months have passed since you first came here. During this time, I've witnessed many a platoon desert because they couldn't stomach the harsh training. Not to mention platoons that failed due to miserable results... Of all who remain, there are only twenty names.

speaker: Katarina
text: Eep, the requirements are incredibly strict!

speaker: Kris
text: True. But we still remain in the game. That's what matters. As long as we keep working hard...

speaker: Jagen
text: From now on, the practical training will be far more gruelling. As such, we will be introducing lectures to advise you.

speaker: Kris
text: Lectures?

speaker: Frey
text: I am Frey, the knight in charge of lecturing. In my lectures, you will learn essential knowledge that all knights should possess.

speaker: Jagen
text: From here on, this is the real thing. Prepare to be pushed to your limits.

speaker: Frey
text: Now, firstly, I'll talk about the preparations you need to make before a battle. Before you fight your enemy on the battlefield, you must ensure that you are sufficiently prepared.

speaker: Frey
text: Selecting those who will fight, organizing their weapons and items... Kris, you will do all these things, as part of your role as commander.

speaker: Kris
text: I understand. I'll do my best.

speaker: Frey
text: One more important thing: Pay attention to party members who wish to speak with you. Talking to your party members will often yield tactical advice. The more stars displayed, the more important a conversation is. When you come to a new battlefield, it's always a good idea to check if anybody has something to say.

speaker: Cain
text: Well then, let us begin today's mock battle. From here on, I will prepare an instructor based on your performances until now. The 7th Platoon's opponent, today, is...

speaker: Draug
text: I am Draug, armor knight of Altea. Your opponent is none other than me.

speaker: Katarina
text: Draug is an armor knight famed for his sturdy defense. Kris, he'll be a formidable enemy.

speaker: Draug
text: These soldiers are your opponents. You must defeat all of them if you wish to fight me.

speaker: Cain
text: Well then, let's begin today's practical training! Your opponents from here on will be the toughest yet, so show me that fighting spirit of yours! The 7th Platoon's opponent, today, is...

speaker: Ogma
text: I will serve as your opponent.

speaker: Katarina
text: What? We-we have to fight Ogma...? Kris, Ogma is a hero from the last war... He'll make for a formidable enemy.

speaker: Ogma
text: The soldiers here will be your opponents, first. If you defeat all of them, I'll step up to fight.

speaker: Cecil
text: Huff... puff... I-I made it. Hey, where's this Commander Kris person?

speaker: Kris
text: That would be me, but who are you?

speaker: Cecil
text: I'm Cecil, a junior knight like you! I know it's very sudden, but I was invited by Katarina to join your group.

speaker: Kris
text: ...Very sudden indeed. But, the more the merrier. Could we talk after the battle?

speaker: Cecil
text: Sure, I'm glad you understand. Oh yeah, I brought along some strong weapons that Katarina prepared for you! Just give me the orders and I'll give you them to replace your worn out ones.

speaker: Draug
text: You're not bad at all. But I won't be beaten so easily.

speaker: Ogma
text: Not bad. As promised, I will fight.

speaker: Draug
text: I keep hearing about your abilities. Please, allow me to judge for myself whether or not you're the real deal.

speaker: Draug
text: S-so you managed to penetrate my armor...

speaker: Ogma
text: Don't think of this as simply training. Come at me without restraint!

speaker: Ogma
text: ...Not bad. That's quite some skill you've got.

speaker: Draug
text: How...? Even my defense couldn't withstand such a tremendous onslaught. Commander Kris, if you have need of an armor knight's strength, you may call on me.

speaker: Katarina
text: We did it, Kris! Good job!

speaker: Ogma
text: Such great power. Looks like Altea is blessed with good knights. Kris, if you have need of my power you need only ask.

speaker: Katarina
text: We did it, Kris! Good job!

speaker: Katarina
text: Excuse me, Kris, do you have a moment?

speaker: Kris
text: Huh? Of course. What is it?

speaker: Katarina
text: That Royal Guard position that Prince Marth offered us. Did you think about it? I... I'd like to be a Royal Guard, if you're in with me. Together, we'd be an unstoppable team... When I imagine a future like that, I feel very happy. ...Um, what about you, Kris? Do you, perhaps, feel the same as I...?

speaker: Kris
text: Um, I'm sorry. I haven't really thought about it yet...

speaker: Katarina
text: ...I-is that so? Yes, I... So it was just me after all... I'm sorry. Good night, Kris.

speaker: Kris
text: Yeah, I think it would be nice.

speaker: Kris
text: Yes, of course.

speaker: Katarina
text: R-really? I'm so glad... Well, this is a little awkward... I should get to bed. Good night, Kris. Good luck for tomorrow.

speaker: Kris
text: Sire, am I glad to see you!

speaker: Marth
text: Kris! Thank goodness. Is everyone else okay?

speaker: Kris
text: Yes, everyone who survived is here.

speaker: Marth
text: Amazing. I don't know how you all managed to escape that onslaught...

speaker: Kris
text: We were most fortunate. A sandstorm was brewing as we were making our escape... Thanks to the obscuring sands, the enemy lost sight of us, and we were able to escape with ease. Even during normal battles, I seem to have lucky moments like that.

speaker: Marth
text: I see. Kris, you must be loved by the goddess of fortune.

speaker: Kris
text: It would be my honor.

speaker: Kris
text: Your thoughts are mine. But somehow we were able to shake off the enemy and escape.

speaker: Marth
text: I see. Thank you, Kris.

speaker: Kris
text: Me neither. The way was blocked by earth and sand, and we lost our way as well... B-but somehow... Somehow we escaped.

speaker: Marth
text: How horrible for you... Even during normal battles, Kris, unlucky things always seem to befall you. I have to wonder if the goddess of fortune hates you?

speaker: Kris
text: It would certainly seem that way...

speaker: Michalis
text: Minerva, if you wait in this village, you will most certainly run into Marth. I don't like him, but he is indeed noble. Join forces with him.

speaker: Minerva
text: Brother, what are you going to do now? Won't you come with me...?

speaker: Michalis
text: I have no intention of doing that. I only wish to find Maria and bring her home to Macedon.

speaker: Minerva
text: You've changed, Brother... Or should I say, you've returned to how you used to be. As I thought, back then you were being controlled by Gharnef's dark magic.

speaker: Michalis
text: No, no magic could bend my will. I wished to crush the arrogant Archanea, and establish Macedonian supremacy over this continent. But Father, without bending his ear to me, distanced himself from me and later had me banished.

speaker: Minerva
text: Are you saying that's why you murdered Father? What a fool you were... Didn't you realize that was Gharnef's plotting all along? Yes, Father was strict with you. But it was only because he loved you. Why couldn't you see that?

speaker: Michalis
text: Enough, Minerva. Do you take me for a fool? After I was defeated, I wandered the gap between life and death. When I had come to, in front of me, I was Maria--her eyes full of tears--praying to the gods. While I treated her like a pawn, Maria, she shed tears for me... Minerva, I'm going now. I have to save Maria. At least that can be my atonement!

speaker: Minerva
text: Michalis...

speaker: Kris
text: Sire. How shall we proceed from here?

speaker: Marth
text: Hmm... I want to go home to Altea, but if we can't prevail against Hardin, then we can't go back. What in the world are we supposed to do...?

speaker: Kris
text: We need to find out the secret of the strange power that's protecting Hardin. Forgive me, sire. As your Royal Guard, I was supposed to strike down your foes...

speaker: Marth
text: No, it's not your fault, Kris. I too felt a strange presence emanating from Hardin, almost like...

speaker: Jagen
text: Sire, it's an emergency! I have just come into some new information. The Khadein mage corps has launched an offensive against us.

speaker: Marth
text: What!? Even Khadein means to be our enemy... Merric, what are you...

speaker: Kris
text: Sir Jagen, what should we do?

speaker: Jagen
text: At this rate, it seems we have no choice. Sire, we need to break into the sanctuary, but you must be prepared to make sacrifices. If we don't hurry, Archanea's pursuit force will reach our rear and we'll be trapped.

speaker: Marth
text: I understand. We've no choice. Everyone, let's break into the sanctuary! But avoid needless fights if possible!

speaker: Jagen
text: An update, sire! The Archanea army is, at present, approaching from the south.

speaker: Marth
text: I see. Hasten the march; don't let them catch up!

speaker: Astram
text: Do not think you can escape, Alteans. I'll turn this desert into your graveyard.

speaker: Soldier
