text: Do not think you can escape, Alteans. We will avenge Captain Astram!

speaker: Villager
text: A swordslayer will demonstrate your might against a mercenary or a hero. You should definitely get one if you can.

speaker: Villager
text: From here on north, you won't see no more shops. If you're going that way, you should stock up now.

speaker: Villager
text: The person commanding Khadein's mage corps is a young man named Arlen. He's not a bad man, but he can be a bit uncooperative. Seems he regards his old rival, Merric, with disdain. Hmm... I reckon only Lord Wendell could talk some sense into him.

speaker: Marth
text: Huh? Princess Minerva, why are you here?

speaker: Minerva
text: My brother... Michalis, he helped me.

speaker: Marth
text: Really? That's good to hear. I was so worried once I heard that Prince Michalis had taken you. But, for him to rescue you: what in the world happened?

speaker: Minerva
text: Maria saved Michalis's life. She's kind, unlike myself... Maria's kindness was able to touch the heart of even a man like Michalis.

speaker: Marth
text: But, isn't that what you wanted? That's why you deliberately avoided killing Michalis. Am I wrong, Princess?

speaker: Marth
text: I can understand. No one can sever the ties between family so easily. Princess, please lift your spirits. I would like you to fight with us again, just like before. I would like Macedon's strength and yours in order to put a stop to Hardin's designs.

speaker: Marth
text: You're... Etzel! Why are you here?

speaker: Etzel
text: I have my ties to Khadein as well. "Prince Marth has succumbed to his ambitions and invaded Archanea." When I was told that, there was no way I could sit still!

speaker: Etzel
text: But... No matter how I put it, I just couldn't imagine you'd become that sort of person. Prince Marth, you said to me long ago that you wanted to let the era of war end. Do you still stand by those words?

speaker: Marth
text: Yes, I do. I do not seek to fight.

speaker: Etzel
text: ...I see. I, too, do not seek as such. Allow me to join you once more.

speaker: Etzel
text: I don't want to fight you, but I owe Khadein. What a troublesome ordeal I am in...

speaker: Etzel
text: This war... will... someday...

speaker: Yodel
text: I will not forgive intruders upon our holy sanctuary! Earth, show your fury! Bolganone!!

speaker: Yodel
text: Arlen... Was this really what you wanted...?

speaker: Jagen
text: The atmosphere inside the building seems somewhat strange.

speaker: Marth
text: Indeed, something seems to be happening. Kris, Merric's inside there. You met him during your training, right?

speaker: Kris
text: Yes. Sir Merric really helped us with his magical prowess. So Sir Merric is here... We must hurry, sire.

speaker: Marth
text: Yes, let's go!

speaker: Jagen
text: Kris, it's been decided that we're going to war with Archanea. Archanea will not be an easy opponent. They have one of the most powerful militaries on the continent.

speaker: Kris
text: We're ready to face anything, sir. Although... we still lack experience, I admit. We have to grow stronger...

speaker: Jagen
text: Indeed. Kris, are you aware of the "drill grounds" that operate across the continent?

speaker: Kris
text: Drill grounds, sir?

speaker: Jagen
text: It costs a bit of money, but if you go practice in one, you can get stronger. It might be a good idea to let our more inexperienced men have a go.

speaker: Toras
text: Commander Lang. The... A-Altean army has arrived...

speaker: Lang
text: You moron. Why are you so panicked? With their nation and name in ruins, the Alteans are of no consequence to us.

speaker: Toras
text: But, Sir Jeorge's archers left to quell the rebellion. Can we win with just our troops?

speaker: Lang
text: Why didn't you tell me earlier? Call Jeorge back to the castle this instant! While you're there, find that hired sword, Navarre, and bring him here. General Toras! I'm heading inside. You will defend this location till your last breath. Do NOT let the enemy get close. Do I make myself clear?!

speaker: Soldier
text: Captain Jeorge. We've received orders to return to the castle immediately.

speaker: Jeorge
text: Orders from Lang, huh? I'm not fond of that man. His treatment of our people is simply intolerable. To work beneath him is an insult. Pay his orders no mind.

speaker: Soldier
text: But, Captain! You'll be accused of treason! Captain?! You can't be planning to defect to Altea...

speaker: Jeorge
text: No, that's not an option. If I were to defect now, I'd drag the entire platoon down with me. So for that reason alone, I will absolutely not take any risks that might besmirch our name.

speaker: Soldier
text: Captain Jeorge...

speaker: Jeorge
text: Anyway, inform everyone: Do not move from your stations. However, if the enemy approaches, you may engage them.

speaker: Villager
text: Y'know, lately I haven't seen that mercenary, Samuel. I thought that he might have joined your ranks, but I guess not... He's as lax as they get, but you can't go wrong with his skill.

speaker: Villager
text: Oh, Alteans, hear our plea! Please, defeat General Lang! As long as that man lives, peace is but a fleeting dream.

speaker: Elder
text: Ohh, if isn't Prince Marth! I wonder how my granddaughter Lena is faring, hm? What, you don't know? I see... Th-then... Do you still want this Hammerne staff? At least, if Lena's pupil Marisha were around, I'm sure she could use it... Well, whatever be the case, I've no use for a souvenir. Please, make good use of it.

speaker: Bandit
text: Whoo! Ready, boys? Look at all the ruckus! Never a better time to attack that buncha villages!

speaker: Julian
text: Hey, Rickard! I see you haven't tired of stealin'.

speaker: Rickard
text: Ah! Chief! How nice to see ya. Well, I was plannin' on workin' with you and makin' loadsa money, but you had to go and quit the business! Fallin' head over heels for that beautiful cleric, and then dumpin' me... That's just too cruel! Did our love really mean that little to you?

speaker: Julian
text: Can it, you little fink!! People'll get the wrong idea about us, if you keep talkin' like that. Anyway, forget about thievin' and come with me to fight for justice.

speaker: Rickard
text: Hmm... alright then! I'll follow you anywhere. I do adore ya, Chief!

speaker: Ogma
text: Long time no see, Barst.

speaker: Barst
text: Captain Ogma! Why are you here...?

speaker: Ogma
text: Another war has started. Once again, I fight under Prince Marth's banner. Barst, lend us your strength. We need you.

speaker: Barst
text: I got nothing to do with fighting now... Well, that's what I would say if you were anyone else. Captain, I owe you. You've saved our sorry asses on more occasions than one. Captain Ogma. Just say the word. I'll do whatever you want!

speaker: Bord
text: Barst! What're you doin' in a place like this?!

speaker: Barst
text: Bord? It's been a while. Fighting's a thing of the past for me. I'm just an ordinary woodcutter now. Move along; nothing to see here.

speaker: Bord
text: Don't be an idiot. Doncha know? This is Prince Marth's fight. If you ignore his plea, you're a disgrace to the Talysian Mercenaries. Tell me you're no disgrace.

speaker: Barst
text: ...... You know, all I really want is to live in peace... I suppose I can't just kick back, and chop my wood, with this damn war going on. This needs to end quickly.

speaker: Bord
text: Oh yeah! That's my bro!

speaker: Barst
text: Yeah, I'll join too. Tell Prince Marth for me.

speaker: Cord
text: Barst! What're you doin' here?!

speaker: Barst
text: Bord? Long time no see.

speaker: Cord
text: I'm not Bord! I'm Cord! You of all people should know that!

speaker: Barst
text: It was a joke! Sorry. Look, Cord, I know you came out all this way... But I've got nothing to do with war no more. I'm an ordinary woodcutter now. Just ignore me.

speaker: Cord
text: Don't be stupid. Doncha know? Prince Marth's fighting again. If you ignore his plea, you're a disgrace to the Talysian Mercenaries. You wanna be a disgrace, is that it?

speaker: Barst
text: ...... You know, all I really want is to live in peace... I suppose I can't just kick back, and chop my wood, with this damn war going on. This needs to end quickly.

speaker: Cord
text: Heh! That's my bro.

speaker: Barst
text: Yeah, I'll join too. Tell Prince Marth for me.

speaker: Jeorge
text: You wouldn't have needed to die if you hadn't come so close...

speaker: Jeorge
text: Fools...

speaker: Rickard
text: Chief, where aaare ya?

speaker: Rickard
text: Tch. Man, I messed up big time.

speaker: Barst
text: Oi, quit it! I don't want to get involved in no war!

speaker: Barst
text: Damn it... What a world...

speaker: Toras
text: Projection 44.5 degrees! Fiiiire!!!

speaker: Toras
text: General Lang... Altea is too strong...

speaker: Jagen
text: Sire, we've finally seized control of Grust. However, a number of enemies are concealed within the castle. Our job here is far from over.

speaker: Marth
text: Yes, I know. Lang must be stopped here and now. Or else we forsake the people of Grust.

speaker: Kris
text: Sire. I, too, do not intend to let him go. Say the word and with these very hands...

speaker: Jagen
text: This is Lang we are talking about. We don't know what he's planning. Kris, we must take extra caution when fighting inside the castle!

speaker: Marth
text: This is the Ice Dragons' Temple. Anri's final destination...

speaker: Gotoh
text: Prince Marth, can you hear me? Come to the front of the center room. I shall await you there.

speaker: Gotoh
text: What!? You found all the shards? Thank you, then the Starsphere can be restored. Please wait a moment...

speaker: Gotoh
text: Marth, this is the Starsphere. You can take this with you as well.

speaker: Marth
text: Huh? Gotoh, why are you giving such an important item to me?

speaker: Gotoh
text: The only person that can restore the Shield of Seals is you... The Shield, itself, has chosen you.

speaker: Gotoh
text: You still don't understand? The Emblem shield you're carrying is the stolen Shield of Seals. To be honest, it was only recently that I noticed; its exterior had completely changed... After stealing it from the Fane of Raman, the thief removed its jewels and sold them off as treasures. The money was used to fund an army, which, along with three stolen weapons, was used to conquer the world. The thief that went on to become the king of Archanea had the shield, which brought him such good fortune, it became the emblem of his royal family. Now do you understand, Marth? It is what you are carrying, Archanea's Fire Emblem.

speaker: Marth
text: !! What... ...The first king of Archanea was originally a thief!? Is that true...? In that case, I can kind of understand the curse of the Fire Emblem... Then, Gotoh... If I can collect all five orbs, can I restore the Shield of Seals?

speaker: Gotoh
text: Mmm... But please hurry up. The shield has already been broken for 600 years... It is almost time for the Earth Dragons, sealed underneath Macedon, to awaken from their slumber. Those evil Earth Dragons number several hundreds... No, several thousands. Once they awaken there will be nothing that we can do... I will leave Tiki in your care. You can find her in the room to the right. That Divine Dragon child should be able to help you battle the Earth Dragons. But, I will state clearly, if the Shield of Seals is not restored, Tiki will be destroyed.

speaker: Marth
text: Huh...!? Why is that...

speaker: Gotoh
text: That child is still developing. Without the Shield of Seals she will begin to degenerate. Eventually she will become wild and attack humans. I made her sleep, because I felt sad for her. But, if the Shield of Seals is restored I will no longer have to worry, because the shield will protect Tiki. Marth, please take care of Tiki. You must rescue that child from the path of ruin.

speaker: Gotoh
text: Is that so. You couldnt find them all... Theres nothing you can do about it... Please hand your collected shards to me. Tiki is sleeping in the room to the right. But since the shield isnt restored, I cant let you see her. That child is still developing. Without the Shield of Seals she will begin to degenerate. Eventually she will become wild and attack humans. I cannot allow Tiki to awaken again. It is for her own good... Marth, once youve obtained all the treasures, head to the room to the left. I will be waiting for you...

speaker: Marth
text: Tiki!? Are you alright...

speaker: Tiki
text: Uh...

speaker: Marth
text: Tiki, it's me, Marth. Hey, open your eyes!

speaker: Tiki
text: ...Marth... .....! Oh Marth!! You came! You came to see Tiki!!

speaker: Marth
text: Yes, I hadn't seen Tiki in a long time. Are you feeling well?

speaker: Tiki
text: Uh... No. The bishop told me that I had to sleep again. But I don't want to... Because when I sleep I'm always alone. During my sleep, I dreamt many nightmares. There, I became a wild dragon, like those poor Fire Dragons and Ice Dragons. I attacked humans, and I killed them. No... No... When I awoke I was all alone in the dark room... I felt so strange, but also very scared... So very scared... But I couldn't leave that room. I cried many times, and then Uncle Bantu would come to comfort me as usual. One day he took me away, and took me to a human village. Living in that village was very fun, and everybody treated me well... In the short time, until I was discovered by Gharnef, I felt really happy. I don't want to sleep anymore... I feel that if I close my eyes once more, I will be unable to open them ever again. I don't want that. I want to live with everyone, I don't want to sleep again!

speaker: Marth
text: Tiki, it's alright now. I will protect you, so don't cry...

speaker: Tiki
text: Really...? I won't need to see those scary dreams again!?

speaker: Marth
text: That's right! Once the shield is restored, Tiki can live together with the rest of us. Don't worry, believe in me!

speaker: Tiki
text: Ah! I'm so happy!! Thank you, Marth!

speaker: Tiki
text: Huh...? Who... who are you...?

speaker: Tiki
text: ...Ah... Mar...Mar...

speaker: Gotoh
text: I see... So Tiki was pretty happy. It must have been very painful for her. Though it was to protect her, I was far too cruel to her. I suspect she must really hate me... You should go, Marth. I will send you to Altea with my powers.

speaker: Gotoh
text: You should go, Marth. I will send you to Altea with my powers.

speaker: Marth
text: Lord Gotoh, why don't you come with us?

speaker: Gotoh
text: Hmm... At the moment I've one thing I must still investigate. Gharnef has returned.

speaker: Marth
text: Gharnef...!? But we killed him!

speaker: Gotoh
text: Yes, you killed his body. But his soul was held prisoner by the Darksphere, and within it, his hatred only grew. Afterwards, his former disciples--the heretic bishops--resurrected him. And they seem to be planning something foul.

speaker: Marth
text: I see. Very well, Lord Gotoh. We shall split ways here.

speaker: Gotoh
text: Indeed. If I find something, then I too will visit Altea afterwards. I'm counting on you, Marth. Everything rests on your shoulders. You must save both our races from the path of destruction.

speaker: Kris
text: ...Altea, home at last. Though you may be occupied by Archanea... I will get you back, I swear.

speaker: Xane
text: Boy, what a serious lady. Hey, Kris. You said you're Marth's Royal Guard, right?

speaker: Kris
text: Yes. My mission is to protect Prince Marth.

speaker: Xane
text: I see. But if you really plan on protectin' him, then you need the strength to match your conviction. Hey, do you wanna know a way to get stronger?

speaker: Kris
text: Hm? You know of a way?

speaker: Kris
text: ...At long last, Altea. My dearest home... Archanean occupation be damned; I will get you back, I swear it!

speaker: Xane
text: Boy, what a serious fella. Hey, Kris. You said you're Marth's Royal Guard, right?

speaker: Kris
text: Yes. My mission is to protect Prince Marth at all costs.

speaker: Xane
text: I see. But if you really plan on protectin' him, then you're gonna need the strength to back up your conviction. Hey, do you wanna know a way to get stronger?

speaker: Kris
text: Huh? Do you know how to?

speaker: Xane
text: 'Course, just hold on a second.

speaker: Xane
text: Ta-da! Kris, you know about Tiki, right? Tiki's still a kid, but the real reason she can fight is because of her hairstyle and tiara.

speaker: Kris
text: Wait, what?! Are you serious?!

speaker: Xane
text: Yeah, if you wear your hair like this, then you'll be that much stronger. So all you gotta do is wear this tiara, and wear your hair like Tiki. If you do that, then a legendary power will flow through you! ...Well, maybe. So? Do you wanna give it a try?

speaker: Kris
text: Sure, why not?

speaker: Xane
text: Alrighty then. I'll be sure to do this properly.

speaker: Kris
text: Thank you, Sir Xane!

speaker: Xane
text: ......You aren't doubting me? Is this trust or naivete...?

speaker: Kris
text: Is something the matter, Sir Xane?

speaker: Xane
text: Ah, no, it's nothin'. Well, see you around. I'm looking forward to your new look!

speaker: Kris
text: No, that's quite alright. I want to protect Prince Marth with my own strength.

speaker: Xane
text: Hmm, that so? Boring.

speaker: Kris
text: Huh? What do you mean "boring"?

speaker: Xane
text: Ah, no, it's nothin'. Catch you later!

speaker: Cain
text: Kris's 7th Platoon! You have fought valiantly thus far. It has been a joy being your instructor!

speaker: Jagen
text: Frey, Cain; I have heard reports from both of them. Though your individual strengths vary, there exists no doubt of your excellence. Thus, today we will hold your final practical exam. Make sure that you are thoroughly prepared.

speaker: Cain
text: The final preparations have been made! We are now ready to begin! Your opponent in the final exam shall be...

speaker: Cain
text: Myself: Cain, knight of Altea! I'll show you the sort of battle that real knights face!

speaker: Est
text: Est, ex-Whitewing of Macedon, at your service. I won't go easy on you!

speaker: Cain
text: You have come well prepared. But you must be wary that the enemies you see are not always your only ones!

speaker: Est
text: I can tell that you aspire to be something great. But you'd better not think that your only enemies are those that you can see.

speaker: Cain
text: Now! Reinforcements, attack!

speaker: Est
text: Now! Reinforcements, attack!

speaker: Cain
text: Here we go! Give it your all!

speaker: Cain
text: Impressive...!

speaker: Est
text: Here I come! I wonder, can you keep up with me?

speaker: Est
text: So... so strong...

speaker: Cain
text: Congratulations, you won! There is nothing more we can teach you.

speaker: Est
text: As I thought...It pains me to say this, but you were really strong. I don't think you can call yourselves apprentices any more!

speaker: Jagen
text: Hm. Well then, Kris's 7th Platoon; I will announce the results of the second half of your training right here, right now. As before, your score depends on the amount of companions who were forced to make an early exit. Listen carefully. Your performance has been...

speaker: Jagen
text: Most impressive! Even amongst the past Altean knights, there has not been a group with such high credentials as yours! Therefore...

speaker: Jagen
text: Ahem, not bad! Compared to other aspiring knights in the past, you have done very well. And so...

speaker: Jagen
text: Hmm... This is extremely difficult for me to say. You have many injured... But you deserve credit for winning all your battles until now. Therefore...

speaker: Jagen
text: Kris's 7th Platoon, I have decided that you have passed your final test!

speaker: Ryan
text: We passed... So that means we're...

speaker: Luke
text: Alright, we did it! We can become knights!

speaker: Cecil
text: We did it. After this, I'm going to buy myself a nice sword, and a hefty lance... Oooh, it's getting me excited just thinking about it! Heh heh heh heh...

speaker: Roderick
text: ...Cecil, you're scaring me. But you're not alone in excitement. My lifelong dream has at last been realized.

speaker: Katarina
text: Everyone looks so happy. I guess it's because we're all to be knights! We really did it, Kris.

speaker: Kris
text: Yeah. It was my grandfather's and my own dearest wish to become an Altean knight. I can now work for Altea and serve Prince Marth. So I've all the reason to be happy.

speaker: Katarina
text: Indeed. I'm happy too...

speaker: Katarina
text: ...... Ah, Kris. What are you doing up so late at night?

speaker: Kris
text: I can't seem to sleep. What about you, Katarina?

speaker: Katarina
text: I... well... There's a lot on my mind, I suppose. ...Kris, have I ever told you about the town I was born in?

speaker: Kris
text: Now that you mention it, you're never told me anything about your hometown. It wasn't Altea?

speaker: Katarina
text: I was born in a town called Knorda. Have you ever heard of it? I... know it all too well. In Knorda, I was treated like an animal, beaten for fun. Whenever I couldn't stand the pain, I'd just close my eyes and think of nothing, taking refuge within my heart's confines...

speaker: Kris
text: Katarina...

speaker: Katarina
text: ...But someone was there to save me. She showed me the meaning of life. I felt that I would do anything for her. Kris, do you have someone like that in your life?

speaker: Kris
text: Yes. To remain loyal to a lord: that's the sort of knight I aim to be.

speaker: Katarina
text: Yes, that's right. You're also doing it for someone else... Not long now, is it...? It won't be long until we become Altean knights. When that happens... ......... Good night, Kris.

speaker: Kris
text: Well then, time to get some rest...

speaker: Katarina
text: U-um, Kris! I'm sorry, I forgot one thing... Please take this, if you would.

speaker: Kris
text: What's this? A headband?

speaker: Katarina
text: It's from Cecil. "Give this to the new platoon commander," she said. Supposedly if you wear this, you'll be more... "psyched". Cecil really wants you to wear it.

speaker: Kris
text: So once I put this on, I'll have a hairstyle like Cecil's? But will being like Cecil really suit me?

speaker: Katarina
text: I'm sure it would. Oh, I know! How about you just try it on? If you try it and it feels a little strange, you can just go back to your original hairstyle.

speaker: Kris
text: Oh, good point...

speaker: Katarina
text: Well, how about it? Want to change your hairstyle?

speaker: Kris
text: Alright, let's give it a try. It'll be fun becoming like Cecil.

speaker: Katarina
text: Wonderful! Cecil is sure to be stoked. I look forward to seeing your new look. See you tomorrow then, Kris.

speaker: Kris
text: No, let's stop here. My hairstyle is fine as it is.

speaker: Katarina
text: Oh, is that so? That's too bad. I was looking forward to see your new look, too... Ah, I'll go return this then. See you tomorrow, Kris.

speaker: Kris
text: Alright, let's give it a try. I'll try arranging my hair so that it's like Cecil's.

speaker: Katarina
text: Wonderful! Cecil is sure to be happy with your decision. I look forward to seeing your new look. See you tomorrow then, Kris.

speaker: Kris
text: No, I think I'm alright. My hairstyle is fine as it is.

speaker: Katarina
text: Oh, is that so? That's too bad. I was looking forward to see your new look, too... Ah, I'll go return this then. See you tomorrow, Kris.

speaker: Eremiya
text: So the Altean army has reclaimed Altea Castle. Master Gharnef is rightfully livid...

speaker: Katarina
text: Lady Eremiya...

speaker: Eremiya
text: And yet, Eine. All you can do is stand there, doing nothing. Are you not ashamed of being alive? To die for my sake-- is that not the natural recourse?

speaker: Eremiya
text: Eine, you are worthless trash. There is no value in your life. You're a child the world never wanted. Tell me, who was it that saved you? Who should you thank for allowing your wretched existence to continue?

speaker: Katarina
text: It's all thanks... to you, Lady Eremiya.

speaker: Eremiya
text: Kill them.

speaker: Katarina
text: But... Lady Eremiya...! I... sniff...

speaker: Eremiya
text: Silence, worthless puppet. You cannot defy my orders. That's what I've "taught" you since you were little. The words I engraved upon your then-young soul will remain there, forever.

speaker: Katarina
text: ...Sniff... sniff...

speaker: Eremiya
text: O-hoh hoh! I'll use you until you break. My little puppet...

speaker: Kris
text: Katarina...

speaker: Katarina
text: Kris... Prince Marth...

speaker: Marth
text: Katarina, if you have reasons, I would like to hear them. I'm sure we can settle this, without resorting to fighting.

speaker: Katarina
text: ...I'm sorry. I... I have no choice but to do this.

speaker: Kris
text: Katarina...

speaker: Katarina
text: Kris. I... had a dream. It was short... but it was a very happy dream. Kris, you and I... Both of us became Royal Guards... We saved many people, received many thanks... And then, the two of us... Kris... I... I'm sorry... I'm talking nonsense. There's no going back for me. ...Let us resume our battle, Kris.

speaker: Katarina
text: Kris... There's nothing left for us to say. You and I are enemies... Please fight me. If you don't, I'll kill you...

speaker: Kris
text: Katarina! Listen to me.

speaker: Katarina
text: Kris... Why? Why do you refuse to fight...? You must know that you'll die if you don't kill me... And yet, why do you hesitate...?

speaker: Kris
text: Because you're my friend.

speaker: Kris
text: You can't have forgotten: Our days training as knights... The times we fought together with Luke, Rody, Ryan and Cecille... "Together, we'd be an unstoppable team"... That's what you told me.

speaker: Katarina
text: Kris, that's a wonderful name. We're here for the same reason, then. My name is Katarina. I came because I wish to serve Prince Marth.

speaker: Katarina
text: Thank goodness... Kris, you won. I knew you could do it.

speaker: Katarina
text: I... I'd like be a Royal Guard, if you're in with me.. Together, we'd be an unstoppable team... When I imagine a future like that, I feel very happy. ...Um, what about you, Kris? Do you, perhaps, feel the same as I...?

speaker: Katarina
text: That was... That was all... a lie. Everything I did was to deceive you... It was all just a ruse... The truth is... I don't care about you...

speaker: Kris
text: If that's the case... Then why are you crying, now?

speaker: Kris
text: Katarina. You don't belong there. You want to fight alongside me, for Prince Marth. I'm certain of it.

speaker: Katarina
text: It's... too late for that. I've committed too many unforgivable sins...

speaker: Kris
text: Then, you'll just have to start atoning for them. It won't be easy. Many people from both Altea and your organization will turn you a cold shoulder... But, I can promise you this. No matter what happens... I'll stand by your side.

speaker: Katarina
text: Kris...

speaker: Kris
text: Return to us, Katarina.

speaker: Katarina
text: ...Sob... sob... ...Kris... Kris... Kris...!

speaker: Katarina
text: I am a puppet... I exist only to serve Lady Eremiya... My life has no value...

speaker: Katarina
text: Thank... you... ... Now I... won't have to hurt Kris... anymore... Kris... I'm... glad I could meet you... During those days of training... you showed me a beautiful, happy dream... Hey, Kris... Today's training... is about to begin... Look, there's Prince Marth and the others... Don't... wait for me... ... ...

speaker: Katarina
text: ...Prince Marth, I have committed many unforgivable sins. Please, hand me punishment... worthy of my crimes. Please execute me...

speaker: Marth
text: Raise your head, Katarina. I have no intention of taking your life.

speaker: Katarina
text: But... why? I don't deserve to live. Please let me atone with my death...

speaker: Marth
text: That's no atonement. You're just running from your sins.

speaker: Marth
text: If you truly regret what you've done, then live. I want you to atone with your life, not your death.

speaker: Katarina
text: Atone with my life...? But, how? What should I do...? How could I even begin to atone?

speaker: Marth
text: I cannot give you that answer. Until now, you've only followed orders, never thinking for yourself. But that's going to change now. You will think for yourself, and find your own answer. That is my punishment to you.

speaker: Katarina
text: Prince Marth...

speaker: Marth
text: Kris... I've forced you to play a painful role. I won't forgive the villain who led her to this path. Let's go, Kris.

speaker: Jagen
text: The 7th Platoon and its commander, Kris, are all present and accounted for, yes? From today forth, you will train together as a team in your bid to become fully-fledged knights. The first half of your training will focus on developing your practical skills. Without further ado, I will introduce the senior knight who is to be your instructor.

speaker: Cain
text: I am Cain, the knight in charge of your practical training! To hone your practical skills, we will have a contest in the form of combat. If you let your guard down, it won't be just an injury you'll be walking home with!

speaker: Jagen
text: Even amongst the Altean knights, Cain is one of our strongest men. You must all become strong enough to earn his approval.

speaker: Cain
text: Well then, let's begin today's training! Your enemies will consist of us Altean knights, as well as brave warriors whom I am proud to call friends. The opponents are determined by the ability of each platoon. 7th Platoon, your opponent is...

speaker: Caeda
text: My squires, my friends; please go easy on me.

speaker: Katarina
text: Oh, it's Princess Caeda! Prince Marth's fiancee! She's so pretty... I feel nervous at the thought of fighting her...

speaker: Caeda
text: Let us see if you've got the ability. Talys's mercenaries shall fight you first.

speaker: Caeda
text: I see you know how to fight well. In that case, I will fight you next.

speaker: Caeda
text: Fear won't help you; approach with confidence and the intent to fight.

speaker: Caeda
text: You're a mercenary, aren't you...? Tee hee. This looks promising. Come, show me what you can do with your sword!

speaker: Caeda
text: An armored knight... I'll be at a disadvantage with the way that I fight. But I won't lose so easily! Come, show me what you've got!

speaker: Caeda
text: You're a cavalier, huh? Looks like you'll be a good match for me. Come, show me what you've got!

speaker: Caeda
text: So you're a fighter, Kris? Of the lance and the axe, the axe is advantageous... I might be at a slight disadvantage, but I won't lose easily! Come, show me what you've got!

speaker: Caeda
text: Kris, you're an archer!? The bane of us pegasus knights... B-but I will not sit idly by and lose to you! Show me everything you have!

speaker: Caeda
text: So you're a mage, Kris? Pegasus knights are resistant to magic, you know. I'm not going to lose this one. Come, show me what you've got!

speaker: Caeda
text: Kris, you're a myrmidon, huh? Teehee. I feel somewhat drawn to you. We should be friends from now on. But that doesn't mean I'll go easy on you in this fight. Come, Kris, show me what you can do with that sword of yours!

speaker: Caeda
text: Well, well, Kris, you're a pegasus knight, just like me. Teehee. We have so much in common... But I won't go easy on you for this battle. You and your pegasus... Shall we take to the skies?

speaker: Caeda
text: Ngh...!

speaker: Caeda
text: That was a thrilling fight. You are the first squires to have bested me in combat. Promise me that you'll become knights worthy of helping Marth.

speaker: Kris
text: Of course, Princess Caeda.

speaker: Caeda
text: If you ever need help during the practical training, do call on me. And I'll fight, but as your companion.

speaker: Kris
text: Hm? We'd gladly appreciate your help, but I'm not sure if we would be allowed to.

speaker: Katarina
text: What should we do? I know, how about we ask Sir Jagen?

speaker: Jagen
text: I have no qualms about your proposal. You may borrow the help of friends if they offer as much.

speaker: Katarina
text: What a relief. I'm certain Princess Caeda will make a reliable ally.

speaker: Kris
text: But, is it really alright to rely on others? I don't see how this fits with our training...

speaker: Jagen
text: Hmph. Don't tell me you're still in the dark about Prince Marth's method of fighting in the War of Shadows?

speaker: Kris
text: Yes, I'm sorry. I'm not familiar with the details.

speaker: Jagen
text: Then I shall tell you. Our victory in the previous war was not just by merit of Altea. Gathering and fighting together with allies of various positions and statuses... This is how Prince Marth fights. No matter when an ally came to our side, they could instantly join the battle with us. That is also a necessary skill for an Altean knight.

speaker: Kris
text: I see... I understand now.

speaker: Katarina
text: If we can combine our strengths when we fight, I'm sure we can achieve anything. Right, Kris?

speaker: Kris
text: Yes, you're right.

speaker: Kris
text: No, this I know. The League led by Prince Marth didn't just consist of Altea: It went beyond the frontiers of nationality, and included friend and foe alike...

speaker: Jagen
text: Yes. Our victory was not just the accomplishment of us Altean knights. Overcoming status and position; being able to fight together as equals... That is how Prince Marth fights. No matter when an ally came to our side, they could instantly join the battle with us. That is also a necessary skill for an Altean knight.

speaker: Kris
text: I see... That will be important to our training. I understand now.

speaker: Katarina
text: If we can combine our strengths when we fight, I'm sure we can achieve anything. Right, Kris?

speaker: Kris
text: Yes, you're right.

speaker: Katarina
text: Kris, we have been designated as members of the 7th Platoon. I'm glad we were grouped together.

speaker: Kris
text: As am I. Who else do we have in our platoon?

speaker: Luke
text: I'm Luke! Or if you prefer, you can call me Luke, the Paladin of Dawn!

speaker: Roderick
text: I am Roderick. It is a pleasure to meet you. So, is that everyone?

speaker: Ryan
text: U-um... I'm a new recruit, too. My name is Ryan. I'm an archer.

speaker: Kris
text: It looks like that's all five of us. Well, what's the plan for today?

speaker: Katarina
text: There was an order from Sir Jagen. Today's mission is to decide who the new commander will be.

speaker: Roderick
text: Luke, how should we go about this?

speaker: Luke
text: Roderick, you wait at the back. I'll fight alone! It's just Kris and that kid, right? If that's all, I should be able to handle it. I'll show them my true strength.

speaker: Roderick
text: You're at it again...? Fine, have it your way. But I think underestimating your opponent will get you into trouble.

speaker: Luke
text: Commander? Gotcha! Well, I'll be commander if you guys all insist!

speaker: Roderick
text: Nobody's insisting anything, Luke...

speaker: Katarina
text: Excuse me. I'd like to recommend Kris.

speaker: Kris
text: Katarina...?

speaker: Katarina
text: Kris is a really strong individual. And he didn't abandon me during the mock combat yesterday, even though I couldn't fight.

speaker: Luke
text: Alright then, I challenge him! Kris, if you beat me, I'll cede the position to you.

speaker: Katarina
text: Huh? H-how has it come to this?

speaker: Luke
text: It's a challenge, man-to-man! Kris, you're not afraid to fight me, are you?

speaker: Katarina
text: Don't be silly. Kris won't lose to you.

speaker: Roderick
text: So we'll decide with a battle. That'll let us know who's got the skill to be commander.

speaker: Katarina
text: I'm sorry, Kris. That was selfish of me... But I couldn't stand hearing them make fun of you...

speaker: Kris
text: It's okay. When my grandfather trained me, he used to say the same thing. He said that the best way for men to understand each other is by fighting.

speaker: Katarina
text: Huh. Y-your grandfather sure sounds colorful... Anyway, our opponents are Luke and Roderick. It's been decided that Ryan will be on our team.

speaker: Ryan
text: Y-yes. I'll do my best.

speaker: Luke
text: Commander? Gotcha! Oh, what's that? Luke should be the one? Yes, I completely agree!

speaker: Roderick
text: Don't make up our words...

speaker: Katarina
text: Excuse me. I'd like to recommend Kris.

speaker: Kris
text: Katarina...?

speaker: Katarina
text: Kris is a really strong individual. And she didn't abandon me during the mock combat yesterday, even though I couldn't fight.

speaker: Luke
text: Alright then, I challenge her! Kris, if you beat me, I'll recognize you as leader.

speaker: Katarina
text: Huh? H-how has it come to this?

speaker: Luke
text: It's a challenge, man-to-man!

speaker: Kris
text: But I'm a woman...

speaker: Luke
text: Well then it's a man-to-woman challenge!! Kris, you're not afraid to fight me, are you?

speaker: Katarina
text: Don't be silly. Kris won't lose to you.

speaker: Roderick
text: So we'll decide with a battle. That'll let us know who's got the skill to be commander.

speaker: Katarina
text: I'm sorry, Kris. That was selfish of me... But I couldn't stand hearing them make fun of you...

speaker: Kris
text: It's okay. When my grandfather trained me, he used to say something similar. He said the best way for men to understand each other is by fighting. Well, I'm a girl, but...

speaker: Katarina
text: Anyway, our opponents are Luke and Roderick. It's been decided that Ryan will be on our team.

speaker: Ryan
text: Y-yes. I'll do my best.

speaker: Roderick
text: As I thought, Luke couldn't win alone. I guess I'll have to fight, too.

speaker: Luke
text: Guah...?! I-impossible... The future hero, Luke, defeated...

speaker: Roderick
text: Urgh! I see... You are even stronger than I had imagined...

speaker: Luke
text: Kris, I've heard rumors about you! Sir Jagen said that there was a recruit who stood out from the rest of us!

speaker: Kris
text: Is that so?

speaker: Luke
text: Yeah, that's right! And I bet you're hogging all the attention, overshadowing the rest of us! I'll beat you here to prove I'm the best! Prepare yourself!

speaker: Luke
text: Sorry, Kris, but I won't hold back just because you're a girl!

speaker: Kris
text: That's fine with me.

speaker: Luke
text: I'll show you what I've got! Kris, try not to fall in love with me!

speaker: Luke
text: Kiddo, just stand back and watch! Only Kris is worthy of fighting me!

speaker: Roderick
text: Kris, I've heard the rumors about you as well. I need to see your ability firsthand, especially if you're to become the commander. I ask you this, as a fellow squire of Altea.

speaker: Katarina
text: Thank goodness... Kris, you won. I knew you could do it.

speaker: Luke
text: Alright, I'm a man of my word. I'll keep my promise. From here on, the commander'll be Kris. Gah, but I don't get it! I was so confident in my skills! How did I wind up losing?!

speaker: Roderick
text: Because we didn't fight together. We took turns fighting Kris one-on-one. That's why we lost to him/her.

speaker: Ryan
text: Yeah, my brother once said the same thing... Even if we are weak individually, we can become stronger by working together with our friends.

speaker: Kris
text: That's right. Fighting with your friends: That is the way of an Altean knight.

speaker: Luke
text: ...I see. I thought I could be the victor through my strength alone. But I guess I was wrong. Fighting together is far more important...

speaker: Katarina
text: Luke... I'm so glad. You understand now.

speaker: Luke
text: Yeah, it's all clear to me! It looks like being the leader is more trouble than it's worth! So I'll leave this bothersome job to Kris! I'm sure it'll be a joy working under him/her! Kris, I'll be looking forward to your help!

speaker: Katarina
text: ...Does he really get it?

speaker: Luke
text: Alright then, Kris! Now that you're the commander, how about I give you a cool title?

speaker: Kris
text: A title?

speaker: Luke
text: Yeah. All the legendary heroes have their own awesome title! Hm, let's see... Looking at your eyes... It's got to be Kris the Ordinary!

speaker: Kris
text: I don't really understand... Nor do I think it's something worth celebrating.

speaker: Luke
text: Aw, don't worry about it! Kris the Ordinary!

speaker: Marth
text: Jagen, where are we? Macedon? Or Dolhr?

speaker: Jagen
text: Both--we are precisely on the border. I hear this place is home to Macedon's great wyverns. But since the area is overrun with barbarians, even the Macedonian soldiers dare not set foot in here.

speaker: Marth
text: I see. You learn something new every day...

speaker: Kris
text: According to our scouts, a large number of wyverns and barbarians have gathered nearby. It's like Anri's Way... No, it's worse. Sire, please be careful.

speaker: Marth
text: Got it. Let's go, Kris. I need to know what's happened to my sister and the others... I have a dreadful feeling about this.

speaker: Ymir
text: There you are, Marth!

speaker: Marth
text: You're...!

speaker: Kris
text: Who are you?! A barbarian of this dale? Please stand back, sire.

speaker: Marth
text: It's alright, Kris. This is Ymir, another ally from the last war. When I met him, he was holding off an entire army to protect some villagers. He's a kind and brave man.

speaker: Ymir
text: Yeah, the name's Ymir. I heard Marth was fightin' here and figured I'd come along too.

speaker: Kris
text: I-I see... How rude of me, Sir Ymir. Please forgive my insolence.

speaker: Ymir
text: Oh, it's okay. My face is a bit on the scary side, I gotta admit. What's your name?

speaker: Kris
text: Ah, yes. I am the Altean Royal Guard, Kris.

speaker: Ymir
text: Kris! What a name! It's a real pleasure to meet you.

speaker: Kris
text: Likewise.

speaker: Young Man
text: On the other side of the mountains is a small hill, called the Dragon's Table. Recently, there have been eerie roaring sounds coming from there. Grandfather and the others are afraid a demon is about to awaken. You mustn't get to close to that place.

speaker: Man
text: This is the Wyvern's Dale. Don't go any further. Otherwise I fear you'll be burnt to death by the wyverns.

speaker: Marth
text: Prince Michalis!? What are you doing here? And you've suffered a grave wound. What happened?

speaker: Michalis
text: ...Marth... ...I have been waiting... for you...

speaker: Marth
text: Huh!?

speaker: Michalis
text: ...Take this...

speaker: Marth
text: ...! This is the Starlight tome. You're giving it to me!?

speaker: Michalis
text: That's right... Gharnef... Only with this spell can he be harmed. I managed to take it back from his possession...

speaker: Marth
text: Gharnef!? Where is he now?

speaker: Michalis
text: The Dragon's Table... Ha... I was careless... I could be... Defeated by Gharnef... Marth... Good luck... I'm already finished. If Minerva is still around... Tell her to... In my place... Rescue Maria...

speaker: Marth
text: Michalis!

speaker: Michalis
text: Your highness... I leave Maria's fate to you... Urgh.

speaker: Minerva
text: ............ Brother...? Could it be... Is it really you...?

speaker: Michalis
text: ...Minerva...?

speaker: Minerva
text: Ah! You're wounded! I'll go get help!

speaker: Michalis
text: Don't bother... This wound is beyond help. I'd rather you call for... Prince Marth. I have... something I must pass on to him.

speaker: Minerva
text: The prince will be here soon. Hold on, Brother! I'll tend to your wound...

speaker: Michalis
text: Heh... To think I'd need your help in the end... Guh... ngh...!

speaker: Minerva
text: Brother!

speaker: Michalis
text: Minerva... I have something to ask of you. Should I die... Give this tome to Prince Marth. This is as far as I can go... I leave the rest... to you...

speaker: Minerva
text: B--Brother... Michalis...! No... This isn't like you! When did you become so weak!? The brother I knew was strong and noble... He always found his own way, never relying on anyone else... Do you hear me? I won't accept this! You're going to pass this on yourself, without the help of your younger sister.

speaker: Michalis
text: Hmph... Am I being scolded now...?

speaker: Minerva
text: Brother, listen to me... You cannot die here. You have to live...!

speaker: Marth
text: So this is the Dragon's Altar. The place where divine dragon Naga banished the earth dragons...

speaker: Gotoh
text: Indeed. Medeus, the altar's guardian, could not tolerate the human race's atrocities against the Manaketes. Thus, he gathered the surviving dragonkin, forming the Dolhrian Empire. All to obliterate mankind. He was vanquished by Anri once and then defeated a second time by you. However earth dragons boast tremendous life force, and cannot be completely eliminated so easily... Even now, they sleep at this altar.

speaker: Marth
text: You mean to say they'll awaken?!

speaker: Gotoh
text: Not exactly. Even sleeping earth dragons should not awaken for centuries or so. The next time Medeus awakens though, he will rise as a terrifying Shadow Dragon... No, wait...! Perhaps...? Yes, I see... So that's why Gharnef...

speaker: Marth
text: What's the matter, Lord Gotoh?

speaker: Gotoh
text: Prince Marth. I have finally realized the reason why Gharnef kidnapped the clerics. He intends to use them to resurrect Medeus. To hasten the awakening of a dragon requires the life force of pure, maiden women. Knowing this, Gharnef kidnapped them.

speaker: Marth
text: So that means Elice and the others are in this very altar?

speaker: Gotoh
text: Indubitably... Marth, you must hurry. They are in grave danger! Medeus's awakening... is only a matter of time!!

speaker: Kris
text: Sir Ymir, please forgive me for earlier.

speaker: Ymir
text: It's fine. I don't mind at all. It's rare to see someone like me anyway. But it's so warm dressin' like this. Why doesn't anybody else do this? I don't get it.

speaker: Kris
text: Oh, is it warm?

speaker: Ymir
text: Yeah, it's great during winter. Hey! Why don't you try wearin' this for a change? It's a hat made from animal hide. Just wear it! You're gonna see how amazin' it is right away.

speaker: Kris
text: This is... Wow, it is a pretty great hat.

speaker: Ymir
text: See, it fits you well. Do you want to wear it for a bit?

speaker: Kris
text: Yes, I'd love to.

speaker: Ymir
text: Whoa! I'm so stoked you said that! It'll look great on you! No doubt about it.

speaker: Kris
text: Oh no, I don't think it suits me.

speaker: Ymir
text: That so...? Too bad. But, oh well.

speaker: Kris
text: I'm sorry. After you went to all that trouble too...

speaker: Ymir
text: It's fine, it's fine. I don't mind at all.

speaker: Minerva
text: Brother...... Brother... why...? Why here...? I--I never wanted to fight you...! I just wanted things to be like they used to... With you and Maria... Brother...... Michalis... Bro...ther......!

speaker: Michalis
text: ...Your tears... How long has it been since I saw them last...?

speaker: Minerva
text: What...? M-Michalis?! Are you...?

speaker: Michalis
text: I don't plan on dying in front of you, Minerva. I'd be an endless laughing stock. The Michalis you knew... would never die in a place like this. Am I right?

speaker: Minerva
text: Brother...! Oh, Brother!

speaker: Michalis
text: Hmph, don't get the wrong idea. You and I are still enemies... That will not change. The incompetence of your army sickens me, so you leave me with no choice but to help.

speaker: Minerva
text: Thank goodness... You've finally returned to your old self. I understand. Until the Shadow Dragon breathes his last, let us borrow your strength.

speaker: Katarina
text: Kris, Prince Marth, this is it. Please watch your footing.

speaker: Kris
text: It's pitch black. Visiblity's practically non-existent... We'll be in trouble if we have to fight.

speaker: Katarina
text: The organization's children were raised in darkness... They have no heart or will of their own. They only move their limbs when ordered, like puppets...

speaker: Kris
text: Katarina...

speaker: Katarina
text: I'm... not like them anymore. Kris... I want to be of use to you. That feeling is mine and mine alone. Not just some order! But my own truest desire... My treasure. Let's go, Kris.

speaker: Kris
text: Sire, this is it. Please watch your footing.

speaker: Marth
text: It's pitch black. Did Katarina and the others really live here...?

speaker: Kris
text: ... It'll be difficult to battle in this darkness... Sire, please exercize caution.

speaker: Eremiya
text: The Altean army is here? Gosh, that junk puppet betrayed me... Who would have expected that she'd wrestle free from my control. But, I bet you didn't know this: There are many puppets here far superior to you, my dear. Come, my sweet little children. The bad men have come. Darkness is our friend. What our enemies cannot see, we can. Let them experience... the feeling of pure terror.

speaker: Eremiya
text: The Altean army is here? Oh, how wonderful. Come, my sweet little children. The bad men have come. Darkness is our friend. What our enemies cannot see, we can. Let them experience... the feeling of pure terror.

speaker: Eremiya
text: My children... were just trash in the end. They couldn't even dispose of this rabble.... It seems I have no choice but to show them how it's properly done.

speaker: Eremiya
text: My... children...

speaker: Katarina
text: Lady Eremiya...

speaker: Eremiya
text: Oh my, if it isn't the broken puppet. I wonder... should I call you ungrateful trash or traitorous trash? But I must say, it's very brave of you to show your face in front of me again, Eine.

speaker: Katarina
text: Meeting you again... crushes my heart. I'd rather die, frankly... But, if I can be of use to Kris, then I will not run away!

speaker: Eremiya
text: A junk puppet talking like a human being? The only word you're ever allowed to say is "yes". I'll make sure that mouth of yours starts working properly right away.

speaker: Kris
text: Sire, we've seized control of the area. The assassins shall target you no longer.

speaker: Marth
text: I see, thank you.

speaker: Jagen
text: According to the villagers nearby... That woman called Eremiya used to be a kind bishop who looked after war orphans. But during the war, her orphanage was burned down and all the children killed... Ever since then... she changed.

speaker: Marth
text: So she was yet another victim of the war? That does not erase her sins, but... 'tis truly a tragedy.

speaker: Kris
text: However, at the very least there won't be more victims like Katarina.

speaker: Marth
text: Indeed. That's my only comfort. Let us go, Kris! There are still things we must do.

speaker: Kris
text: Yes, sire.

speaker: Gharnef
text: ...Bah! ...So you failed in the end... ...Eremiya.

speaker: Eremiya
text: Master... Gharnef... Forgive... me... For not... fulfilling your order...

speaker: Gharnef
text: Oh, you don't need to apologize. The ritual to revive the Shadow Dragon shall soon begin. You and your underlings were useful enough, for capturing the clerics. Heh heh, it was worth the trouble casting that spell on you...

speaker: Eremiya
text: What? A spell... on me...?

speaker: Gharnef
text: Yes, don't you remember? But of course. Poor, poor Eremiya. My spell stole that memory as well. Once upon a time, you felt grief. The corpses of the orphans killed in the war haunted your very existence. You wondered what you could have done so that they might have survived...

speaker: Eremiya
text: I... never wanted... to let those children die...

speaker: Gharnef
text: And then, I told you. You had to make the children stronger. Twisted, yes, but they became stronger so they wouldn't die, just as you wanted. Well? Have you remembered now?

speaker: Eremiya
text: That's right, I... I made those children...

speaker: Gharnef
text: Heh heh... Hypocrites like you and Marth disgust me. Despairing over the orphans' deaths, you fell all too easily under my spell. And then you gathered children, subjecting them to hellish training, just as I told you to. You watched the children cry and scream... and yet, you smiled... Heh heh, 'twas quite a sight.

speaker: Eremiya
text: Ah... Ahh... ...Aaaaah... ...My... ...My... children... AAAAAAH!

speaker: Gharnef
text: Heh heh... Worry not, Eremiya. The despair you feel now is nothing. This world will soon be enveloped in the darkest despair... You had better look forward to it, Marth. Heh heh heh...

speaker: Jagen
text: Kris, you should be aware that Lang is a general with high defense. To defeat him, you would do well to attack with magic or a special weapon like an armorslayer.

speaker: Kris
text: Duly noted.

speaker: Jagen
text: If you plan to defeat him with strength alone, you'd have to be extremely powerful.

speaker: Jagen
text: Kris, your strength is simply tremendous. Against a blow from you, Lang's armor would crumple like paper. Please, in my stead, kill that insolent man.

speaker: Kris
text: Yes sir!

speaker: Jagen
text: Kris, your strength is quite impressive. You might just be able to defeat Lang. Please, in my stead, kill that insolent man.

speaker: Jagen
text: Kris, you are, sadly, not very strong. But you could fight using your other talents. Please, in my stead, kill that insolent man.

speaker: Lang
text: Heh heh heh... So the Alteans have come. Reinforcements are arriving soon; if we can hold out a little longer, we can make a pincer attack. Swordsman Navarre. When they open that door, you make your move. There is no need for restraint; slice them to pieces!

speaker: Navarre
text: Yeah... sure. Though the knights of Altea are hardly worthy enemies.

speaker: Lang
text: Oh-ho! That's my Navarre. They say not even Ogma of Talys is your equal.

speaker: Navarre
text: What? Ogma?! N... Naturally... A guy like him is no match for me.

speaker: Lang
text: I see. Glad to hear it. Then I'll leave this place in your capable hands, Navarre!

speaker: Jagen
text: Sire, there seems to be movement near the front of the castle. And it would appear to be moving towards our forces.

speaker: Marth
text: Are they enemy reinforcements? Or allies to our cause...?

speaker: Jagen
text: I do not know, but... I do hope they are allies.

speaker: Frey
text: Sire!

speaker: Marth
text: Frey! Thank goodness you're safe.

speaker: Frey
text: You too, sire. Norne and I escaped from Altea Castle and we rode here as fast as we could.

speaker: Norne
text: But the rest of our forces were scattered... I'm sorry we couldn't all make it.

speaker: Marth
text: You don't have to apologize, I'm just glad that you're safe. The others can take care of themselves.

speaker: Frey
text: Sire. From here on we shall accompany you. Please give us your orders.

speaker: Norne
text: Oh, and please be careful! I caught a glimpse of enemy troops approachin' the castle behind us. I expect they'll be enterin' the castle soon.

speaker: Marth
text: Enemy reinforcements? I understand. Thank you.

speaker: Caeda
text: Navarre, please hear me out! Lend your sword to our case, just once more!

speaker: Navarre
text: What? Who are you? I'll have no business with women or children... But, there's a first for everything... (Whoa, she's smoking!) What business do you have with me?

speaker: Caeda
text: ...... Y-you're not Navarre! Who are you?

speaker: Samuel
text: Yikes, I've been exposed, huh? I'm actually a stingy mercenary known as Samuel. Somehow, I keep getting mistaken for this famous "Navarre" swordsman guy. I got tired of it after a while, so I decided to pose as him and got myself hired. But I don't like this General Lang guy either. If you're alright with it, I'll lend you my sword.

speaker: Caeda
text: Yes... You'll do just fine...

speaker: Ogma
text: Navarre... You bastard...

speaker: Navarre
text: Stay away... This evening, my killing edge hungers for blood...

speaker: Ogma
text: Do you mean to kill me, no matter what? Hmph, very well. I knew that we'd have to settle our score eventually.

speaker: Samuel
text: Wait... Stay your blade! ...I'm no Navarre, I'm just a sham. I... it's me, Samuel. Have you forgotten, Ogma?

speaker: Ogma
text: Samuel?! Samuel, the gladiator from Knorda?

speaker: Samuel
text: Yes, I was a slave gladiator at the time, and you really helped me out. Even when everyone was making their escape, you stayed behind to distract the guards and ended up caught...

speaker: Samuel
text: I heard everything from my friends. How you were dragged out to the square and whipped until you looked like a corpse. How, by chance, the young Princess Talys, tears in her eyes, stood up for you and saved you. And that's why you swore your blade to Talys. Or rather... to the princess...

speaker: Ogma
text: Enough... Say no more! No more. It's in the past now... No more...

speaker: Samuel
text: ...Ogma... Anyway, I want to repay you! I'm following you from now on, okay?

speaker: Navarre
text: I pity your soul. But I can at least grant you a quick death. Take this! My killing edge!!

speaker: Samuel
text: Doh, I shouldn't have said that I was Navarre...

speaker: Lang
text: W-wait, please! I'm sorry... Please forgive me... I've only done as the Emperor ordered me to. I didn't agree with him, but I had no choice. So... so please, s-spare my life... I'll do anything you say. Yes... Just like this... Mwahaha! You shouldn't have let your guard down! You fool... Now die!

speaker: Lang
text: Urgh... Impossible... I have been defeated...

speaker: Marth
text: General Lang, I have--with my own eyes--witnessed a number of your crimes. I cannot forgive you. But if you have something to say, I will listen.

speaker: Lang
text: S-silence... silence! You damned country-boy prince! You're a fool for coming here! Just die already!

speaker: Marth
text: Is that your answer? Then prepare yourself!

speaker: Lang
text: Y-you! You're that impertinent little girl/boy from before...!

speaker: Kris
text: Lang! You have oppressed countless people, and insulted my liege. You can only atone for these sins with your life!

speaker: Lang
text: W... Why you!

speaker: Marth
text: Lord Wendell! Thank goodness you're unharmed.

speaker: Wendell
text: Lang accused me of collaborating with the rebels and had me imprisoned. Even though I told him that I must fulfill a mission assigned to me by Archsage Gotoh...

speaker: Marth
text: A mission from Lord Gotoh?

speaker: Wendell
text: That's correct... You have seen the "Starsphere"--the holy orb with the twelve constellations etched on its surface. In order to pierce Gharnef's shadowy veil, Lord Gotoh created a sacred spell named "Starlight" from that orb.

speaker: Wendell
text: Unfortunately, the strain on the Starsphere was so severe that it shattered into twelve shards, which scattered into the sky. Lord Gotoh told me that this world has long been guarded by five orbs of mysterious arcane power, and that if even one of them is lost, the world will fall into irreparable ruin. By any means possible, we must gather the twelve star shards and restore the Starsphere.

speaker: Marth
text: Is... Is this a joke? That the world could just end... This is all very hard to take in. But aren't these the star shards? If so, we already have a few. After we retake Altea, we'd be glad to help you find the remaining shards and orbs.

speaker: Wendell
text: Of course... Your country was only just invaded by the Empire... I understand, Prince... I too shall fight to restore Altea, then. Thinking about it, my meeting with you is like a sign from Lord Gotoh himself. In that case, I shall surrender myself to fate. But, please, let's stop by the Fane of Raman. We may be able to find some star shards in the ancient temple.

speaker: Marth
text: Understood. If it's the Fane of Raman, we can go there on our way to Altea!

speaker: Marth
text: General Lang has been defeated. And now the people of Grust no longer have to suffer.

speaker: Kris
text: That's right, sire.

speaker: Marth
text: Kris, since leaving Altea, we've had a great deal of fights... Looking back at them now...

speaker: Marth
text: None of our companions were hurt and none of them died. That's what I'm happiest about. Kris, it's because you've been here. Thank you so much.

speaker: Marth
text: It couldn't be helped, but... Some of our comrades were injured or passed on. I don't want to lose anyone from now. I know we can do it if you're there. Kris, please, help me.

speaker: Marth
text: All I remember is seeing our companions fall, one by one... Enough! I don't want any of our comrades to suffer that pain. Kris, please, help me.

speaker: Jagen
text: Sire, some new information has come in from the patrol. Just ahead, the enemy seems to be preparing some kind of ambush. It's not the Archanean Empire, but likely, I fear, mercenaries hired with coin.

speaker: Marth
text: Mercenaries, is it...? Do we continue as we are or take a longer, safer route? Personally, I'd rather not detour. We have to return to Altea as soon as possible.

speaker: Jagen
text: Hmph, if you would allow me to speak as your tactician... I think we ought to stay here and fight. We will be facing mercenaries. The Altean knights would never lose to mere mercenaries.

speaker: Marth
text: Kris, your thoughts?

speaker: Kris
text: I agree with Sir Jagen.

speaker: Marth
text: I see, thank you. Jagen, Kris! The whole army shall move on as they were. We'll hit the mercenaries head-on!

speaker: Anna
text: Welcome! Today, another hero will be born. One who will help decide the world's fate... What's your name, hero?

speaker: Anna
text: Are you a boy, or a girl?

speaker: Anna
text: What's your occupation?

speaker: Anna
text: And what do you look like?

speaker: Anna
text: I shall now predict your journey using your past, present, and future. Beginning with your past, what sort of circumstances were you born into?

speaker: Anna
text: And what about you now? What is your most impressive attribute?

speaker: Anna
text: Finally, your future. What kind of future trait do you strive to attain?

speaker: Anna
text: With everything now complete, let us begin your story posthaste...

speaker: Katarina
text: Eek!

speaker: Kris
text: Hey, are you okay?

speaker: Katarina
text: I-I'm sorry. I was in a hurry, and... Excuse me, did you come here to become an Altean knight as well?

speaker: Kris
text: Yeah. I came here all the way from Sera village when I heard they were recruiting new knights. My name's Kris.

speaker: Katarina
text: Kris? That's a nice name. We're here for the same reason then. My name is Katarina. I came because I wish to serve Prince Marth. But there sure are a lot of hopefuls here. Look, there's one over there and another there...

speaker: Luke
text: Here it is! This is where my shining legacy starts! The first chapter of my epic saga to become Altea's greatest knight!

speaker: Roderick
text: ...Luke, I'm going up ahead.

speaker: Luke
text: Hey, wait up, Roderick! Don't leave your partner behind!

speaker: Kris
text: There's no doubt those two were knight candidates like us.

speaker: Katarina
text: We should follow them, Kris. I think the leader of the knights, Sir Jagen, has something to say to all of us.

speaker: Jagen
text: Altea's gates have opened today so that we may test you as potential knights. Knights will be chosen by their ability, not by their blood. The path is not easy, however. We have gathered a hundred men and women today, and only a handful of you will succeed.

speaker: Katarina
text: T-this is nerve-wracking.

speaker: Kris
text: I'm nervous too, but I've been training hard for this day.

speaker: Jagen
text: We expect every one of you to show us the results of your arduous training! Apprentices, I want you to gather in pairs! You will be facing real Altean knights in mock combat!

speaker: Katarina
text: Huh?! We have to fight? T-this could be a problem... Kris, would you please partner with me? I'm training to become a tactician.

speaker: Kris
text: A tactician?

speaker: Katarina
text: Y-yes. I can give you advice on how to fight, but I can't fight at all...

speaker: Soldier
text: Hey, you two! You're up next. Grab your weapons and get into position. Hurry!

speaker: Kris
text: Got it! Let's go, Katarina! The test is about to start.

speaker: Katarina
text: Y-yes! Let's do our best.

speaker: Katarina
text: Kris! Let's move to that spot over there.

speaker: Soldier
text: So you made it to the right place. I'll be your first opponent. Attack me whenever you like!

speaker: Jagen
text: ...I'm your final opponent for the day. Don't hold back!

speaker: Jagen
text: Excellent. Show me what you've got!

speaker: Jagen
text: Urgh... I've been beaten?

speaker: Kris
text: Phew... we won, somehow.

speaker: Jagen
text: Yes... splendid work! I see we can expect much from this year's apprentices.

speaker: Katarina
text: You did it! We won, Kris! ...But I didn't really do anything... It was all thanks to you that we won, Kris!

speaker: Jagen
text: Prince Marth wishes to address everyone who passed the test. Sire, if you please.

speaker: Marth
text: I humbly thank you all for coming.

speaker: Katarina
text: Ah, it's Prince Marth! He looks so majestic. So that's the face of the hero who saved the world. I love the stories about Prince Marth in the last war. How about you, Kris?

speaker: Kris
text: Of course. After all, Prince Marth was the hero who brought an end to the previous war.

speaker: Katarina
text: Yes, he defeated the Shadow Dragon and Dark Pontifex, restoring peace to the world.

speaker: Jagen
text: You there, silence! You stand before Prince Marth!

speaker: Katarina
text: Eep!

speaker: Marth
text: Everyone. I'm truly happy that so many came to help shoulder Altea's future. With the war over, peace has returned. However, peace isn't something we can simply take for granted: It is my duty, as ruler, to risk my life to protect it. Alone, I am powerless. So, everyone. From now on, I want you to lend me your power, as my knights.

speaker: Katarina
text: Hear hear, Prince Marth! It was wonderful hearing Prince Marth speak, wasn't it, Kris?

speaker: Kris
text: Yes, it was. We have to do our best so he can rely on us.

speaker: Katarina
text: Let's keep at it together!

speaker: Marth
text: Kris, we'll be arriving shortly. This is your first real battle, is it not? Battles will be different from here on out. Defeat on the battlefield means death. Any allies you lose will never return... That is the harsh reality of war. You must take the utmost care not to get yourself killed.

speaker: Kris
text: Of course, sire.

speaker: Marth
text: You, and everyone else... It would be wonderful if we could end this battle without losing anyone...

speaker: Kris
text: Sire...

speaker: Jagen
text: Sire, we have made arrangements for a transport convoy. We will also have merchants accompanying us, who will sell us weapons and items. I daresay they will be invaluable during battle preparations.

speaker: Marth
text: Thank you, Jagen. Then let's begin our preparations at once.

speaker: Jagen
text: Sire, this is General Lang, the commanding officer of the occupational forces.

speaker: Lang
text: Oho, so you are Prince Marth? Glad you could make it here. Since you've come all this way, I suppose I'll let you have the glory of capturing the rebel leader, General Lorenz.

speaker: Marth
text: What?! General Lorenz leads the rebels?! What would possess him to rebel of all things?!

speaker: Lang
text: Who knows? I haven't the foggiest idea, and frankly I don't care. Prince. You are to kill General Lorenz, and reclaim the children of the Grustian royal family that he's hiding. While you do that... We will slaughter the families of those who participated in this rebellion and raze their homes to the ground.

speaker: Marth
text: Are you insane?! They're innocent civilians!

speaker: Lang
text: I-insane!? Young man, are you questioning my orders?! Perhaps Altea, too, plans to rebel against Archanea...?

speaker: Marth
text: Of course not! That's not...

speaker: Lang
text: Prince Marth, your tiny country means absolutely nothing to me. Your rude behaviour is merely an irritation. Do not forget that I have the power of the empire behind me: I can crush weak, pesky insects like you any time I wish.

speaker: Marth
text: Jagen... What in the world is going on here? How could Hardin have entrusted this country to such a vile man?

speaker: Jagen
text: Sire, I understand how you feel. However, Lorenz has begun a rebellion. That much seems to be true, so we ought to do something about that first. Sire, why don't you try speaking to General Lorenz personally? Allow me to stay by your side and serve as your tactician. Royal Guard Kris! When Prince Marth is in danger on the battlefield, protect him at all costs. That is an order!

speaker: Kris
text: Acknowledged.

speaker: Marth
text: Kris, I have no need to worry if you're here. Let's clean up the bandits, and head to General Lorenz's position!

speaker: Kris
text: Yes sir!

speaker: Villager
text: After the last war, Princess Nyna let this country keep its sovereignty under the rule of General Lorenz. However, as soon as Hardin became emperor, General Lorenz was banished and Lang's troops came crawling in. Lang stole everything from us. He stole our gold, of course, but he even stole our food and our loved ones... Ah... If only General Camus were here! Then we wouldn't have to live in fear of people like Lang!

speaker: Villager
text: There aren't any young girls left in this country. They were all taken away by the imperial troops. They say General Lang keeps the really pretty ones to himself. What a dark, insane chapter in Grust's history...

speaker: Villager
text: The late King Grust had two children. Princess Yuliya and Prince Jubelo. They're still young. Maybe thirteen, or fourteen; cute little twins, both of them. In the last war, Gharnef, the Dark Pontifex, kidnapped the twins to blackmail the king. They were taken to Khadein, the city of magic, and locked away in a pitch-black room. At great personal risk, Pontifex Wendell saved them. He took them to a monastery to protect them.

speaker: Villager
text: General Lorenz took the royal children from Lord Wendell and raised them in Grust. The empire demanded their extradition, but Lorenz was afraid they would be killed, and hid them. The empire branded Lorenz a traitor, and sent General Lang here. Lang did horrible things to find the royal children. That's why we rose up. But, we lost. And now Lang is going to kill everyone in this entire country!

speaker: Villager
text: I heard that General Lorenz lived in Talys when he was young. Talys wasn't unified at the time, so there were a number of noble houses contending for control. Lorenz lent his power to the young patriarch of one house, and together they unified Talys into one country. Lorenz and that patriarch--now the king of Talys--remain close friends to this day.

speaker: Villager
text: I only saw him briefly, but that knight, Arran, looked awfully pale. You know, he's probably hit the wall, so to speak. I doubt he'll get any stronger, no matter how much he fights...

speaker: Villager
text: Oh... Please, show mercy to just this child. She's only ten years old.

speaker: Marth
text: Ma'am, please calm yourself. I am not here to take any children.

speaker: Villager
text: What... You're not imperial soldiers?

speaker: Marth
text: No... We're not. We didn't come to fight. If there's anything you need, please ask. It's not much, but we can give you food.

speaker: Marisha
text: Wait... Please, take me with you...

speaker: Marth
text: Huh...? You're... Are you really ten?

speaker: Marisha
text: No... I'm a grown woman, but Granny lied so that I wouldn't be taken away by the soldiers. Lang's soldiers are all monstrous. But you're different. You have very sweet eyes. Please, take me with you. I want you to take me away from this country, and take me to yours.

speaker: Villager
text: It's not safe for her to stay here. Please take her with you, and protect her. You can marry her, too, if you like. Marisha is a beautiful, good-natured lady, just like me! I'm sure she'll make a fine wife.

speaker: Marisha
text: No-no-no! Granny, it's far too early for that! Now you've made Marisha all flustered!

speaker: Bandit
text: Oh? A battle, is it? We're in luck, boys! Let's loot 'em villages before 'ey realize what's hit 'em!

speaker: Lorenz
text: Alright, that will do for now... Sir Ogma, please forgive me for getting you involved in this mess.

speaker: Ogma
text: I am here on King Talys's orders. As such, I will do everything in my power to help.

speaker: Lorenz
text: I see... Then I have a favor to ask of you. I want you to escort these children to Macedon. These children... Prince Jubelo and Princess Yuliya, are King Grust's orphans. Please. Take them safely to Lord Wendell in Macedon.

speaker: Ogma
text: Understood... I will guard these two with my life.

speaker: Lorenz
text: Thank you, Sir Ogma... Now, Prince Jubelo, Princess Yuliya, you will be leaving with Sir Ogma.

speaker: Yuliya
text: No! I'm not going! I won't leave you behind!

speaker: Lorenz
text: Princess... I cannot go. With this wound, I can barely even walk. It saddens me, but you two must go on without me.

speaker: Yuliya
text: You took that grievous wound to protect us... How can you tell us to just leave you behind now?! I will never leave. We will never leave your side, Lorenz!!

speaker: Ogma
text: What shall I do, General?

speaker: Lorenz
text: Hmm... this is most troublesome. Princess Yuliya is not one to change her mind easily... We will remain here.

speaker: Ogma
text: In that case, I will find some other way to help you. I will find Lang and bring him down... I will bury him with this sword, I swear on it. General Lorenz, you must hold out until then...!

speaker: Lorenz
text: Prince Marth! So it is you... How unfortunate, that I must fight... the Altean army and its prince...

speaker: Marth
text: Please, wait. I do not wish to fight with you. I heard about everything from the villagers. I've heard of all the atrocities Archanea has committed. I promise, I will inform Emperor Hardin of the truth and rescue Grust. So please, lower your weapons.

speaker: Lorenz
text: Prince... I am grateful for the offer. But, I am afraid that I cannot comply. Prince, you know nothing. Do you think that a man of Emperor Hardin's caliber would make a general out of a man as worthless as Lang without good reason? He called for an invasion: to crush the kingdom of Grust and make it a territory of the Empire.

speaker: Marth
text: No, it can't be! Hardin would never do something like that.

speaker: Lorenz
text: I know it's hard to believe. But I'm afraid that, ever since he became emperor, he has changed a great deal. He is no longer the Hardin you once knew. Prince, I have one final request of you. In this stronghold, I am protecting the young prince and princess of Grust. Please, find a way to help them. If you can do just that, I will have no regrets.

speaker: Marth
text: What... General Lorenz, what are you saying...?!

speaker: Lorenz
text: Prince Marth... My life in exchange for theirs... By any means necessary, please help them... This is the last thing I will ask.

speaker: Marth
text: General Lorenz!! ......This can't be happening......

speaker: Lorenz
text: What?! You're... the Altean army?! So even Altea has turned on us...

speaker: Lorenz
text: Forgive me, people of Grust...

speaker: Elder
text: Prince Marth... General Lorenz entrusted everything to you. You spared his life, and even heard him out. We, the people of Grust, thank you. Please, let me offer you a token of our gratitude. Here. We're protecting Prince Jubelo and Princess Yuliya in this stronghold. I beg you, do what you must to protect our last fragments of hope...

speaker: Marth
text: You, you're... Grust's royal heirs... Prince Jubelo and Princess Yuliya?!

speaker: Jubelo
text: Sniff... Lorenz... He's gone... How can we live on without him?

speaker: Yuliya
text: You monsters!! Stay away! You're going to murder us just like you murdered Lorenz!!

speaker: Marth
text: No, you have it all wrong!! We just...

speaker: Lang
text: Ah... Prince Marth. You finally caught these filthy traitors.

speaker: Marth
text: General Lang! Wait, please! These children have done nothing wrong. Allow me to take custody of them.

speaker: Lang
text: Don't make me laugh. These brats are coming with me to my castle. Besides, my dear prince, you have other, more important, priorities. I have received reports that there has been a military revolt in Macedon, and Princess Minerva has been imprisoned.

speaker: Marth
text: What...?! How could that happen to Macedon?! I understand my obligations, General Lang. Still, these children... Let them stay with me, please.

speaker: Lang
text: Prince, do not try my patience! Listen up you two! You're coming with me!

speaker: Yuliya
text: No, let me go!! Jubelo... help me!!

speaker: Jubelo
text: Yuliya... Yuliya...!!

speaker: Marth
text: Wait!! Lang! Release them at once!

speaker: Kris
text: Sire! Give me the order, and I'll get them safely back at once!

speaker: Jagen
text: Sire, don't do it!! You too, Kris! If we oppose Lang right here, right now, we run the risk of being branded traitors by Archanea.

speaker: Marth
text: But Jagen, are you telling me to simply allow Lang to take them?! I cannot stand for that...

speaker: Jagen
text: I understand how you feel, sire... But please remain patient for a little longer. If we head to Macedon... then rescue Princess Minerva, Macedon will surely lend us its strength.

speaker: Marth
text: Kris, if we can get through this pass we will be on Archanea's doorstep. Just hang in there a little longer.

speaker: Kris
text: Yes, sire.

speaker: Marth
text: Despite all the odds, we've surpassed Anri's Way and taken back Altea... The battles we've faced up to now... have been nothing short of difficult. And in those battles...

speaker: Marth
text: We've managed to keep everyone alive. With the strength of all our comrades, we can accomplish something worthy of Anri... I'm so proud of everyone.

speaker: Kris
text: Sire......

speaker: Marth
text: It's thanks to our friends that our country is free; I cannot help but think of the fallen. I want to become stronger for them. From now on, let's live so that no one falls again...

speaker: Kris
text: Sire......

speaker: Marth
text: ...The feeling of pain overwhelms me. When I think of the severely wounded, and the many who have fallen... Perhaps if I had been stronger like Anri, then everyone would still be alive... From now... From now on, I will definitely...

speaker: Kris
text: Sire......

speaker: Roshea
text: Wolf, Sedgar, Vyland. Is this really okay...? Can we really fight this battle?

speaker: Wolf
text: Roshea! What are you trying to say? Look, the Altean army is marching long the narrow mountain road. Now's our only chance to defeat them.

speaker: Vyland
text: Yes, Roshea. We swore that we could sacrifice our lives for Lord Hardin. Lord Hardin was the one who freed us plains people from slavery. If we don't fight Altea now, Millennium Court will fall. Do you want Lord Hardin to be defeated by them?

speaker: Sedgar
text: That's right! Prince Marth wants to destroy Archanea, and conquer the world. And that's why he joined forces with Macedon to crust Grust. Now he even has Gra under his rule. If we don't do something, the whole world will fall under his control.
